Scheme For Financial Assistance For Vete.details:
The “Scheme for Financial Assistance for Veteran Artists”, earlier known as “Scheme for Pension and Medical Aid to Artists” was launched by the Ministry of Culture. The Scheme is meant for improving the financial and socio-economic status of the old artists and scholars who have contributed significantly in their specialized fields of arts, letters, etc. in their active age or are still contributing in the field of arts, letters, etc. but due to old age, they have to lead a miserable life or are in penury condition.
Under the scheme, financial assistance from the Government may be given in the form of a monthly allowance. Such allowance given to the artists recommended under the center-state Quota will be shared by the Centre and State Government/UT Administration concerned.
**The following two types of cases/requests will be covered under the Scheme:**

   1. Existing beneficiaries getting monthly artistes pension under the 1961 Scheme of ‘Financial Assistance to Persons Distinguished in Letters, Arts and such other walks of life who may be in indigent circumstances’ as amended from time to time; and
   1. Fresh cases of artists, writers, etc. who are eligible for a grant/monthly financial assistance under the extant guidelines of the Scheme.

**Administration of the Scheme:**
The Scheme will be implemented by the Ministry with the support of all Zonal Cultural Centres and SCZCC, Nagpur will be the main coordinator. The Ministry reserves the right to modify the provisions of the Scheme at any time. In order to implement the Scheme in a better perspective, the Scheme Guidelines will be circulated widely through State Governments/UT Administrations along with sharing the data of beneficiaries of the Central Government with them.
Scheme For Financial Assistance For Vete.benefits:
1. Under the scheme, a total allowance of ₹6000/- per month will be given to an eligible beneficiary.
   1. In case of the death of a beneficiary getting an artist pension, the financial assistance may be transferred, at the discretion of the Central Government, in the name of the spouse of the beneficiary till life.

**Note 01:** The monthly allowance contributed by the State Government/UT Administration concerned shall be at least ₹500/- per month per beneficiary.
**Note 02:** The monthly allowance contributed by the Central Government shall not exceed ₹5500/- per month per beneficiary.
**Note 03:** Out of ₹6000/-, the monthly contribution of allowance of the Central Government will be less than the extent of the monthly contribution of allowance being provided to the applicant by the State Government/UT Administration.
**Note 04:** If State Government is already providing ₹1000/- per month pension to an artiste recommended to get financial assistance from the Central Government under this Scheme, in that case, the contribution of the Central Government would be only ₹5000/- per month.
**Note 05:** In respect of State Govt./UT Administration where there is no provision for an Artist&#39;s Pension, ₹6000/- per month will be paid as an Artist Pension by the Central Government.
**Note 06:** In case of the death of a beneficiary, a request application should be received in the Ministry of Culture from the spouse along with the relevant documents within the period of one year from the date of death of the beneficiary artist. After the period of one year, the claim for the transfer of pension in the name of the spouse will stand forfeited and no request in this regard shall be entertained.
Scheme For Financial Assistance For Vete.eligibility:
1. To be eligible for assistance under the Scheme, a person&#39;s contribution to art and letters, etc. must be of significance.
   1. Traditional scholars who have made significant contributions in their fields would also be eligible notwithstanding the absence of any published works.
   1. The personal income of the applicant (including the income of the spouse) must not exceed ₹4,000/- per month or an annual income of ₹48,000/-. [This excludes artiste pension assistance amount already getting by a beneficiary from the Government (i.e. concerned State Govt./UT Administration and/or Ministry of Culture)]
   1. The applicant should not be less than 60 (sixty) years of age (This does not apply in the case of a spouse).
   1. The applicant artiste is getting a pension of at least ₹500/- per month from the concerned State Government/UT Administration or is recommended by the Zonal Cultural Centres, Ministry of Culture, for the artists of their Members State where State Pension is not there.
   1. The applicant artists should not be getting financial assistance under other Schemes of the Ministry viz. Repertory Grant etc.

application process.process: Application Procedure: The application may be made online through using the Registration/login Page of " Culture Scheme Monitoring System (CSMS) " on the  website of the Ministry of Culture  under the heading of "MOC Schemes Application". Selection of Applicants for Award of Artists Pension: Step 01:  The applications of eligible artists found to be complete in all respects will be placed before Expert Committee constituted by the Ministry of Culture under the Scheme after getting physical inspection/verification of the applicants done by officer(s) of the Ministry of Culture or one of the organizations of Ministry of Culture. Step 02:  The Expert Committee will consider the applications in terms of extant guidelines of the Scheme and recommend the names of deserving candidates for the award of Artists' Pension solely on merit considering the financial position and eminence etc. of the applicant artist. Step 03:  The recommendations of the Expert Committee are to be examined by the Administration Division with reference to the Scheme guidelines and the rules of the Govt. as also the availability of funds under the Scheme to facilitate an appropriate decision by the Competent Authority. Step 04:  The cases of all the recommended candidates will be submitted finally for getting approval of the Competent Authority which will be one level above the Chairperson of the Expert Committee. Before the release of financial assistance to the approved candidates, the concurrence of the Internal Finance Division shall be obtained. Disbursement of artist's pension: Monthly Artist Pension to the approved existing beneficiaries (i.e. pensioner) and new artists to be included in the beneficiaries list subsequent to the recommendation of the Expert Committee and thereafter approval of the Competent Authority, will be disbursed by the Ministry of Culture through Public Financial Management System (PFMS)/Direct Benefit Transfer(DBT) or through Service Provider (appointed by Ministry of Culture for disbursement of Artists Pension) directly into their bank account subject to receiving the following documents mandatorily online on the email of Artistes Pension Section of the Ministry i.e. documents.moc@gmail.com or artistspension.moc@gmail.com and after examination/scrutiny, the same are found to be in order: Every Year in November, the Digital Life Certificate (DLC) of the beneficiary is processed through the Jeevan Pramaan Portal (https://jeevanpramaan.gov.in) by using necessary information like Aadhaar number, Mobile number, and Pension Payment Order (PPO) displayed by the Ministry on its website [Till the time the Aadhaar Card is made mandatory by the Government for an individual residing in the State of Assam, Meghalaya, and Jammu & Kashmir, they may submit a colored scanned copy of their original Life Certificate]; and Every Five (05) Years, a Coloured scanned copy of the original Income Certificate in the prescribed format is issued by the concerned Competent Authority of the States/UTs. The beneficiaries will have to furnish any other requisite information/document(s) as sought by the Ministry from time to time. In case the requisite documents sought by the Ministry are not received from a beneficiary, the pension will not be released to him/her. Further, if any discrepancy is found in the documents furnished by the beneficiary, the pension may not be released or stopped forthwith till such time the discrepancy is rectified. Renewal of financial assistance to existing beneficiaries: Subject to the above provisions the recurring monthly allowance sanctioned under the Scheme to the existing beneficiaries shall be for such period as may be determined by the Central Government and/or may be continued on a year-to-year basis on receipt of Digital Life Certificate (DLC) and Income Certificate from them. Discontinuance of allowance: If the financial means of a recipient improve beyond ₹4000/- (Rupees four thousand only) per month or annual income of ₹48,000/- (Rupees forty-eight thousand only) [This excludes artiste pension assistance amount already getting by a beneficiary from the Government (i.e. concerned State Govt./UT Administration and/or Ministry of Culture)], allowance under the Scheme will be discontinued forthwith without any notice to the recipient. The government may also at its discretion terminate the allowance after giving three months' notice to the recipient. Any recipient may also relinquish his/her right to receive allowance by giving written notice to the Government. In such cases, the allowance will be discontinued with effect from the date of his/ her letter of relinquish. Contact Details: Section Officer, 210, IInd, ‘D’Block, Puratatva Bhawan, G.P.O. Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang.details: Musical instruments or equipment have been essential items for the students and artistes to carry out their learning or performance. The scheme &quot;Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT): Support for Purchase of Instruments / Equipment&quot; by the Department of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur aims to support many talented students and budding artistes, who are economically well but in need of instruments/equipment for their learning and performance purpose to help them groom towards professionalism. In every academic year, 300 students will be supported through this scheme.
Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang.benefits: Reimbursement towards the purchase of instruments/equipment. In every academic year, 300 students will be supported. The applicant may avail of the benefit of this scheme twice during his studentship with a gap of one year. Note:  The extent of financial assistance will be decided by the Screening Committee.
Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the state of Manipur.
1. The applicant should be a Student at one of the following institutes: Government Dance College, Shree Shree Bal Mukunda Dev Music College, Imphal Art College, Manipur University of Culture, Jawaharlal Nehru Manipur Dance Academy, and Manipur University (Dance, Music, and Fine Art Department).
1. The applicant should be pursuing a course in one of the art forms.
1. The applicant should be below 30 years of age (age to be reckoned on 1st April).
1. The annual income of the parents, as well as the applicant, should be less than ₹ 1,00,000/-.

Award Of Scholarships To Young Artists I.details:
The scheme “Award of Scholarships to Young Artists in Different Cultural Fields” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. This scheme seeks to give assistance to young artists of outstanding promise for advanced training within India in the field of Indian Classical Music, Indian Classical Dance, Theatre, Mime, Visual art, Folk, Traditional and Indigenous Arts, and Light Classical Music.
**Subjects/Fields in which Scholarships can be awarded:**

   1. Indian Classical Music - Classical Hindustani Music (Vocal and Instrumental), Classical Carnatic Music (Vocal &amp; Instrumental, etc.)
   1. Indian Classical Dance/ Dance Music - Bharatnatyam, Kathak, Kuchipudi, Kathakali, Mohiniattam, Odissi Dance/ Music, Manipuri Dance/ Music, Thangta, Gaudiya Nritya, Chhau Dance/ Music, Sattriya dance.
   1. Theatre - Any specialized aspect of theatre art, including acting, direction, etc., but excluding playwriting and research. Mime.
   1. Visual Arts - Graphics, Sculpture, Painting, Creative Photography, Pottery &amp; Ceramics, etc.
   1. Folk, Traditional, and Indigenous Arts - Puppetry, Folk Theatre, Folk dances, Folk Songs, Folk Music, etc.
   1. Light Classical Music - 

     a)	Thumri, Dadra, Tappa, Qawali, Ghazal,
     b)	Light Classical music based on Carnatic Style, etc.
     c)	Rabindra Sangeet, Nazrul Geeti, Atulprasad.
**Terms of Scholarship:**

   1. The nature of training will be determined in each case after taking into consideration the previous training and background of the scholar. Normally, it will be in the nature of advanced training under a Guru/Master or in a recognized institution.
   1. The Scholar will be required to undergo a rigorous training. Such training will include minimum of three hours a day for practice alone apart from the time spent for acquiring knowledge of the theory of the subject/field concerned and also an appreciation of the related disciplines.
Award Of Scholarships To Young Artists I.benefits:
1. Under the scheme, total number of scholarships is 400.
1. Each scholar will be paid ₹5000/- per month for a period of two years to cover his/ her living expenses on travel, books, art material, or other equipment and tuition or training charges, if any.
1. The scholarships are provided in the field of Indian Classical Music, Classical Dances, Light Classical Music, Theatre, Visual Arts, and Folk/ Traditional and Indigenous Arts.
Award Of Scholarships To Young Artists I.eligibility:
1. Candidates should be Indian Nationals.
   1. Candidates should have adequate general education to pursue their training effectively.
   1. Candidates must give evidence of their desire to make the pursuit of their training effectively.
   1. As the scholarships are meant for advanced training and not for beginners, candidates must have already acquired a degree of proficiency in the chosen field.
   1. The candidate should have undergone a minimum of 5 years of training with their Guru/Institutes. The Certificate duly signed by the present Guru / Institute and former Guru/ Institute (if any) should be submitted along with the application.
   1. Candidates should have adequate knowledge of the connected arts/ disciplines.
   1. The candidate&#39;s age should not be less than 18 years and not more than 25 years as of 1st April of the year in which the application is being made. Age relaxation is not permissible.

D. D. Kosambi Research Fellowship Scheme.details:
The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa to encourage Goan Scholars to undertake research in the field of Goan history, culture, arts, social studies etc. Three fellowships shall be awarded, upto one at junior, upto one at senior & upto one at the post-doctoral level each for research in the specified areas every year.
> **Objectives** 1. To encourage the Goan scholars to undertake research in the areas of society, economy, polity, history, art and culture of Goa. Only topics that are closely connected to Goa will be accepted. However authentic topics pertaining to Goa may also be considered for the fellowship depending upon the decision taken by the selection committee constituted for the purpose. 1. To create, promote and develop research activities in the State of Goa. 1. To promote interdisciplinary research programmes in colleges and universities.
D. D. Kosambi Research Fellowship Scheme.benefits:
1. Eligible scholars for the junior category shall be awarded a fellowship up to ₹ 15,000/- per month for a maximum period of 2 years, on a case-to-case basis. 1. Eligible scholars for senior & post-doctoral categories shall be awarded a fellowship of ₹ 20,000/- per month for a maximum period of 2 years, on a case-to-case basis. 1. However, the applicant who undertakes to complete the research work on a full-time basis may be awarded the scholarship upto ₹ 30,000/- per month. In such cases, the research period shall be as decided by the selection committee.
> **Number of Fellowships** A maximum of one fellowship in each category shall be awarded every year.
**NOTE:** The amount of fellowship shall be assessed on the recommendation of the selection committee after the submission of his/her project.
D. D. Kosambi Research Fellowship Scheme.eligibility:
1. Any individual who has completed post-graduation and is upto 35 years of age shall be eligible to undertake research in the junior category.
1. Any individual who has completed post-graduation and is above the age of 35 shall be eligible to undertake research in the senior category. 
1. Any individual who has completed a PhD shall be eligible to undertake research in the post-doctoral category. There shall be no age bar in this category. 
1. The fellowship shall be awarded to any scholar only once in his lifetime under each category.
D. D. Kosambi Research Fellowship Scheme.exclusions: A fellow will not be eligible for any other fellowship offered by the Department in any other category for a period of 10 years from the date of the submission of his/her project. Any grace period/extension will not be considered under the quantum of the fellowship financial assistance.

Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana.details:
The scheme "Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana Puraskar)" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa is designed to honour the young Goan individuals who have excelled in the field of Art and culture in Goa. The scheme intends to give recognition to young artists par excellence for their outstanding achievements and for their extraordinary contribution to the field of Art and culture.
> **Objectives** 1. To honour the young artists for their contribution towards the field of Goan Art and culture. 1. To felicitate the young artists par excellence for their outstanding achievement in the respective field of their art. 1. To recognize, encourage and identify the young artists as Youth Artists of the State.
Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana.benefits: 1. A memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse to the extent of **₹ 25,000/-** per individual.1. Every year a maximum of 6 persons in the fields of Music/Dance, Drama/Tiatr, Folk Art, Photography/Painting, Craft, Sculpture, Bhajan/Kirtan, Literature, and Film shall be considered.
Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an individual artist.
1. The age of the applicant should be between 25 and 40 years. Only in exceptional cases, the minimum & maximum age could be relaxed by upto 5 years.
1. The applicant should have given extraordinary contributions in the field of Art and culture at large in his/ her respective field of art in specific.
1. The applicant should have contributed to his/her respective field of art in Goa for a minimum 5 years out of his/her career as a 
1. practising artist.
1. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during the selection process if the death of any artist occurs after the recommendation of his name then the Task Force Committee may consider his name for the award, in such circumstances, the award will be presented posthumously.
Yuva Srujan Puraskar (Navsarjan Chetana.exclusions:
1. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme.
1. No individual artist shall be eligible to avail the benefit of the scheme for a second time.

Laxman Award / Rani Laxmi Bai Award Sche.details: The scheme “Laxman Award/Rani Laxmi Bai Award” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh the sportspersons will be honoured by the state government with the Lakshman award for male sportsperson and Rani Lakshmi Bai award for a female sportsperson in 31 sports disciplines.
Laxman Award / Rani Laxmi Bai Award Sche.benefits: - This award recognizes sports personalities with a Citation, a Bronze statue of either Laxman or Rani Laxmi Bai, a Scroll, and a cash prize of ₹3,11,000/-.
Laxman Award / Rani Laxmi Bai Award Sche.eligibility: 1. The player must be a bonafide native of Uttar Pradesh. 1. The sportspersons for at least three consecutive times for the year 2020-21 (year 2018-19, 2019-20 & 2020-21) must have been a member of the state senior team for the year 2021-22 (2019-20, 2020-21 & 2021-22) participated in the National Games/National Senior Championship and also the medal earned by him in the year for which the award is recommended. 1. If a player has participated in the National Senior Championship and he/she will participate in the international competitions mentioned in the government order such as the Olympic Games, World Championship/World Cup (held at an interval of 04 years) Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, Asian Championship and Commonwealth Championship (held 01 time in 04 years), SAF Games If he participates, will also be considered eligible. 1. The player will have to give an affidavit along with his application that he has never been a participant in the consumption of drugs in any competition/championship or sports event nor has he been found guilty in this case. 1. The applicant shall also submit an oath that he has not been found guilty in any suit by the Hon'ble Court nor has he been found guilty in connection with sexual harassment 1. The players who have the above eligibility will be given the Laxman Award to the male player and Rani Laxmi Bai Award to women players included in 31 sports (Swimming, Archery, Athletics, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing & Kayaking, Cycling, Horse Riding, Fencing, Football, Gymnastics, Handball, Hockey, Judo, Kabaddi, Kho - Kho, Rowing, Shooting, Table Tennis, Lan Tennis, Volleyball, Weightlifting/Best physics, Wrestling, Taekwondo, Yachting, Golf, Cricket, Soft Tennis, Karate and Wushu) by conferring Lakshman/Rani Lakshmi Bai Award to male/female sportsperson who bring laurels to the state and the country by achieving significant achievements in the respective sports. 1. One person will be rewarded only once. 1. The Government may cancel the name of any person from the list of awardee sportspersons and in that direction, such person shall be required to return the statue and inscription given to him. The cancellation will thus be final and no appeal can be made against it. 1. Any form of conveying (pleading) about a recommendation will disqualify that entry. 1. The players only participating in National Senior Championships/National Games will not be considered eligible for the award.

National Handicrafts Development Program.details: The scheme "Direct Benefit to Artisans - Supports to Artisans in Indigent Circumstances" is a component of the Umbrella Scheme "National Handicrafts Development Programme (NHDP)" by the Ministry of Textiles, Govt. of India. The scheme is introduced to support the artisans during their old age. The scheme is designed to give a boost to the handicraft sector in India. Assistance of upto ₹8,000/- per month is granted to the Artisans in Indigent Circumstances in the form of monthly allowance or lump sum grant or both, through PFMS/DBT.
National Handicrafts Development Program.benefits: Assistance of upto ₹8,000/- per month is granted in the form of a monthly allowance or lump sum grant or both, disbursed via the Public Financial Management System (PFMS)/ Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
National Handicrafts Development Program.eligibility:
- The applicant should be a master craftsperson who is the recipient of the Shilp Guru Award/ National Award/ Merit Certificate/ State Award/ any other bigger award.
- The annual income of the artisan should not exceed ₹1,00,000/- in the preceding financial year.
- The applicant should not be a recipient of similar financial assistance from any other source.
- The artisan should not be less than 60 years of age on the date of application. Age may be relaxed in the case of artisans with disabilities, subject to submission of the Certificate issued by the appropriate authority.

application process.process: The applications from the eligible master craftsperson would be invited every year by making wide publicity through advertisement. Step 1:  The eligible artisan should take print of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  The interested applicant should submit the duly filled and signed application form and the documents to the  Handicrafts Service Centre/Regional Office . Step 4:  On receipt of the application, necessary entries will be made in the application receipt register and a unique number is assigned to the applicant for identifying each applicant which shall be used for all further references and also as acknowledgement for the receipt of the application. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  On receipts of applications inspections will be done by the field officer. Step 2:  The applications completed in all respects shall be processed within 30 days. On the recommendation of the Regional Director, the Core Committee under the Chairmanship of the Development Commissioner (Handicrafts) would finalize the selection of the master craftsperson for financial assistance. Step 3:  The financial assistance will be disbursed through the in-charge in the respective field formation of the Office of the Development Commissioner (Handicrafts). *If there is any gap in extending the financial support due to non-submission of income certificate/enhancement of income criteria, the applicant has to apply as a fresh application according to the financial support.

Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists.details: The "Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme gives an opportunity to talented young artists to perform in cultural programmes organized by voluntary organizations, thereby identifying talented youth in the field of Vocal Music, Bharathanatyam, and Instrumental Music. Remuneration in the range of ₹5,000/- to ₹10,000/- is paid to the artists for their performance.
Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists.benefits: Remuneration in the range of ₹5,000/- to ₹10,000/-.
Scheme of Encouragement to Young Artists.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artist.
1. The applicant should be a domicile of Tamil Nadu.
1. In the case of music artist, the age should be above 16 years and within 30 years.
1. In the case of Bharatanatyam artist, the age should be over 15 years and within 30 years. 
1. The orchestra artists such as ghatam, ganjira, muharshingh, konnakkol are also eligible to apply. 
1. The artist should participate in any one of the following performances: Vocal, Bharatanatyam, Kathakalakshepam, Veena, Violin (solo) Nadaswaram, Flute, Jalatharangam, Gottuvadhyam, Clarinet, Guitar, Mandolin, Saxophone.

Scheme of Awarding Porkizhi to the Indig.details: "Scheme of Awarding Porkizhi to the Indigent Kalaimamani Awardee Artists" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The artists who have already received the Kalaimamani Award and who are presently in indigent circumstances are awarded financial assistance of ₹15,000/-. The scheme is implemented by the Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Mandram Ponni.
Scheme of Awarding Porkizhi to the Indig.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artist.
1. The applicant should have received the Kalaimamani Award.
1. The applicant should be living under indigent circumstances. 
1. The age of the applicant should be 58 years or above.
1. The annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹12,000/-.

application process.process: The advertisement from the Manram is published in the newspapers. Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office of the Manram and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the  Member Secretary, Tamil Nadu Eyal Isai Nataka Manram, Ponni, 31, P.S. Kumarasamy Raja Salai, Chennai-600 028. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Natural Death and Funeral Assistance.details: The Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu was launched the scheme "Natural Death and Funeral Assistance". This scheme provides financial assistance for the funeral and natural death of registered folk artistes to support their families during difficult times. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Regional Office.
Natural Death and Funeral Assistance.benefits:
**Financial Assistance:**

- For Funeral ₹2,000/- 
- For Natural Death ₹15,000/-
Natural Death and Funeral Assistance.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be the Nominee of the registered folk artist.
1. The registered folk artist should have died a natural death.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the  regional office  and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form (VIII) from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the  Claim Form (VII) , and  Accident Information Form (VI)  to the Assistant Director/Deputy Director in the regional offices. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Assistant Director/Deputy Director to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles -.details: The "Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles" scheme was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Under this scheme, The Tamil Nadu Folk Artiste's Welfare Board provides assistance of ₹500/- for the purchase of spectacles to registered folk artists. The assistance shall be restricted to two thousand registered folk artists per year on “First come – First serve” basis.
Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles -.benefits:
- Financial Assistance maximum of ₹500/-

> **Note:** This assistance shall be given only once.
Assistance for Purchase of Spectacles -.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a registered folk artist.
1. The applicant should not have any dues payable to the board.
1. The applicant must not have availed similar benefits from any other government scheme.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the  regional office  and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form XV from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director/Deputy Director in the regional offices. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Assistant Director/Deputy Director to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Scheme of Financial Assistance for Dance.details: The "Scheme of Financial Assistance for Dance and Drama Troupes/Associations" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide a grant of ₹2,000/- for dance and drama troupes/associations who have a standing of at least two years. The applications are accepted offline.
Scheme of Financial Assistance for Dance.benefits: - **Grant of ₹2,000/- given to the dance and drama troupes/associations.**
Scheme of Financial Assistance for Dance.eligibility:
1. The dance and drama troupes should be presenting new classical or folk dance programs or for staging new dramas, enacted by any cultural body registered in the territory.
1. The troupe/association or body should have a standing at least 2 years.
1. The theme of the dance or the story and dialogue of the drama must be new and original, created by an artist who is a native of the territory by birth or domicile.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Department of Art and Culture and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. OR The interested applicant downloads the  application form . Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the superintendent, Department of Art and Culture,1, Romain Rolland Street, Puducherry. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the superintendent to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Pay & Play Scheme.details: The “Pay & Play Scheme” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. The scheme aims to provide state-level players with training and practice opportunities at the Mega Sports Complex, Hotwar, Ranchi. The scheme includes 11 sports disciplines: athletics, badminton, lawn tennis, table tennis, shooting, gymnastics, basketball, taekwondo, volleyball, wrestling, and swimming.
Pay & Play Scheme.benefits: - Training in 11 diverse sports disciplines: athletics, badminton, lawn tennis, table tennis, shooting, gymnastics, basketball, taekwondo, volleyball, wrestling, and swimming under professional supervision. - Free registration and membership for school students (up to Class 10th) with the principal’s recommendation.- Free registration and membership for international/national participants and medalists. - Athletics players enjoy 15 days of free access (non-repetitive).
Pay & Play Scheme.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Jharkhand.  
1. The applicant should be a sportsperson.
1. The applicant should actively participate in state-level sports.
1. The students up to class 10th with a recommendation from the school principal and National/international participants or medalists are eligible to apply.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant downloads the  application form  the official website. Step 2:  Fill out the form with accurate details and attach the required documents. Step 3:  Submit the form at the Jharkhand State Sports Promotion Society office. Step 4:  Pay the registration fee (₹50) and the relevant membership fee, if applicable. NOTE: Other athletes are willing to pay registration and membership fees. Fee Table (https://sports.jharkhand.gov.in/documents/Pay-and-Play.pdf)

Encourages sports participation and enhances Jharkhand's reputation nationally and internationally.

application process.process: Step-1:  The interested applicant downloads the  application form  from the official website. Step-3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sports Officer. Step-4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana.details: The "Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana" implemented by the Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand aims to financially support athletes and encourage them to focus on sports as a livelihood. Under this scheme, scholarships are provided to athletes based on their performance in recognized national and state-level competitions.
Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana.benefits:
> ***Monetary Assistance Based on Performance*** **National championship winners:** - First, Second, and Third Place: ₹6,000 per month. - Fourth to Eighth Place: ₹4,000 per month.
**State-level winners qualifying for national championships:** - First to Third Place: ₹3,000 per month.
**National record-equivalent performances:** - ₹4,000 per month.
***Recognition for National Representation*** - Athletes representing Jharkhand after obtaining a No Objection Certificate from other states or organizations may receive an allowance equal to their existing honorarium/salary. ***Additional Support*** - Financial aid can be used for training, nutrition, and purchasing sports equipment.
Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Jharkhand. 1. The applicant should be a sportsperson. 1. Scholarships are awarded based on performance in the previous year's recognized national or state-level sports competitions. 1. The applicant must not receive any other scholarship or benefits under any other sports scheme, such as free diet, accommodation, or stipend.

**NOTE:** If the applicant is already receiving such benefits, they must forfeit them before applying for this scholarship.
Khel Chhatravriti (Vritika) Yojana.exclusions: - The applicant availing any other sports-related stipend, scholarship, or honorarium are not eligible.

application process.process: Visit the Official Website Go to the  official website  Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs. Download Application Form Navigate to the "Notice" section, select "Khel Vritika (Sports Scholarship)," and download the  application form . Fill Out the Form (details such as personal information, competition performance, and bank details). Attach Documents Attach all required documents as listed above. Ensure proper attestation wherever needed. Submit the Application Submit the completed form and attached documents to the Directorate of Art, Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs or the Jharkhand State Sports Authority.

The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibiti.details: "The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibition Scheme" by the Department of Information & Publicity, Government of Goa, aims to encourage young talents in photography and photojournalism, promote self-employment, and provide a platform for local youths to exhibit their work. The scheme offers cash prizes of ₹20,000/-, ₹16,000/-, and ₹12,000/- in each category. Benefits also include exhibitions for selected entries. Applicants born and residing in Goa for at least 15 years are given preference.
The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibiti.benefits:
- First prize: ₹20,000/- in each category.
- Second prize: ₹16,000/- in each category.
- Third prize: ₹12,000/- in each category.
- Five consolation prizes: ₹2,000/- each.
- Certificates are presented to the best entries.
- Judges' Honorarium: ₹5,000/- each for three judges.
The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibiti.eligibility: Individuals who were born and residing in Goa for 15 years or more will be given preference, though the scheme does not bar others.
The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibiti.exclusions:
- The applicant must not be an employee of the Department of Information & Publicity.
- Mobile images are not accepted.

application process.process: The interested individuals should send their entries along with the required documents and details to the "Director of Information & Publicity, 3rd Floor, Udyog Bhavan, Panaji, Goa", superscribing the envelope as “Entries for The Goa State Photo Contest And Exhibition”. A soft copy of high-resolution photographs will also be required to be submitted.

Travel Grants To Goan Authors.details: The scheme "Travel Grants To Goan Authors" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their own within India to acquaint them with the writers and the people of that region, and to widen their awareness and sensibility about the country as a nation.
Travel Grants To Goan Authors.benefits: The grant amount will be decided by Kala Academy with provision for an advance upto 75% of the total grant for a maximum of two Goan authors.
Travel Grants To Goan Authors.eligibility:
- The applicant should be a writer.
- The applicant should be from Goa.

_*A copy of the rules and regulations is available at Kala Academy free of charge._

application process.process: Step 1:  The entries are invited by releasing press announcements in local print and electronic media. The announcement consists of the proforma prescribed by the Kala Academy for application to the scheme. Step 2:  In the provided entry form, the interested applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the supporting documents. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed form along with the supporting documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the  Member Secretary, Kala Academy, Goa, Campal, Panaji . Step 4:  Applications are placed before the Advisory Committee (Literature of Kala Academy) for their recommendation and subsequent approval by the authorities of Kala Academy. Authority for Redressal of Grievances:  Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa.

Bhajan Pakhawaj Workshops.details: The scheme "Bhajan Pakhawaj Workshops" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to provide knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing to Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field. Applications are invited by announcement in local print and electronic media. Certificates are awarded to the participants. A Suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops.
Bhajan Pakhawaj Workshops.benefits:
- Knowledge of appropriate and traditional Bhajan Singing and Pakhawaj playing is provided to the Bhajan performers through experts from the respective field. 
- Certificates are awarded to the participants. 
- A suitable Honorarium is paid to conductors of workshops. 

_*The venue of the workshop is decided by Kala Academy._
Bhajan Pakhawaj Workshops.eligibility:
**For Trainee:** The applicant should be a Bhajan performer.
**For Workshop Conductor:** The applicant should be an expert in traditional Bhajan Singing or Pakhawaj playing.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applications for this scheme are invited by announcement in local print and electronic media. Step 2:  In the provided application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the supporting documents. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the  Member Secretary, Kala Academy, Goa . Authority for Redressal of Grievances:  Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa.

Operation of Sports Hostels.details: The scheme &quot;Operation of Sports Hostels&quot; was introduced by the Tribal Area Development Department, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to encourage tribal students in Scheduled Areas to participate in sports and prepare them for national and international competitions. Under this scheme, tribal students from Class 6 to 12 are provided with free residential facilities, training in archery and athletics by skilled coaches, nutritious meals, uniforms, and modern sports equipment. The scheme is implemented in the following District:	Banswara, Dungarpur, Sirohi, Udaipur &amp; Pratapgarh.
Operation of Sports Hostels.benefits:
The following facilities are provided in the sports hostel:

- Free residential accommodation in sports hostels.
- Nutritious meals, snacks, and special dietary arrangements as per approved pattern.
- Sports training with modern equipment by expert coaches (especially in archery and athletics).
- Free school uniforms and educational materials.
Operation of Sports Hostels.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe community.
1. The applicant should be studying in class 6th to 12th.1. The applicant should not have any disability or suffering from any serious illness.
1. The applicant’s parents/guardians should not be income tax payers.
1. The applicant should not be a failed student in the last examination.

**Note:** Only those students who pass the selection test will be admitted to the sports hostel.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme. Step 2:  The applicant should visit the nearest E-Mitra Center and complete the Biometric Verification Process. Step 3:  The applicant should ensure that the E-Mitra Center agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents. Step 4:  Keep the acknowledgment receipt for future reference.

Organisation of Cultural Programs.details: The scheme “Organisation of Cultural Programs” was introduced by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to cultural groups and artists registered with the Department of Culture for performing in cultural programs organized during traditional fairs, festivals, regional celebrations within and outside the state, as well as on the occasion of national festivals.
Organisation of Cultural Programs.benefits: After the presentation of cultural programmes by groups/folk singers enlisted with the Culture Department on the occasion of traditional fairs, festivals, celebrations, and national festivals organized within or outside the state, the following honorarium and allowances are payable: 1. Group Leader: Honorarium of ₹1,000/- and travelling allowance of ₹500/-. 1. Other Artists: Honorarium of ₹800/- each and travelling allowance of ₹400/- each. 1. Folk Singers: - Category A: ₹7,500/- as honorarium. - Category B: ₹4,250/- as honorarium. - Travelling allowance: ₹300/- along with ordinary bus fare or second-class rail fare for the journey.
Organisation of Cultural Programs.eligibility: - The applicant must be a cultural group or an artist registered with the Department of Culture, Uttarakhand.

application process.process: The Directorate of Culture conducts auditions periodically to shortlist cultural groups and artists. For the selection of a cultural group, the following documents are required: the organization’s registration certificate, a copy of its bylaws, details and number of the group’s artists, and a certificate confirming that the members are natives or permanent residents of Uttarakhand. At present, the department has a total of 267 cultural groups and 226 solo artists on its list.

Kailash Darshan Yatra.details: Launched in 2001, the scheme "Kailash Darshan Yatra" by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the sacred Kailash Mansarovar pilgrimage. The scheme offers one-time financial assistance to selected applicants who complete the yatra. To be eligible, the applicant must be a selected pilgrim from Gujarat and submit proof of yatra completion within 90 days. Applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Kailash Darshan Yatra.benefits:
One-time financial assistance is provided to the pilgrim for undertaking the Kailash Darshan Yatra.
**Validity:** Once in a lifetime per pilgrim.
_*The scheme guidelines do not specify the amount of the benefit; applicants should verify with the authorities._
Kailash Darshan Yatra.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a pilgrim from Gujarat.
- The applicant must have completed the Kailash Darshan Yatra.
- The applicant must apply within 90 days of yatra completion.
- The applicant must not have availed of the benefit before under this scheme.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields (details of the authorized travel agent/organizer, details of the pilgrims), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to  "Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar"  within 90 days of yatra completion. *Retain a copy of the submitted application for future reference. Verification & Disbursement The board processes applications, and financial assistance is credited to the beneficiary’s account.

Sindhu Darshan Scheme.details: Launched in 2017, the scheme "Sindhu Darshan Scheme" by the Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh, promoting cultural unity. The scheme provides a one-time financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to eligible pilgrims and supports a maximum of 300 pilgrims per financial year. To be eligible, the applicant must be a native of Gujarat and must submit proof of completing the yatra within 60 days of its conclusion. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board. The applications are accepted offline via a prescribed form available on the official website.
Sindhu Darshan Scheme.benefits:
**Financial Assistance:** One-time grant of ₹15,000/- per pilgrim.
**Beneficiary Cap:** Limited to 300 pilgrims per financial year.
**Disbursement Condition:** Proof of yatra completion must be submitted within 60 days.
**Validity:** Once in a lifetime per pilgrim.
Sindhu Darshan Scheme.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native of Gujarat.
- The applicant must have completed the Sindhu Darshan Yatra.
- The applicant must submit the application within 60 days of completing the yatra.
- The applicant must not have availed the benefit before under this scheme.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields (details of the authorized travel agent/organizer, details of the pilgrims), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to  "Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar"  within 60 days of yatra completion. *Retain a copy of the submitted application for future reference. Verification & Disbursement The board processes applications, and financial assistance is credited to the beneficiary’s account.

State Art Exhibition Competition.details: The scheme "State Art Exhibition Competition" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and appreciate the creative pursuits of artists, art students, and school children through state-level art exhibitions and competitions in disciplines like painting, sculpture, graphic arts, applied arts, and visual arts. Participants are invited through public advertisements in newspapers, and entries are judged by expert panels. Winners receive cash prizes, certificates, and an opportunity to exhibit their work at the Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan. Prize-winning art institute students are also eligible for a monthly scholarship. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. 2 entries each from artists and students of art institutions and a maximum of 14 entries from classes 1 to 5 and 14 entries from classes 6 to 10 from a school are invited through the school in a prescribed format.
State Art Exhibition Competition.benefits: - **Artists Category:** 23 prizes totaling ₹1,74,500/-. - **Art Institute Students Category:** 16 prizes totaling ₹48,000/-. - **School Children Category:** 50 prizes totaling ₹25,000/-. - **Scholarship:** Winning students in the art institution category are eligible for a monthly scholarship of ₹1,000/-.
State Art Exhibition Competition.eligibility: - Artists/ art institute students and school children in Gujarat are eligible under this scheme. - Students should be studying in classes 1st to 10th in Gujarat.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application forms for the "State Art Exhibition Competition" scheme. Application Form for State Art Exhibition-Competition . Application form for providing Scholarship to Student . Step 2:  In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted. Contact Us: Gujarat State Academy of Fine Arts Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan, Opposite Bhaikaka Bhavan, Law Garden, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad - 380006. 079-26425562 079-26562558

Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme.details: The scheme "Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and support the contributions of state-level sportspersons who have won medals in national-level sports events by offering them a financial pension after the age of 50 years. The scheme ensures dignified post-retirement sustenance for these individuals, thereby encouraging younger generations to pursue sports professionally. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.
Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** A Pension of ₹3,000/- per month.
Retired Sportsperson Pension Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should be a male. - The applicant should be a sportsperson. - The applicant should be aged above 50 years at the time of application. - The applicant should have won medals in national-level sports competitions representing the state.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant should download the prescribed format of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Commissioner of Youth Services and Cultural Activities Office. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coach.details: The “Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coaches of Athletes who have Won Competitions at the National and International Levels” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to honour coaches who have significantly contributed to the success of athletes in the field of sports. Under this scheme, financial incentives are provided to coaches of athletes who have won competitions at national and international levels.
Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coach.benefits: Under this scheme, financial incentives of up to 10% of the prize money awarded are provided to coaches of winning players in national and international level competitions, subject to a maximum limit of ₹10 lakh.
Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coach.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be domiciled in the State of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a coach of an athlete/player who has won a national or international level competition. 1. The scheme is applicable to coaches of players who have received cash sports talent awards in the year 2015-16 and onwards. 1. The coach should be employed in the Sports Department of the State Government on a permanent or contract basis. 1. The coach must have trained at least five players. 1. The coach must provide supporting evidence from the players who have undergone training. 1. Online, postal, or telephonic coaching will not be considered.

Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana.details: The scheme 'Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana' was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sports among talented youth aged 14 to 23 years from Uttarakhand by providing scholarships and financial assistance for sports equipment.
Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana.benefits: - Under this scheme, players/sportspersons aged 14 to 23 years are selected annually based on the P-SAT (Physical and Sports Aptitude Test). - A total of 100 boys and 100 girls are selected per district, and they are provided a scholarship of ₹2,000/- per month along with ₹10,000/- once a year for sports equipment.
Khiladi Protsahan Chhatravriti Yojana.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a boy or girl between 14 and 23 years of age. 1. The boy or girl who obtain the highest marks based on merit in the final district-level competition, conducted through various stages of the Physical and Sports Aptitude Test (P-SAT) assessing physical abilities such as strength, flexibility, endurance, speed, and coordination, will be eligible for the sports scholarship. 1. Scholarships are awarded on a priority basis in the following sports: (1) Athletics, (2) Badminton, (3) Boxing, (4) Taekwondo, (5) Kabaddi, (6) Football, (7) Volleyball, (8) Basketball, (9) Hockey, (10) Table Tennis, (11) Karate, and (12) Judo.

application process.process: There is no selection at the school or Nyaya Panchayat level. Players independently participate in competitions held directly at the municipality, municipal corporation, or district level, and selections are made based on merit. Six competitions will be organized to test physical efficiency: (1) 30-meter flying run (2) Standing broad jump (3) Forward bend and reach (4) 6 × 10 shuttle run (5) Medicine ball throw (6) 600-meter run The district-level selection committee will issue a final list in each age group who secure the highest marks based on merit. These players will be eligible for the sports scholarship, which will be directly transferred to their accounts through DBT.

Documentation And Research Assistantship.details: The scheme "Documentation And Research Assistantship Scheme" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage documentation and digitisation of valuable Tiatr-related materials such as manuscripts, photos, handbills, advertisements, newspaper or magazine clippings, video and audio recordings that are with Tiatr artistes, tiatr lovers and institutions, addressing the high degree of risk that some of these materials may be lost to posterity if efforts are not undertaken to preserve and document them. The scheme provides assistance to possessors of Tiatr-related materials to organize and document their holdings.
Documentation And Research Assistantship.benefits: - One-time Incentive: A reasonable amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be paid to the holder for converting materials into electronic formats. - Hourly Honorarium: Documentation assistants will be paid an honorarium on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Reimbursement: Tiatr Academy of Goa will reimburse costs incurred towards conversion according to rates determined by it if services of other agencies become necessary. - Assistance provided to organize and document materials in holdings. - Copy of digitised material provided to the holder on Digital Versatile Disc or Pen-drive. - Professional documentation and preservation services. > ***Conditions*** _*The work done must be certified by the holder of the material._ _*Tiatr Academy of Goa will periodically review the work undertaken and accordingly extend or curtail the assistantship._ _*Holders must indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation tasks._
Documentation And Research Assistantship.eligibility: > ***For Material Holders*** - The applicant must be a possessor of materials related to Tiatr such as manuscripts, photos, handbills, advertisements, newspaper or magazine clippings, video and audio recordings. - The applicant must indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation and organization tasks. > ***For Documentation Assistants*** - The applicant must be willing to serve as Documentation Assistant. - The applicant must be capable of performing tasks including compilation and organisation of materials, typing or word-processing of textual materials, scanning and converting by Optical Character Recognition, conversion of images by scanning or photographing with digital camera, and converting video or audio recordings from analogue to digital format.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. The form requires details including name of artiste or documentation assistant, complete address, contact number, email identification, Aadhaar Card number, and specific aspect of Tiatr on which documentation can be done. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields including personal details, contact information, and specify the aspect of Tiatr on which documentation work can be undertaken. Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *For material holders, indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation tasks, and may also indicate proximate candidates willing to undertake the documentation work. *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment received for future reference. Post-Application Processes Step 1:   Assignment of Tasks Tiatr Academy of Goa will assign documentation tasks to candidates according to the requests received from the holders of materials. The academy will match documentation assistants with appropriate holders based on proximity and requirements. Step 2:   Work Execution and Certification Documentation assistants will perform assigned tasks including compilation, organization, digitisation, and conversion of materials under the supervision and certification of the material holder. The quality and progress of work will be periodically reviewed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Step 3:   Payment and Delivery Upon completion and certification of work, documentation assistants will receive honorarium payment on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa. A copy of digitised material will be provided to the holder on Digital Versatile Disc or Pen-drive, while Tiatr Academy of Goa will retain a similar copy for its uses. *The Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules of the scheme.

Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes participating in Kala Academy’s Annual Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage non-commercial dramatic troupes participating in Kala Academy’s yearly Tiatr Festival to produce Tiatrs of better quality. The scheme provides financial support for specific aspects of drama, including Direction, Stage Setting, Live Band Music with at least 2 blowing instruments, Light Effects, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, and Transport. It also features the video recording of the Tiatr for the Tiatr Academy of Goa Library, with a free Digital Versatile Disc copy provided to the institution, and offers expertise through compulsory workshops in various Tiatr components.
Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes.benefits:
##### ***1. Financial Support*** - For improving aspects of Tiatr production, including Direction, Stage Setting, Live Band Music with at least 2 blowing instruments, Light Effects, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, and Transport. - The extent of the financial support shall be fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Direct payment to the Institution based on submitted bills. ***Conditions*** _*The troupe must compulsorily participate in workshops organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa by deputing at least one of its members; otherwise, they will not be entitled to avail the benefits of this scheme._ _*The Tiatr must not contain any adverse remark in any form, either written or verbal, against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting of religious sentiments; if proved so, Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to disqualify the performance and refrain from making any payment or recall the payment if already made._ _*All advertisements, oral, print or electronic media, banners/standees, etc., must insert/publish and announce before the performance and during the interval that ‘This Tiatr is staged in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa’._
##### ***2. Video Recording of Tiatr and Digital Versatile Disc Copy*** - Tiatr Academy of Goa will video record the said Tiatr for its Library and other uses. One copy of the Digital Versatile Disc will be given to the Institution free of cost. To preserve the presentation of Tiatr for future generations. - The dramatic troupe will have the freedom to use the Digital Versatile Disc in any manner, but cannot make use of the logo of Tiatr Academy of Goa on the said Digital Versatile Disc. *The videographer will be appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa.
##### ***3. Expertise and Workshops*** Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide expertise to the troupes in the different compartments of Tiatr (Direction, Stage Setting, Live Band Music, Light Effects, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, Transport) by organizing workshops in those aspects. ***Conditions*** _*The troupe will have to compulsorily participate in these workshops by deputing at least one of the members of the troupe._
Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes.eligibility: - The applicant must be a dramatic troupe. - The applicant must be participating in the Tiatr Competitions organized by Kala Academy. - The applicant must fulfill the conditions laid down in the scheme as per the format enclosed. - The applicant's Tiatr script will be scrutinized by a scrutiny committee who will submit a report on whether the Tiatr is as per the format. - The applicant must ensure that one typed copy of the Tiatr script and one typed copy each of the lyrics of the songs are submitted to Tiatr Academy of Goa along with the application form. - The applicant must ensure that handwritten copies of scripts and lyrics will not be accepted. - The applicant's Tiatr, in any form either written or verbal, must not contain any adverse remarks against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting of religious sentiments of anybody. - The applicant must compulsorily participate in workshops organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa by deputing at least one of the members of the troupe.
Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes.exclusions: The applicant will not be allowed to take benefit of the scheme “Production of Tiatr in Villages/ urban areas/ Educational Institutes” if the benefit of this scheme is already availed for a particular Tiatr.

Financial Assistance for encouraging pro.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance for Encouraging Production of Traditional Khell-Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage dramatic troupes and individuals to produce Khell-Tiatrs of better quality and preserve this folk musical drama. The scheme provides financial assistance to compensate for expenditures related to staging four shows, including the provision of an auditorium or hall, or financial aid for temporary village setups, along with video filming and a free Digital Versatile Disc copy for the applicant. The applicant must adhere to traditional Khell-Tiatr format, performance guidelines, advertising requirements, and submit detailed proposals with all required documentation in advance. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted by submission to the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days prior to the proposed performance date.
Financial Assistance for encouraging pro.benefits:
##### ***Financial Assistance for Staging Performances*** - Financial assistance (as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa) is provided for staging four shows. - Payment will be made directly to the applicant after a statement of expenditure enclosing all original bills (with stamped receipts if the amount exceeds ₹5,000/-) is submitted to the Tiatr Academy of Goa. ##### ***Infrastructure Support*** - An auditorium or hall is provided to stage the programme. - For Village Programmes: Financial assistance (as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa) is provided for erecting a temporary pandal or stage, chairs, sound, etc. ##### ***Archival and Personal Use Video Documentation*** - The Khell-Tiatr will be video filmed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for its library and other uses. - One copy of the Digital Versatile Disc (DVD) of the video-filmed Khell-Tiatr will be given to the applicant free of cost. - The dramatic troupe will have the freedom to use the Digital Versatile Disc in any manner, but cannot make use of the logo of Tiatr Academy of Goa on the said Digital Versatile Disc.
##### ***Conditions*** **Ongoing Compliance regarding Content** - There must not be any adverse remark made in any form, either written or verbal, against any Government, Individual, Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting of religious sentiments of anybody. - If proved so, Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) reserves the right to disqualify the performance and refrain from making any payment or recall the payment if already made to the concerned. **Show Access Obligation** All shows must be presented to the public free of charge. **Advertising and Branding Obligation** In all advertisements, whether oral, print, or electronic media, banners, etc., the statement ‘This programme is held in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa’ must be inserted, published, or announced. **Guest of Honour Coordination** - The organizing dramatic troupe or individual will need to discuss with Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) and decide about the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour well in advance. - The President or Vice President of Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) will serve as the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour at the function.
Financial Assistance for encouraging pro.eligibility: - The applicant must be a dramatic troupe or an individual producing Khell-Tiatrs. - The Khell-Tiatr produced by the applicant should be a new or old script. - The Khell-Tiatr produced by the applicant must conform to the traditional format of the Khell-Tiatr. - The Khell-Tiatr produced by the applicant must be one in which just one-story flows from beginning to end with an interval of 10 to 15 minutes. - The Khell-Tiatr produced by the applicant must have 12 to 14 cantos which are related to the theme of the play. - Out of these cantos, at least 7 must be of an interactive nature. - The band for the Khell-Tiatr produced by the applicant should include at least two blowing instruments, one keyboard, one bass guitar, and a drum set. - The applicant must not have any adverse remark made in any form, either written or verbal, against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc. - The applicant must not have anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting of religious sentiments of anybody.
