Poompuhar State Award.details: The "Poompuhar State Award" scheme was launched by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Government of Tamil Nadu. The best artisans who have contributed to the development of the crafts of Tamil Nadu are selected and given a cash prize of ₹50,000/, a 4-gram gold medal, tamirapathiram and a certificate. The economically backward awardees are also eligible for a monthly pension of ₹3,500/- after completion of 60 years of age.
Poompuhar State Award.benefits:
- Cash Prize of ₹50,000/-.
- 4-gram Gold Medal.
- Thamirapathiram.
- Certificate.
- Monthly Pension of ₹3,500/- to the economically backward awardee.
Poompuhar State Award.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artisan.
1. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu.
1. The applicant should be above 30 years of age. For monthly pension, the applicant should be 60 years or above in age.
1. The experience of the artisans and the service rendered by them in their profession will be taken into consideration during the passing (The artisans participating in the Award will be invited for process explanation and interview if required by the headquarters to test their skills).
Poompuhar State Award.exclusions: An artisan who has already won the Poombukar State Award cannot participate again.

Scheme of Financial Assistance for Publi.details: The "Scheme of Financial Assistance for Publication of Manuscripts/Research Journals" scheme was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹10,000 for publishing manuscripts/research journals. They are published on cultural subjects such as language, literature, philosophy, religion, history, music, dance, drama, and other fine arts etc.
Scheme of Financial Assistance for Publi.eligibility:
1. The applicant's proposed book or journal for publication must pertain to one or more cultural subjects such as language, literature, philosophy, religion, history, music, dance, drama, and other fine arts.
1. The applicant should be using language Tamil/Malayalam/Telugu/English/French.
1. The applicant's work should be a thesis, dissertation, or original research based on personal study and critical analysis, provided it is not intended for obtaining any degree.
1. Fictional works are not eligible for financial assistance under this scheme.

Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme.details: The “Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme” was launched by the Department of Sports & Youth Affairs, Government of Jharkhand. aims to provide financial support to retired athletes for their lifelong contribution to sports. Athletes, including Arjuna, Dronacharya, and Dhyan Chand awardees, Olympic participants, and Commonwealth or Asian Games medalists, receive a monthly pension.
Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme.benefits:
- Athletes receive a lifetime monthly pension of ₹10,000/-. - Dependents of deceased athletes (spouse and minor children) receive ₹5,000/- monthly.
**NOTE:** Pension payments are directly transferred to the beneficiary's bank account.
Jharkhand Sportsperson Pension Scheme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Jharkhand. 1. The applicant should be a sportsperson or dependent on the deceased sportsperson. 1. The applicant must receive the Arjuna, Dronacharya, or Dhyan Chand awards, an Olympic participant, or a medalist in Commonwealth or Asian Games. 1. The applicant should be retired from active sports. 1. The applicant must be at least 40 years old (age relaxation up to 10 years for medically retired athletes). 1. The applicant must not be employed in any government, PSU, or pension scheme. 1. The applicant should have no criminal convictions. 1. The applicant should not be receiving any pension from the Government of India or any other state government.

Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tr.details: The scheme &quot; Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tribe Sportsperson Students&quot; was launched in 1996 by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to promote and encourage sports participation among Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in scheduled areas of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, cash awards, certificates, and mementos are provided as a form of encouragement to Scheduled Tribe sportspersons students who secure the top three positions in national and international sports events.
Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tr.benefits:
**Students who have secured top positions at national and international levels are rewarded with the following incentives as a form of encouragement:**

- Cash Prize
- Certificate of Appreciation
- Memento
Cash Amount for Encouraging Scheduled Tr.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a student.
1. The applicant should be a resident of Scheduled Tribe area of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.
1. The applicant should participate in a national or international-level sports competition.
1.  The applicant should have secured a top-three position at national or international level competition.

Promotion of Tribal Culture.details: The scheme "Promotion of Tribal Culture" by the Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial grants to NGOs, Trusts, and Voluntary Organizations working for the advancement of tribal culture among Scheduled Tribes (Plains) in Assam's plain districts (excluding BTC area). The scheme supports initiatives like heritage preservation, literature promotion, cultural activities, and local brews. Eligible organizations must be registered and have prior experience in tribal culture promotion. Applications are invited through advertisements, and grants are disbursed subject to Selection Committee approval.
Promotion of Tribal Culture.benefits:
**Financial Grant:** Maximum of ₹3,00,000/- per organization for tribal culture promotion initiatives (e.g., heritage, literature, local brews).
**Disbursement:** Subject to Selection Committee approval and fund availability.
_*Financial assistance is not a right; approval depends on eligibility and fund availability._
Promotion of Tribal Culture.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a Registered NGO/Trust/Voluntary Organization under the Societies Registration Act, 1980, or equivalent.
- The applicant must have a demonstrated background in promoting tribal culture.

_*Priority is given to organizations with ST(P) members._

Assistance to Women for Trainer and Coac.details: The scheme “Assistance to Women for Trainer and Coaches Training Course” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote and enhance the participation of women in sports through structured academic training by supporting them financially for pursuing diploma courses in sports. It seeks to enable women to take up professional training to become certified coaches and trainers, thereby boosting employment opportunities and representation in the sports sector. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.
Assistance to Women for Trainer and Coac.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** Eligible female candidates receive financial support to enroll in recognized diploma courses in sports to become trainers or coaches.
Assistance to Women for Trainer and Coac.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a female. 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant should be pursuing a diploma course in sports from a recognized university or institution such as the Sports Authority of India.

Art Exhibition Assistance in the State.details: The scheme "Art Exhibition Assistance in the State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage visual artists of Gujarat to showcase their work by offering financial support for organizing exhibitions across the state. The scheme particularly targets those who have either undergone formal art education or have experience in holding art exhibitions. This initiative helps elevate the reach and recognition of regional art and artists. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Lalitkala Academy.
Art Exhibition Assistance in the State.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** Up to ₹25,000/- or actual expenses incurred (whichever is less) for organizing an art exhibition.
Art Exhibition Assistance in the State.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should have received formal art education or should have conducted a previous individual or group art exhibition. 1. The applicant should organize an exhibition within Gujarat. 1. The applicant should exhibit a minimum of 30 artworks in the sponsored exhibition.

Khel Pratibha Puraskar.details: The scheme “Khel Pratibha Puraskar” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to financially support and honour sportspersons from Gujarat who have earned medals at national and international levels by awarding them cash prizes between ₹10,000/- and ₹5,00,00,000/- depending on the level and nature of their sporting achievement. The scheme intends to inspire athletic excellence and acknowledge the hard work and dedication of Gujarat’s athletes on prestigious platforms.
Khel Pratibha Puraskar.benefits: - **Cash Prize:** An amount ranging from ₹10,000/- to ₹5,00,00,000/-.
Khel Pratibha Puraskar.eligibility: - The applicant should be a sportsperson. - The applicant should have won a medal at a national or international level. - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat or should be representing Gujarat officially in the sporting event.

Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists.details: The “Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial security to artists who are aged, physically disabled, and living in extreme poverty. Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance is provided to artists and their dependents who are physically disabled, above 60 years of age, have a monthly income of less than ₹600, and are unable to sustain themselves due to age or disability.
Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists.benefits: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to artists to help them sustain themselves in old age or in case of disability.
Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be an artist who has made significant contributions in the field of art and literature. 1. The applicant must be 60 years of age or above. 1. The applicant must have a monthly income of less than ₹600/- (₹7,200/- annually). 1. The applicant must be physically disabled. 1. The applicant must be in poor economic condition.

Artist Honor (Gaurav Award).details: The “Artist Honor (Gaurav Award)” scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy under the Sports, Youth and Culture Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artists who have made a lifetime contribution in the field of fine arts, specifically in painting, sculpture, and graphic arts, and have achieved outstanding accomplishments. Every year, a total of nine (9) artists are honored under this scheme, three in painting, three in sculpture, and three in graphic arts with the Gaurav Award. This award has been conferred annually since 1964-65.
Artist Honor (Gaurav Award).benefits: **Award Details:** - Cash prize of ₹51,000/- per artist. - Copper plate, citation, and shawl presented during the award ceremony. - Exhibition of artworks held for 5–7 days at Ravishankar Raval Kala Bhavan, Ahmedabad. - Catalogue publication of Gaurav Award-winning artists and their art. **Number of Awards:** - Total of 9 artists are honored every year. - 3 in painting, 3 in sculpture, and 3 in graphic arts.
Artist Honor (Gaurav Award).eligibility: 1. The artist must be a resident of the State of Gujarat. 1. The artist must be associated with the field of fine arts, specifically in Painting, Sculpture or Graphic Arts. 1. The artist must have made a lifetime contribution in their respective field. 1. The artist should have achieved outstanding accomplishments or the highest level of recognition in their art form. 1. The applicant must be active in the art community and have a recognized body of work.

Scholarships and Stipends.details: The scheme "Scholarships and Stipends" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote excellence in sports by offering financial support to individuals who have represented the state at national-level events and have won medals. This initiative is designed to reduce the financial burden on athletes and to recognize their achievements at the national level, thereby motivating them to continue their athletic pursuits and strive for excellence. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.
Scholarships and Stipends.benefits: - **Scholarships:** ₹2,500/- per player is awarded to athletes who have won medals at the national level. - **Stipends:** ₹2,000/- per player is awarded to athletes who have participated at the national level, irrespective of winning.
Scholarships and Stipends.eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should be a male. - The applicant should have participated in a national-level sports event. - The applicant should have won a medal at the national level to be eligible for the scholarship.

Taluka Level Personality Development and.details: The scheme "Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to facilitate holistic personality development—physical, mental, and spiritual—among Scheduled Caste youth aged between 14 and 35 years by organizing 7-day free training camps. These camps are conducted across all 250 talukas in 41 Scheduled Caste-majority districts of Gujarat and are designed to empower 50 youth participants per taluka through structured personality enhancement and Yogasana sessions.
Taluka Level Personality Development and.benefits: - **Personality Development:** Participants undergo structured sessions for enhancing communication, confidence, discipline, and overall character. - **Physical Development:** Daily Yogasana training and exercises aimed at physical fitness. - **Mental and Spiritual Development:** Yoga and related practices to foster mental peace and spiritual well-being.
Taluka Level Personality Development and.eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category. - The applicant should be between 14 and 35 years of age.

State Mountaineering Reward Scheme.details: The scheme "State Mountaineering Reward Scheme" was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide awards in the field of mountaineering is in place to enthusiastically engage and inspire the youth of the state towards risky and adventurous activities like summiting, mountaineering and rock climbing and to honor and commend the youth of the state who have achieved exceptional achievements in the field of mountaineering. Under the scheme, a cash award, a memento, and a certificate will be awarded to each of the adventurers of the state every year for their outstanding achievements in the field of mountaineering.
State Mountaineering Reward Scheme.benefits: A cash award of ₹25,000/-, a memento, and a certificate will be awarded to each of the adventurers of the state every year for their outstanding achievements in the field of mountaineering.
State Mountaineering Reward Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be a native of Gujarat. - The applicant should have climbed a height of 7,000 meters once or a height of more than 6,000 meters twice. - The climbing achievement of the applicant must be confirmed by the Director of the Indian Mountaineering Foundation (IMF). - The applicant should not be involved in any criminal activity. ****This award can also be given posthumously, for which the legal heir of the awardee will have to apply.***
State Mountaineering Reward Scheme.exclusions: A person who has previously received an award in this field will not be eligible for the award.

Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr.details: The scheme "Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the rich experiences of veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely to the development of Tiatr, as their experiences form a part and parcel of the history of Tiatr for future generations. The scheme provides video recording of artistes' experiences on High Definition or higher format camera with preservation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library and a onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must have made at least 20 years contribution to the Konkani stage and must be a script writer, director, actor, singer, musician, backstage artiste or organizer involved in tiatrs. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr.benefits: > ***Financial Benefits*** - Onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to the artiste to be documented. - Additional amount as decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for artistes living outside Goa. - Remuneration to the interviewer as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. > ***Non-Financial Benefits*** - Video recording of artiste's experiences on High Definition or higher format camera. - Preservation of documentation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library. - One copy of the Digital Versatile Disc provided to the artiste concerned. - Potential upload of recording on Tiatr Academy of Goa's website, other internet sites, or other media channels.
Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr.eligibility: - The applicant must be a veteran artist who has contributed to the development of Tiatr. - The applicant must be a script writer, director, actor, singer, musician, backstage artiste involved in stage setting, light effects, background music, costumes, make-up, or those involved in organizing tiatrs. - The applicant must have made at least 20 years of contribution to the Konkani stage. - The applicant who is a writer or director must have scripted at least 15 tiatrs. - The applicant who is other than writer or director must have participated in at least 20 tiatrs. > ***Preference, Selection and Implementation*** - At least five artistes will be considered for documentation in a financial year. - Artistes will be selected by the Managing Committee of Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Preference will be given to old and sick artistes.

Documentation of Tiatr through Research.details: The scheme "Documentation of Tiatr through Research Work" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage research work in the field of Tiatr and facilitate writers to take up research work in different aspects of Tiatr, its Song & Music. The scheme provides publication of research work in book form with a minimum of 500 copies printed and remuneration as fixed by TAG as per the researcher's experience. The applicant must be a researcher interested in writing books on tiatr after doing thorough research and must submit three typed copies of the manuscript for approval. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG). The applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Documentation of Tiatr through Research.benefits: > ***Publication Benefits*** - TAG will publish the research work in book form after thorough research on the subject. - The publication may be in English or Konkani (Roman Script). - TAG will print a minimum of 500 copies of the book. - 100 copies will be given to the writer. - The remaining copies will be used by TAG for various purposes. > ***Financial Benefits*** The author/researcher will be given remuneration as fixed by TAG as per his/her experience for the research work undertaken. > ***Editorial Support*** - The manuscript approved by the Recommendation Board shall be edited by a member of Editorial Board. - Editing will include checking for spelling and orthography. ***Conditions*** _*The manuscript received from the author/researcher will be considered for publication only after getting approval from the Recommendation Board appointed by TAG._ _*The author/researcher will have to provide TAG, 3 (three) typed copies of the manuscript._ _*If approved, the author/researcher will have to submit a soft copy of the manuscript on a Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/pen drive._
Documentation of Tiatr through Research.eligibility: - The applicant must be a researcher interested in writing books on tiatr after doing thorough research on the subject. - Preference will be given to any researcher who has already done research on any aspect of Tiatr, its Song & Music.

Preservation of Tiatr Literature.details: The scheme "Preservation of Tiatr Literature" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the literature related to Tiatr/Khell Tiatr/Khell, their scripts, lyrics of songs (kantaram), music, scripts of one-act plays, and encourage script writers and lyricists to publish their works in book form. The scheme addresses the issue that, although thousands of tiatrs have been produced and staged and songs (kantaram) composed and sung over the decades, not many books of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays scripts and lyrics of songs (Kantaram) have been published. The scheme provides printing of scripts of tiatrs/khell tiatrs/khells, one-act plays, lyrics of kantaram with or without music in book form in Konkani in Roman Script, and payment of honorarium along with free copies to eligible writers.
Preservation of Tiatr Literature.benefits:
##### ***Printing Services*** - Tiatr Academy of Goa will print scripts of tiatrs/khell tiatrs/khells, one-act plays, lyrics of kantaram with or without music in book form in Konkani in Roman Script. - Minimum of 500 copies of each book will be printed.
##### ***Category-wise Benefits*** > ***Category I (Deceased or Inactive Tiatr Artistes)*** - One-time honorarium as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each tiatr script/anthology of songs. - 25 copies of books will be given to the writer or legal heir. - Books will be published by Tiatr Academy of Goa from its funds allotted to the scheme. > ***Category II (Active Tiatr Artistes)*** - 200 books will be given to the artiste. - One-time honorarium as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa for each tiatr script/anthology of songs. - Books will be published by Tiatr Academy of Goa from its funds allotted to the scheme. > ***Category III (Individual Artiste/Publisher Self-Publishing)*** - 100% of the cost of printing will be paid by Tiatr Academy of Goa on proper verification of rates. - Must give 100 books to Tiatr Academy of Goa free of cost. - Not entitled for any honorarium from Tiatr Academy of Goa.
##### ***Conditions*** _*The manuscript must adhere to traditional formats as approved by Tiatr Academy of Goa._ _*There should not be any adverse remark made in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the scripts/lyrics of songs which may hurt the sentiments of anybody._ _*If proved to contain adverse remarks, Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right not to print the book and refrain from making payment or recall the payment made to the concerned._
Preservation of Tiatr Literature.eligibility: ##### **General Eligibility** The applicant must be a tiatr artiste or the legal heir of a deceased tiatr artiste. ##### **Category-wise Eligibility** ***Category I:*** - The applicant must be a tiatr artiste who has expired or is living but not active on the tiatr stage. - The applicant must submit scripts of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays. - The applicant must have a minimum collection of 50 songs with or without musical scores if submitting only songs (kantaram). ***Category II:*** - The applicant must be a tiatr artist who is active on the tiatr stage. - The applicant must submit scripts of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays. - The applicant must have a minimum collection of 100 songs with or without musical scores if submitting only songs (kantaram). ***Category III:*** - The applicant must be an individual artist/publisher who wishes to publish Scripts of Tiatr/Khell tiatr/Khell/One Act Plays on his/her own. - The applicant must ensure the book conforms to all norms of the scheme. ##### ***Preference*** Scripts/lyrics/music written by tiatr artistes of yesteryears will be given first preference.

Orientation Courses in Dramatics.details: The scheme "Orientation Courses in Dramatics" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to improve the quality of tiatr performances. The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops covering script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These workshops are conducted as per the syllabus formulated by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, led by graduates of the National School of Drama or Kala Academy School of Drama, with tiatr-specific aspects handled by personnel involved in the field. The training is preliminary, intended to help tiatr artistes enhance performance standards. The applicant must be an individual interested in training in tiatr's various aspects, including song and music performances, and must submit a self-attested copy of their Aadhaar Card with the application. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Applications for this scheme are accepted through the local press or by invitation to Konkani Dramatic Troupes.
Orientation Courses in Dramatics.benefits: • **Training and Skill Enhancement:** The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops in various aspects of dramatics, including script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These courses and workshops are intended to help tiatr artistes improve the standard and quality of tiatr performances. • **Expert Instruction:** Workshops are conducted by graduates of the National School of Drama or Kala Academy School of Drama, with tiatr-specific aspects handled by personnel involved in the field of tiatr, to ensure high-quality and relevant training for participants.
Orientation Courses in Dramatics.eligibility: - The applicant must be an individual. - The applicant must be interested in getting trained in various aspects of tiatr, including its song and music performances.

Raising the Standard of Tiatr.details: The scheme "Raising the Standard of Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to improve the quality and standard of Tiatr performances, which is the most popular dramatic form of Goa. The scheme provides opportunities for actors, directors, backstage artists, and script writers to witness high-standard dramas in Hindi, Marathi, English, and other languages, by reimbursing the amount spent on purchasing tickets for up to two persons. The applicant must submit a brief report about the drama witnessed, highlighting its positive and negative points, along with the counter-foils of the tickets, for the reimbursement to be processed. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted by submitting required documents to the office.
Raising the Standard of Tiatr.benefits: - Reimbursement of the value of ticket(s) for witnessing high-standard dramas. - To cover the cost incurred by artists for purchasing tickets to watch high-standard plays, thereby encouraging them to improve their performance quality. _*The value of the ticket(s) will be reimbursed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa after a brief report about the drama seen and the counter-foils of tickets are submitted to the office._ _*The artist who has witnessed the drama must submit a brief report highlighting the positive and negative points of the play._
Raising the Standard of Tiatr.eligibility: - The applicant must be a director, script writer, artist, or backstage artist. - The applicant must submit a self-attested copy of their Aadhaar Card along with the application.

Cash Incentive Award to Bonafede Meritor.details: The Incentive Awards in the form of Cash assistance to Meritorious Sports Persons of Sikkim constitute a Government policy aimed at encouraging the youth to pave their future by engaging themselves in any sports. The scheme seeks to promote all-round development physically, socially, mentally and emotionally, thereby, contributing to the overall wellbeing of citizens in general. The award has been introduced with a view to encourage and motivate sportspersons in their pursuit of excellence. The scheme applies for sub-junior/cadet, junior and senior level of sports competitions with equal quantum of awards for both men & women. However, the achievement in an unauthorized or invitational tournament will not be considered under this scheme. Only tournaments organized under the aegis of Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports/ SAI/ recognized Sports Federation at the zonal, national and international levels will be eligible. The disbursement of the cash award under this scheme is organized annually. Eligibility is restricted to sports persons who are Bonafide domiciles of Sikkim.
Cash Incentive Award to Bonafede Meritor.benefits: 1. Recognition and motivation 2. Financial Support 3. Equal Opportunities/ Gender equality across all age group 4. Promotion of Sports culture 5. Holistic development of individual
Cash Incentive Award to Bonafede Meritor.eligibility: 1. Medal winner in recognized Games/Competitions/ Tournaments/ Championship etc. 2. Eligible for Zonal Level Competitions and above. 3. Bonafede/possessing domicile of Sikkim State 4. Tournaments organized under the aegis of Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports/ SAI/ recognized Sports Federation. 5. Both Olympic and Non-Olympic Sports Disciplines 6. Achievement in Veteran tournaments is not included in this scheme.
Cash Incentive Award to Bonafede Meritor.exclusions: 1. Unauthorized/ Invitational tournaments 2. Non-domicile candidate 3. Unauthorized sports disciplines 4. Veteran tournaments

Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Q.details: The scheme "Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Quintets/Choral Songs" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the traditional concept of singing of duets/duos/trios/quartets/quintets/choral songs, which has been on the decline, and to ensure that the correct concept as done traditionally by the tiatr stage artistes of yesteryears is followed. The scheme provides cash prizes ranging from ₹1,000/- to ₹6,000/- for various categories and certificates to winners and participants. The applicant must be aged either above 16 years to 25 years or up to 16 years on the day fixed for submission of application and must present original compositions with interactive lyrics. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Q.benefits: - Best Duet: 1st Prize - ₹3,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,500/-. - Best Duo: 1st Prize - ₹3,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,500/-. - Best Trio: 1st Prize - ₹4,500/-, 2nd Prize - ₹2,250/-. - Best Quartet/Quintet: 1st Prize - ₹6,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹3,000/-. - Best Choral Song: 1st Prize - ₹2,000/- to ₹4,000/- (maximum 4 participants), 2nd Prize - ₹1,000/- to ₹2,000/- (maximum 4 participants). - Best Lyrics: 1st Prize - ₹2,000/-, 2nd Prize - ₹1,000/-. _*Travelling allowance provided to every participant._ _*Certificates awarded to winners and participants in both categories._
Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Q.eligibility: - The applicant must be aged either above 16 years to 25 years or up to 16 years on the day fixed for submission of application. - The applicant must present original compositions that have not been recorded on any audio albums. - The applicant must ensure that songs which have won 1st, 2nd and 3rd prizes in any competitions organized by Kala Academy/Art & Culture Department/Tiatr Academy of Goa are not considered for first three prizes in this competition. - The applicant must not have participated in popular tiatr performances. - The applicant must participate in any one of the three sections: Section 1 (Duet or Duo), Section 2 (Trio or Quartet), or Section 3 (Quintet or Choral). - The applicant must ensure that duets are sung by a male and female singer with interactive lyrics depicting two different characters. - The applicant must ensure that duos are sung by two male singers or two female singers with interactive lyrics depicting two different characters. - The applicant must ensure that trios are sung by three singers with interactive lyrics depicting three different characters. - The applicant must ensure that quartets/quintets are sung by four/five singers with interactive lyrics depicting four/five different characters. - The applicant must ensure that choral songs are sung by two, three or four singers in different voices.
Promotion of Duets/Duos/Trios/Quartets/Q.exclusions: - Singers who have participated in popular tiatr are not eligible to participate in this competition. - Songs that have won prizes in previous Kala Academy/Art & Culture Department/Tiatr Academy of Goa competitions are not eligible for first three prizes.

Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Ar.details: The scheme "Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Areas/Educational Institutions" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa, aims to explore hidden singing and acting talents among the youths in villages and provide encouragement to develop such talents by promoting tiatr activities among villagers, addressing the need to nurture local artistic capabilities in rural and urban areas including educational institutions. The scheme provides financial and technical support for various aspects including direction, live band, outside artistes, stage setting, background music, costumes, make-up, and light effects, along with technical guidance through directors from Tiatr Academy of Goa's Panel of Directors.
Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Ar.benefits:
- **Financial Support:** Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide financial support to the extent as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa towards various aspects: Direction, Live Band (with at least 2 blowing instruments), Outside Artistes, Stage Setting, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, Light Effects.- **Technical Guidance:** Provision of director from Tiatr Academy of Goa's Panel of Directors who will direct village talents and produce the tiatr.- **Director Expenses:** The expenditure incurred in engaging the director will be borne by Tiatr Academy of Goa.- **Marketing Materials:** Provision of one banner which should be compulsorily displayed on one of the two front side wings of the stage.- **Documentation:** Tiatr Academy of Goa may video film the performance at Kala Academy.- **Observer Support:** Tiatr Academy of Goa may depute an observer from its Panel of Observers to see whether the performance has been made as per the norms of the scheme.- **Payment Method:** Payment will be made directly to the service providers.- **Sponsorship Policy:** Sponsorship from businessmen, firms etc. may be taken.
> ***Conditions*** _*The performance of the tiatr should be staged in the village/urban area of production._ _*The tiatr should be shown to the people free without charging any tickets._ _*Submit statement of expenditure enclosing all original bills (stamped receipt if the amount exceeds ₹5,000/-)._ _*Provide 20 invitation cards/entry passes to Tiatr Academy of Goa well in advance from the middle of rows A, B, or C._ _*Return banner to Tiatr Academy of Goa after the show is staged._ _*Payment will be made only after the receipt of the observer's certificate._
Production of Tiatr in Villages/Urban Ar.eligibility:
- The applicant must be an Educational Institution, Cultural Association, Dramatic Troupe, or Individual. - The applicant must be interested in promoting Tiatr culture in the village. - The applicant must be from the particular village/urban area/parish (in case of Mumbai, Sindhudurg and other parts of the country). - The participating artistes must be from the particular village/urban area/parish (Educational Institutions only). - A maximum of 3 artistes from outside the village/urban areas/parish must be allowed to act as well as sing in the tiatr. - The tiatr must be produced in its original format including 6 or 7 acts (podd'dde) with at least 4 'cantos' and comedy linked to the story of the play. - The tiatr must include at least 14 'Kantaram' which includes at least 2 Duets, 1 Duo, 2 Trios, 1 Quartet/Quintet, 2 Choral Songs and Solos. - The applicant must not make any adverse remark in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the scripts/lyrics of songs/performances/speeches which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. - The applicant must communicate the schedule of practices to Tiatr Academy of Goa well in advance. - The applicant must discuss with Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide who will be the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour at the performance well in advance. - The applicant must ensure this is the first performance of the tiatr for which financial assistance is sought from Tiatr Academy of Goa.
***Script and Performance Requirements*** - The script and songs may be written/composed by anyone from within the village or elsewhere but acting and singing must be done by the artistes from the particular village/urban area/parish. - Musicians may be from anywhere and not necessarily from the village. - Advertising Requirements: In all advertisements, oral, or print or electronic media, banners, etc. the following must be inserted/published/announced 'This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa'.

Step 3:   Stage Performance The applicant must stage the tiatr in the village/urban area of production ensuring all conditions are met including free admission for public, proper acknowledgment of Tiatr Academy of Goa collaboration in all advertisements and media, and maintaining the approved script and format. Step 4:   Observer Coordination, Documentation and Reporting The applicant must cooperate with the observer deputed by Tiatr Academy of Goa from its Panel of Observers who will certify that the performance was in accordance to Tiatr Academy of Goa's norms, as payment will be made only after receipt of the observer's certificate. The applicant must document the performance through photographs and submit 5 copies to Tiatr Academy of Goa for records, ensuring two photographs show the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner during performance. Step 5:   Submit Financial Documentation & Return Materials The applicant must prepare and submit a detailed statement of expenditure with all original bills (stamped receipts if amount exceeds ₹5,000/-) to Tiatr Academy of Goa for direct payment to service providers. The applicant must return the Tiatr Academy of Goa banner to the office after the show is staged to complete the programme requirements and maintain the academy's inventory.

Visit to Old/Sick Artistes.details: The scheme "Visit to Old/Sick Artistes" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make our younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of Tiatr artistes of yesteryears. TAG has observed that many veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed to the development of tiatr immensely in the past, today have become old, and often pass their time in sickness/loneliness. Therefore, TAG has formulated this scheme so that occasional visits to these veteran artistes will make them feel that TAG cares for them during their old age.
Visit to Old/Sick Artistes.benefits: - Members of tiatr fraternity will visit these sick/old artistes at their residences or if admitted, visit the hospital and inquire about their health. - TAG will provide the vehicle or travelling allowance to travel and refreshments/working meal to the members who volunteer to visit the old/sick artistes. - During the first visit of this nature, one-time financial assistance of Rs. 10,000/- (or as fixed by TAG) by cheque will be gifted to the artiste which he/she can use for his/her medical expenses.
Visit to Old/Sick Artistes.eligibility: 1. TAG will identify the sick/old tiatr artistes based on reports from the fraternity. 2. The artistes who have contributed at least 10 years towards tiatr (Commercial or Non-commercial) /khell tiatr/ khell or the writer/director who has staged at least 10 tiatrs (Commercial or Non-commercial) /khell tiatr/ khell will be eligible. 3. Members of tiatr fraternity must visit these sick/old artistes at their residences or if admitted, visit the hospital and inquire about their health.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *TAG reserves the right to make any changes in the rules.

Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (C.details: The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Commercial)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of tiatr, its song and music in the past, addressing the need to acknowledge their lifetime dedication to this traditional art form. The scheme provides a comprehensive recognition package including a shawl, memento, citation, and cash award as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa, along with the prestige of being honored at a special function held annually on 14th December on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr'. The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age (with health-based relaxation provision) and must have at least 20 years of contribution in the field of tiatr with specific performance requirements based on their role. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted through recommendations from individuals/institutions and advertisements in local newspapers.
Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (C.benefits: **Award Components:** Shawl, memento, citation, and cash award as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa **Special Recognition Ceremony:** Honored at a special function organized on 14th December every year on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr' **Annual Limit:** Not more than 5 artistes from the field will be conferred with awards every year **Exclusivity:** Award conferred only once in a lifetime across all categories (Commercial/Non-Commercial Tiatr, Khell, Khell-Tiatr, or Konkani Cinema) _*The selected artiste must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award._
Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (C.eligibility: - The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age. - The applicant must have at least 20 years of contribution in the field of tiatr. - The applicant, if an actor/singer/Stage Manager/Lights provider/Make-up artist/Costume designer/Live Music/Background music provider/organizer/contractor, must have performed in at least 30 tiatrs. - The applicant, if a writer/director, must have written/directed at least 20 tiatrs. - *The age limit of 60 years may be relaxed if the health of the artist is not well. ##### ***Assessment Criteria*** The applicant's excellence as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer will be considered. The applicant's receipt of any awards in their field will be evaluated. The applicant's innovations on the tiatr stage will be assessed. The applicant's songs (kantaram) recorded on records, cassettes, CDs/DVDs or online will be considered (if singer/musician). The applicant's work in dramas in other languages or films besides tiatr will be evaluated. The applicant's published books of scripts/lyrics will be considered (if script writer or lyricist). ##### ***Post-Selection Conditions*** The applicant must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award.
Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (C.exclusions: No person can receive this award more than once in their lifetime across any category.

application process.process: Applications are accepted through recommendations from individuals/institutions and through advertisements in local newspapers. The Executive Board also has the right to nominate deserving artistes from outside the recommended list. Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment. Selection Process:  Selection is done based on the stated criteria through evaluation of recommendations and nominations by the Executive Board of Tiatr Academy of Goa. Award Ceremony:  Selected awardees are honored at a special function organized on 14th December every year on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Joao Agostinho Fernandes, 'The Father of Tiatr'.

State Level Sports Awards - Uttarakhand.details: The scheme “State Level Sports Awards” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to recognize and honor players and coaches from Uttarakhand who have achieved remarkable success at the national and international levels in sports.
State Level Sports Awards - Uttarakhand.benefits: Under this scheme, in recognition of the remarkable success achieved by players and coaches of the state at the national and international levels, the following awards are conferred: Khel Ratna (1 player – ₹5.00 lakh), Himalaya Ratna (6 players – ₹1.00 lakh per player), and Dronacharya Award (2 coaches – ₹3.00 lakh per coach).
State Level Sports Awards - Uttarakhand.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a player or coach who has achieved remarkable success at the national or international level in the field of sports.

application process.process: Applications are invited once a year for the State Awards, which are presented to eligible players and coaches in accordance with the prescribed standards.

Young Achievers Awards.details: The scheme "Young Achievers Awards" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize young talented artistes who have contributed and continue to work for the development of tiatr, its song and music, and have enriched Konkani Tiatr and Song through All India Radio, Doordarshan and other platforms at national and international levels. The scheme provides recognition through awards consisting of a memento, citation and cash burse, given to one male and one female artiste annually. The scheme also provides a special honour function held on 16th November on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Regina Fernandes, the First Lady of the Tiatr Stage.
Young Achievers Awards.benefits: **Award Components:** The Young Achievers Award consists of a memento, a Citation and a Cash Burse as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. **Recognition Ceremony:** Selected artistes are honoured at a special function on 16th November on the occasion of the Birth Anniversary of Regina Fernandes, the First Lady of the Tiatr Stage. **Annual Awards:** The award is given to a male and a female artiste every year. _*The selected artistes must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award._
Young Achievers Awards.eligibility:
- The applicant must be not more than 35 years of age. - The applicant must have contributed in the field of tiatr for at least 10 years. - The applicant must have performed in at least 15 tiatrs. - The applicant's contribution should be considered in areas such as acting, script writing, directing, singing, lyricist work, set designing, etc. ***Relaxation*** The age limit may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well.
***Selection Criteria*** - The applicant's contribution as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer, etc. - The applicant should have received or won any awards in his/her field. - The applicant should have done any innovation on the tiatr stage. - The applicant, if a singer/musician, should have songs recorded on Compact Discs, Digital Versatile Discs, All India Radio, Doordarshan, online, etc. - The applicant should have acted/directed/sung/composed music/composed lyrics/designed sets/provided background music/designed light effects for dramas in other languages or in films. - The applicant, if script writer or lyricist, should have published any books of his/her scripts/lyrics. - The applicant, if a writer/director, should have written/directed at least 7 tiatrs. - The applicant's contribution in acting/singing/providing live music/stage setting/background music, providing lights, as a makeup artiste should be at least for 10 years and should have performed in at least 15 tiatrs.

application process.process: Selection for Young Achievers award is done through recommendation from individuals/institutions and also through advertisements in local newspapers. However, the Executive Board may also select the deserving artistes from outside the recommended list. Step 1:   Obtain Application Form The applicant must visit the Tiatr Academy of Goa, and request for the application form. Step 2:   Fill the Mandatory Details The applicant must fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). The form contains sections for both nominee details and recommender details. Step 3:   Sign and Submit Application Both the applicant and recommender must sign the application form. The applicant must declare that they have read and understood the rules and that all information provided is true to the best of their knowledge. Selection Process The Executive Board will evaluate applications based on the stated criteria and may also select deserving artistes from outside the recommended list. Selection considers years of service, awards received, innovations, recordings, publications, and overall contribution to tiatr.

Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Medical Treat.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Medical Treatment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to aged and needy Goan artists and their dependent family members in indigent circumstances to meet expenses towards major or minor surgical treatment in local or outstation hospitals, including travelling and accommodation expenses outside the state for treatment. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Art & Culture. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Medical Treat.benefits: ##### ***Financial Assistance*** - Financial assistance shall be sanctioned to meet the expenses towards major or minor surgical treatment in local or outstation hospitals. - Financial assistance shall be provided to meet the expenses towards travelling and accommodation outside the state for treatment for self and or wholly dependent family members. - The maximum financial assistance under this category shall not exceed ₹50,000/-. - The Government may relax the ceiling in case of major chronic ailments. ##### ***Disbursement*** - The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. - The disbursement shall be one-time financial assistance. ##### ***Conditions*** - The beneficiary shall not avail the benefit of medical reimbursement from any other Government department or under any schemes or policies for the medical treatment for which the financial assistance is granted under this scheme. - The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers shall be furnished to the department after availing the treatment. - The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount if any shall be refunded to the government within 3 months from completion of the treatment.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Medical Treat.eligibility: - The applicant must be any Goan aged needy artist, born and brought up in the state of Goa. - The applicant must be recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The applicant must have an annual family income from all sources not exceeding ₹2,00,000/- per annum. - The applicant must be not less than 50 years of age. **Relaxation** The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the  Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly. The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee. Step 2:  The sub-committee constituted by the Government shall meet as and when required and shall consider the applications received for this purpose. The committee shall recommend the names of the artists which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme. The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist. Step 3:  After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance. Step 4:  After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account. Step 5:  After availing the treatment, the beneficiary shall furnish the details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers to the department within 3 months from completion of the treatment. *If there is any unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount, the same shall be refunded to the government within 3 months from completion of the treatment.

Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Incentive for Self-Employment" component of the scheme aims to provide financial assistance not exceeding ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, to needy Goan artists or their families for setting up self-employment ventures, helping them establish sustainable income sources. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.benefits: > ***Financial Assistance*** - ₹50,000/- or the actual cost, whichever is less, shall be provided for setting up self employment venture. - The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode. - The assistance is provided as a one-time grant. > ***Conditions*** - The details of the expenditure incurred along with the vouchers must be furnished to the department after utilizing the grant. - The unutilized amount out of the sanctioned amount, if any, shall be refunded to the Government within the stipulated timeframe.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.eligibility: - The applicant must be Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. - The artist must be an artist recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The income of the family of the applicant (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. - The applicant must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) - The applicant must not be employed or self-employed at the time of application.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Incentive for.exclusions: Individuals who have already availed self-employment benefits earlier under any Government scheme, Autonomous bodies, or Corporations are not eligible.

Step 4:  After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account.

Shooting Permission Certificate.details: The scheme “Shooting Permission Certificate” is implemented by the Department of Information and Public Relations, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to simplify the process of granting official permission for film shooting in Uttarakhand through a single-window online system, ensuring timely approvals and promoting the state as a film-friendly destination.
Shooting Permission Certificate.benefits: Permission is provided for shooting films in the state.
Shooting Permission Certificate.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a film producer.

application process.process: Before obtaining permission for film production, the producer must apply online on the "Single Window System" portal at  https://investuttarakhand.uk.gov.in/filmshooting . While submitting the application, the producer must attach the Aadhaar Card, synopsis of the film, Registration Certificate/GST of the production house, or, in the case of a line producer handling the production, an authorization letter for the line producer, along with the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) form filled online. Once the department grants permission, a copy of the Film Shooting Permission Certificate is automatically sent to the relevant departments through the portal. The list of departments is as follows: Office of the District Magistrate Senior Superintendent of Police / Superintendent of Police Concerned DFO/Ranger/Forest Officer Concerned Kotwali / Police Station / Outpost In-charge If the film is to be shot in a centrally operated forest area, the Film Development Council corresponds with the Chief Conservator of Forests (CCF) and the concerned Divisional Forest Officer (DFO) for the issuance of a No Objection Certificate. Permission for film shooting is also provided to the filmmaker free of cost within 14 days through email at ufdc2015@gmail.com.

State Level Awards for Divyang Persons.details: The scheme “State Level Awards for Divyang Persons” has been implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, to honor the exceptional achievements and contributions of persons with disabilities in various fields. Under this scheme, a cash prize of ₹8,000/-, along with a medal and a certificate of appreciation, is awarded to outstanding individuals in categories such as disabled employees, outstanding sportspersons, and best self-employed service providers. The awards are distributed annually on the occasion of World Disability Day (December 3) to recognize and encourage excellence among persons with disabilities.
State Level Awards for Divyang Persons.benefits:
**Award Details:**

- An amount of ₹8000/- is given as a cash prize. 
- Medal and Certificate of Appreciation.

**Mode of Disbursement:**

- The amount disbursed through the cheque or bank draft at the award ceremony.

**Expected Time of Disbursement:**

- Awarded annually on December 3 (World Disability Day).
State Level Awards for Divyang Persons.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be a person with a disability.
1. The applicant should have verifiable records of achievements or work.
1. The applicant should be in any one of the following categories:


- Differently-abled (Divyang) employee
- Outstanding Sportsperson
- Best Self-Employed Service Provider

application process.process: These awards are distributed on the occasion of World Disabled Day, observed on 3rd December. For these awards, applications are invited through newspapers. The applicant must submit the application form to the office of the District Social Welfare Officer along with the disability certificate and details of the special work done by them. After the necessary verification at the district level, and on the recommendation of the Director, Social Welfare, the Screening Committee at the government level finalizes the eligible person in each category. The award includes a certificate, a medal, and a bank draft/cheque of ₹8,000/-.

Financial Assistance/Pension to Former R.details: The scheme “Financial Assistance/Pension to Former Renowned Sportspersons” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide monthly financial assistance in the form of a pension to former renowned sportspersons of Uttarakhand who are above 50 years of age and are financially weak.
Financial Assistance/Pension to Former R.benefits: Under this scheme, financially weak former renowned sportspersons of the state are provided a lifelong monthly pension, with a minimum of ₹4,000/- and a maximum of ₹10,000/-.
Financial Assistance/Pension to Former R.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant should be an ex-sportsperson. 1. The applicant must be above 50 years of age. 1. The applicant should not be currently employed. 1. The applicant’s monthly income from all private sources should not exceed ₹20,000/-. 1. The applicant should be a former medalist or participant in: - Olympic Games, World Cup/Championship - Asian Games, Commonwealth Games - Afro-Asian Games, SAF Games - Para-Olympic/Special Olympic (Mental/Physical Disabilities) - World Marathon (Disabled), International Veteran (Masters) Championships

application process.process: The Sports Directorate issues a notification inviting applications. Applicants are required to submit their applications to the Directorate along with certificates of participation and medals in relevant sports competitions, permanent residence certificate, income certificate, Aadhaar card, bank account details, and birth certificate.

Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang.details: The scheme "Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang (CMAT) – Scheme of Festival Assistance for Participating in International & National Festival" is a scheme by the Dept. of Art and Culture, Govt. of Manipur. Through this scheme, the artists will be extended a sum of financial assistance to meet their travel costs and journey costs when they are invited to participate in International Festivals abroad with conditions that they have to bear international travel costs, visa fees, performance remuneration, etc.
Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang.benefits: The expenditure will be reimbursed to the applicant through DBT after receipt of all bill / vouchers / tickets / Boarding Pass etc in original. For International Festival: 1. Individual artiste (3 Nos.) once a year will be supported. 2. Group Artistes (3 Nos. of the registered cultural group) once a year will be supported. For National Festival: 1. Individual artiste (3 Nos.) once a year will be supported. 2. Group Artistes (3 Nos. of the registered cultural group) once a year will be supported.
Chief Ministergi Artistesinggi Tengbang.eligibility:
> **For International Festival Assistance:** 1. The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the State of Manipur. 1. The applicant should be an Artist. 1. The individual artists or groups should have already given a performance/show in at least 2/3 of the National Festival recognized by the National Academies / Zonal Cultural Centres / Ministry of Culture, Government of India / Culture Department of State Government. 1. The individual artists or groups should have participated in 3/4 of the State Level Programme. 1. The applicant individual or group should not have been sponsored wholly by any individual or institution for the same purpose.
> **For National Festival Assistance:** 1. The applicant should be a resident/domicile of the State of Manipur. 1. The applicant should be an Artist. 1. The individual artists or groups should have already given a performance/show in at least 3/4 of recognized National Festivals. 1. The individual artists or groups should have participated in 3/4 State Level Programmes. 1. The applicant individual or group should not have been sponsored wholly by any individual or institution for the same purpose.
**Method of Selection:** The selection of artists/groups will be done by a Screening / Selection Committee constituted by the Government. This Committee will also decide whether a festival/event is to be considered an International or National Festival.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant should take print of the format of the  application form  provided in the scheme guidelines. Step 2:  The applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach all the (self-attested) required documents. Step 3:  The duly filled-in application form should be submitted to the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Manipur office at Palace Compound, Imphal along with a cover letter addressed to the Director (Art & Culture) latest by a month before the travel schedule.

Financial Assistance to Revive, Preserve.details:
The scheme “Financial Assistance to Revive, Preserve and Protect Goan Maand Culture” by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa has been designed with the objective of encouraging Goan Folk artists to revive, preserve and protect the Goan Maand culture consisting of folk forms viz. Zagor, Ranmalle, Kallo, Perni Zagor, Talgadi, Tonyamell, Shigmo, Challe, Naman, Jatigayan, Goff, Dhallo-Fugadi and folklore and folk music viz. Suvarivadan, Ghumatvadan, Shamelvadan, Dholvadan and any other folk forms, folklore and folk music as selected by the committee of experts which basically originated from Goan Maand.
<br>

> **Objectives**


   1. To revive, preserve and protect the Goan Maand culture that has produced various folk art forms and folk music and folklores in the State of Goa. 
   1. To maintain bonding of unity integrity and brotherhood amongst the villagers to uplift the cultural bondage and carry the tradition for future generations. 
   1. To provide necessary infrastructure and financial support for the purpose. 
   1. To preserve and protect the old age traditions of Maand culture to its unique original form, keeping the Maand culture authentic, and intact by providing all kinds of infrastructure to the Maand group within the ambit of cultural structure. 
   1. To support existing Maand groups that are on the verge of extinction. 
   1. To create cultural interaction between village to village in the form of a village exchange programme. 
   1. To create a legacy of Maand artists through folk programmes at State, National and International levels.
Financial Assistance to Revive, Preserve.benefits:
> **Nature and Quantum of Assistance**
1. The honorarium to Maand Guru/Trainer shall be ₹ 9,000/- per month. 1. The honorarium to the Assistant shall be ₹ 6,000/- per month. 1. The stipend to trainees shall be ₹ 1,500/- per month. (Each Maand group may consist of at least thirty artists/trainees). 1. Financial assistance of ₹ 50,000/- will be provided to purchase folk instruments (a list of the required musical instruments should be attached). 1. Financial assistance of ₹ 40,000/- will be provided towards the upkeep of Maand culture (repairs of old musical instruments and Maand place). 1. Financial assistance upto ₹ 60,000/- to purchase costumes and drapery for the performance. 1. (The exact quantum will be decided by the committee of experts as per the requirement). 1. Financial assistance of ₹ 25,000/- will be provided to upkeep and maintain the place of Maand. (daily cleaning and floor maintenance).
[**NOTE:** The Financial Assistance provided in point 4,5,6, and 7 above shall be for the duration of the training course.]
Financial Assistance to Revive, Preserve.eligibility:
1. The Maand group should have a legacy of practising folk art forms for at least the past thirty years at such a traditional Maand place. 1. The applicants who desire to join training under this scheme shall not be less than 10 years of age. Whereas any old age folk artist in the course of training could share their experience and guide the new generation with kind co-operation from Maand Guru.
> **Relaxation / Preference / Priority** Preference will be given to those Goan Maand culture which are on the verge of extinction.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit the Directorate Of Art & Culture, Government of Goa, 5th Floor, Shram Shakti Bhavan, Panaji, Patto, Panaji, Goa - 403001 Step 2:  Take a print of the  proforma  of the application form, or request a hard copy from the concerned authority. Step 3:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required). Step 4:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the  ACO-I, Directorate of Art & Culture, Phone: 0832-2404640, Email: aco3-dac.goa@nic.in

Promotion of Literature on Art & Culture.details:
The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa to encourage Goan writers to publish their literature on Art and Culture. The entire expenditure on printing and publishing the book is borne by Govt. by keeping the copyright of the publication. Every year two or more books are published depending upon the availability of funds. About 1000 copies are printed and supplied to Educational institutions, libraries, Cultural Institutions etc.
> **Objectives** 1. To encourage Goan writers to publish their literature on Art & culture. 1. To bear the entire expenditure on printing and publishing of the book by keeping the copyright of the publication.
Promotion of Literature on Art & Culture.benefits:
> **Nature and Quantum of Assistance**


1. The entire expenditure on printing and publishing the book is borne by the Government by keeping the copyright of the publication. 
1. Every year two year or more books are published depending upon the availability of funds. 
1. About 1,000 copies are printed and supplied to Educational institutions, libraries, Cultural Institutions etc. 
1. The authors are paid an honorarium.
Promotion of Literature on Art & Culture.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an author from Goa. 1. Only the literature concerned with the cultural traditions of the state of Goa shall be published.
**NOTE:** Authors who have already availed the benefit shall not be considered for a second time.
Promotion of Literature on Art & Culture.exclusions: Authors who have already availed of the benefit shall not be considered for a second time.

Step 3:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest if required). Scheme of Financial Assistance to Indige.details: The "Scheme of Financial Assistance to Indigent Artists" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹3,000/- per month to artists who are in indigent circumstances and their dependents. The Indigent artists who have rendered services in the field of Art and Culture during their lifetime ar eligible for this scheme.
Scheme of Financial Assistance to Indige.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artist.
1. The applicant should be in indigent circumstances.

Scheme of Conferring ‘Kalaichemmal’ Awar.details: The "Scheme of Conferring Kalaichemmal Awards" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage eminent artists in the field of paintings and sculptures in recognition of their meritorious service in the fields of Traditional Art and Contemporary Art. The Kalaichemmal awardees are given a citation and a cash award of ₹1,00,000/-. The exhibitions are conducted by Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu at the state level and creations works will be on display for public view in the exhibition.
Scheme of Conferring ‘Kalaichemmal’ Awar.benefits: - Financial Assistance of ₹1,00,000/-. - Copper Citation Plaque.
Scheme of Conferring ‘Kalaichemmal’ Awar.eligibility:
- The applicant should be an eminent artist. 
- The applicant should be a domicile of Tamil Nadu or should be a resident of the state for at least five years.
- The eminent artist should have outstanding records of achievement in the field of Contemporary or Traditional art.
- The eminent artist should have continuous involvement in their fields.
- The eminent artist should have participated in art Exhibitions conducted on behalf of the Government or in the major exhibitions of Art conducted by others.
- The eminent artist should receive awards at the National-level or State-level art Exhibitions.

Living Craft Treasure Award.details: The "Living Craft Treasure Award" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This is the highest award for handicrafts at the state level was introduced in the year 2013-2014 to craftsperson’s of eminence who are above the age of 65 years. This award consists of a cash prize of Rs.1.00 lakh, a thamirapattiram, an 8-gram gold medal, and a certificate. The award is granted yearly.
Living Craft Treasure Award.benefits:
- Cash Prize of ₹1,00,000/-. 
- Thamirapattiram.
- 8-gram Gold Medal.
- Certificate.
Living Craft Treasure Award.eligibility:

1. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu. 
1. The applicant should be working in the handicraft industry in Tamil Nadu.
1. The applicant should be 65 years of age or above.
1. The experience of the craftsman and the service he has rendered in his profession's special features will be taken into consideration during selection.

Grant to Meritorious Wards of ESM in Spo.details: "Grant to Meritorious Wards of ESM in Sports: National / International Level" is a Welfare Scheme by the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund of the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry. Through this scheme, the meritorious wards of the ESM are provided grants for their achievements in sports at national and international levels. The application should be submitted offline within three months from the date of the achievement.
Grant to Meritorious Wards of ESM in Spo.benefits:
- Grant of ₹50,000/- for achievements in sports at the international level.
- Grant of ₹30,000/- for achievements in sports at the national level.
- The amount is credited to the beneficiary’s Bank Account through RTGS/ NEFT.
Grant to Meritorious Wards of ESM in Spo.eligibility:
- The applicant should be a Ward of an ESM / Ward of the Widow of an [Ex-Serviceman](https://sainik.py.gov.in/definition-ex-servicemen) (ESM).- The ESM / Ward of the Widow of an ESM should be [registered ](https://sainik.py.gov.in/registration-procedure)with the Department of Sainik Welfare, Puducherry.- The event should be organised by a body approved/recognized by the Government.
- The applicant should have achieved merit in a sport at the national/international level.

Poompuhar District Craft Award.details: The "Poompuhar District Craft Award" scheme was launched in the year 2011-2012 by the Department of Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles & Khadi, Govt. of Tamil Nadu. The award was introduced to recognize and honor the artisans district-wise. The awards are conferred every year and consist of a cash prize of ₹10,000/-, a silver medal, and a certificate. The award is granted annually.
Poompuhar District Craft Award.benefits:
- Cash Prize of ₹10,000/-. 
- Silver Medal.
- Certificate.
Poompuhar District Craft Award.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artisan.
1. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu.
1. Handicraft competitions will be conducted in the following 16 types of handicrafts: Panchaloka Idols, Brass Lamps and Brass Artifacts, Thanjavur Paintings, Thanjavur Plates, Wood Sculptures, Stone Sculptures, Fire Clay, Kalamkari Pathik and Applique Work, Pulp Toys, Mat Weaving, Bamboo and Palm Leaf Products, Neti Work, Textiles, Temple Jewellery, Pictorial Embroidery Work and Other Handicrafts.
