Theatre Workshop.details: The scheme "Theatre Workshop" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to provide scientific knowledge of theatre to upcoming theatre artistes through an expert theatre personality. The workshops are organised on the written request of institutions working in the field of theatre and educational institutions for their students. Applications are invited by announcement in local print and electronic media. Certificates are given to the trainees.
Theatre Workshop.benefits:
- Honorarium T.A./D.A. is paid to the conductor of the workshop and the person assisting the conductor.
- Certificates are given to the trainees.
Theatre Workshop.eligibility: Institutions working in the field of theatre and educational institutions are eligible.

application process.process: The applications for this scheme are invited by Kala Academy, Goa, by announcement in local print and electronic media. The interested institutions must apply in the prescribed format provided in the local print/ electronic media. The application must be submitted to the Member Secretary, Kala Academy, providing all the relevant particulars and details. The application must be submitted within the stipulated date declared by Kala Academy every year. Authority to Receive Applications:  Member Secretary, Kala Academy. Authority for Redressal of Grievances:  Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa.

Scholarship to Undergo Advanced Training.details: The scheme "Scholarship to Undergo Advanced Training in the Field of Art" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to provide facilities to Goan talented students to undergo advanced training in the field of various disciplines of Art, i.e. Indian Classical Music and Dance, Drama, Western Music, Folk Art, Puppetry, Painting, Sculpture, etc..
Scholarship to Undergo Advanced Training.benefits:
- Advanced training in the field of various disciplines of Art, i.e. Indian Classical Music and Dance, Drama, Western Music, Folk Art, Puppetry, Painting, Sculpture, etc. 
- Scholarship of ₹3,000/- per month is given, initially for two years and can be extended for another three years.
Scholarship to Undergo Advanced Training.eligibility:
- The applicant should be from Goa.
- The applicant should be a student.
- The applicant should be in the age group of 16 to 30.

_*A copy of the rules and regulations is available at Kala Academy free of charge._

Step 2:  In the provided application form, the interested applicant should fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the supporting documents. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Member Secretary, Kala Academy, Goa, Campal, Panaji. Step 4:  After proper scrutiny, the candidates are interviewed with practical demonstrations in performing arts for the ion. *The Kala Academy reserves the right to the students for advance training. *Authority for Redressal of Grievances: Member Secretary/Chairman, Kala Academy, Goa.

Tiatr Script Writing Workshop.details: The scheme "Tiatr Script Writing Workshop" is a state-level cultural scheme by the Kala Academy, Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The objective of the scheme is to enrich and promote the writing skills of Tiatr playwrights and to have a healthy and constructive discussion on various aspects of Tiatr script writing amongst the Tiatr writers, participating institutions and artistes. All the Goan tiatr playwrights, artistes and institution representatives, besides experts invited by Kala Academy, are eligible to participate. A hall with infrastructural facilities is made available free of charge. Experts are paid honorarium and travelling expenses. Lunch and refreshments are provided to all participants.

- A hall with infrastructural facilities made available free of charge. 
- Experts are paid honorarium and travelling expenses per Kala Academy's norms / as decided by Kala Academy. 
- Lunch and refreshments for all participants are provided by Kala Academy.
Tiatr Script Writing Workshop.eligibility: All the Goan tiatr playwrights, artistes and institution representatives, besides experts invited by Kala Academy, are eligible.

Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Arti.details: The scheme &quot;Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Artist&quot; by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to recognize and financially assist artists aged 60 years or above who have retired from professional artistic practice and have made distinguished contributions in the field of plastic arts at the national level. The fellowship is intended to support such artists by enabling them to acquire necessary equipment and continue contributing meaningfully to the arts. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. In this scheme, 10 artists are given a monthly fellowship of ₹5,000/- for one year, and it is extendable for a maximum of two years, depending on the quality and impact of the artist’s continued work.
Award of Fellowship to Most Eminent Arti.eligibility:
- The applicant should be an artist.
  - The applicant must be 60 years or older.
  - The applicant should be retired from the professional field of plastic arts.
  - The applicant should have attained national-level fame and established a distinct identity through excellence in painting, sculpture, or graphic arts.

The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹51,000/- and state-level recognition to outstanding individuals, fostering motivation and continuity in preserving indigenous physical training traditions. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.

Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festiva.details: The scheme "Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festival and Awards" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve, promote, and celebrate the Indian classical music heritage by recognizing and awarding distinguished male artists who have significantly contributed to this field. The award is conferred annually during the Pt. Omkarnath Shastri Sangeet Mohotsav, where artists are selected by an expert committee based on their lifelong service, adherence to the guru-shishya tradition, and national or international recognition in classical music.
Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festiva.benefits: - **Financial Assistance and Recognition:** Eligible male artists receive a prestigious award that acknowledges their lifelong dedication to Indian classical music.
Pandit Omkarnath Classical Music Festiva.eligibility: - The applicant should be a male. - The applicant should be an artist. - The applicant should have significantly contributed to the field of Indian classical music. - The applicant should have rendered at least 40 years of service in classical music at the state or national level. - The applicant should have received formal training under the traditional guru-shishya parampara (teacher-disciple tradition). - The applicant should have worked for the promotion, protection, and nurturing of classical music. - The applicant should have received recognized awards at the national or international level. - The applicant should have conducted noteworthy research in the development and conservation of classical music.

Trekking in Coastal Area for Scheduled C.details: The scheme "Trekking in Coastal Area for Scheduled Caste" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to offer Scheduled Caste youth a direct introduction to the culture of Sagarkantha, increase awareness about coastal industries and marine wealth, and motivate them to engage in ocean-related developmental activities.
Trekking in Coastal Area for Scheduled C.benefits: - **Cultural and Industrial Exposure:** The program provides 100 Scheduled Caste youth annually with a 10-day trekking tour to explore the culture of Sagarkantha, learn about coastal wealth, and understand local industries.
Trekking in Coastal Area for Scheduled C.eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category. - The applicant should be between 15 and 35 years of age.

Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Acti.details: The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to create interest in Tiatr among students of educational institutions and tiatr lovers in villages and cities. The scheme provides for the creation of awareness about tiatr, its song, and music through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. These activities, which must have at least 20 participants, can be organized by the Tiatr Academy of Goa alone or in collaboration with other institutions or individuals, with the Academy covering various expenditures and providing necessary materials. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa on a 'First Come First Serve' basis, and applications for this scheme are accepted as per the availability of funds.
Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Acti.benefits:
• **Awareness Creation:** Awareness about Tiatr, its song, and music will be created through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. • **Resource Person Honorarium:** Resource persons will be paid an honorarium, as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, for every session, with the amount dependent upon the distance from their residence to the venue. • **Expenditure Coverage:** The Tiatr Academy of Goa will cover the expenditure incurred on Resource Persons, refreshments, and food (lunch or dinner) served to participants. Additionally, any other miscellaneous expenditure made in organizing the activity by an institution or individual by way of collaboration will be taken care of by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. • **Provision of Materials:** The Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide essential materials, including a backdrop, certificates for the participants, and stationery. • **Documentation Coverage:** The Tiatr Academy of Goa will document the Symposia, Seminar, or Workshop, and the expenditure incurred on this documentation will be borne by the Tiatr Academy of Goa.
> **Conditions** _*Prior approval will be required from the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing the resource persons, if the activity is organized in collaboration with others._ _*The cost of refreshments or food to be served must be verified and approved by the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalization._ _*The scheme will be implemented strictly on a ‘First Come First Serve’ basis._ _*Applications will be considered, and benefits disbursed as per the availability of funds._
Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Acti.eligibility: • The applicant must be an educational institution or an individual interested in collaborating with the Tiatr Academy of Goa to organize academic activities for promoting Tiatr. • The applicant must ensure the number of participants for conducting the Symposia, Seminar, or Workshop shall be at least 20. • The applicant must obtain prior approval from the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing resource persons, if the activity is organized by others in collaboration. • The applicant must get the cost of refreshments or food to be served verified and approved by the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing them.

Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (N.details: The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (Non-Commercial)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor non-commercial artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of tiatr, its song and music through yearly Tiatr Festivals/Competitions organized by Kala Academy and by organizing tiatrs in villages, as well as artistes who have enriched Konkani Tiatr and Konkani Song through All India Radio, Doordarshan and other media platforms. The scheme provides lifetime recognition awards consisting of a shawl, a memento, a citation, and a cash burse as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa, with special consideration given to excellence in acting, script writing, directing, singing, lyric writing, set designing, and innovative contributions to the tiatr stage.
Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (N.benefits: - The Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Award (Non-Commercial) consists of a shawl, a memento, a citation, and a Cash Burse as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa - Recognition and honor at a special function on 2nd January on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Lucasinho Ribeiro the 'Pioneer of Tiatr' - Lifetime achievement recognition for contribution to tiatr field - Awards are conferred annually with not more than 5 artistes receiving the award each year. - Awards are presented at a special function on 2nd January.
Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards (N.eligibility: - The applicant should be not less than 60 years of age. - The applicant should have at least 10 years contribution in the field of tiatr. - The applicant should demonstrate excellence as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer, or other relevant role. - The applicant should have performed in at least 10 tiatrs if working as actor/singer/stage manager/lights provider/make-up artist/costume designer/live music/background music. - The applicant should have written/directed at least 10 tiatrs if working as a writer/director. ***Relaxation*** The age limit of 60 years may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well. ***Post-Selection Conditions*** *The selected artistes will have to be compulsorily present in person to receive the award. *Tiatr Academy of Goa will confer Lifetime Contribution to Tiatr Awards only once in a lifetime be it in Tiatr (Commercial/Non-Commercial) or Khell or Khell-Tiatr or Konkani Cinema.

Kala Utsav Pratiyogita - Uttarakhand.details: The “Kala Utsav Pratiyogita” scheme is implemented under the Samagra Shiksha Programme by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote and encourage artistic talent among school students of Classes 9 to 12. In 2023-24, the state-level competition was organized by the Haridwar district. Effective cooperation and coordination were ensured in organizing this competition from the district level to the state level.
Kala Utsav Pratiyogita - Uttarakhand.benefits: A total of 20 students, who secured first place in 10 categories across boys’ and girls’ groups, participated in the National Level Kala Utsav Pratiyogita held at Bal Bhavan, New Delhi, representing the state.
Kala Utsav Pratiyogita - Uttarakhand.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student of Classes 9 to 12. 1. The applicant must be studying in a school in Uttarakhand.

application process.process: The student (awardee) will be selected through competitions conducted at the district, state, and national levels.

Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell.details: The scheme "Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve and promote the traditional folk theatre of Goa called 'The Khell', also known as 'Fell' or 'Zomnivoilo Khell', by organizing annual competitions in different parts of Goa to maintain this cultural heritage for future generations. The scheme provides financial assistance towards production costs for participating troupes and creates a platform for showcasing traditional Khell performances through structured competition format. The applicant must be an institution or individual with a Khell that has been staged during the current carnival season and must comply with the traditional format requirements including 8 to 10 cantos with specific duration limits. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed application forms.
Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell.benefits: - Financial assistance towards production costs as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa from time to time. - Mementos awarded to first three winning positions (no cash prizes). - Video recording of all performances for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa library. - Complimentary Digital Versatile Disc copy of the performance provided to the director. - Platform for showcasing traditional Khell performances to wider audiences.
Competition of Zomnivoilo Khell.eligibility: - The applicant must be an institution or individual organizing a Khell performance. - The applicant must have staged the Khell during the current carnival season. - The applicant must comply with the exact format of Zomnivoilo Khell comprising 8 to 10 songs called Cantos. - The applicant must ensure each canto consists of 2 verses and one chorus with limited dialogues. - The applicant must maintain the duration of each Khell between 40 to 60 minutes. - The applicant must ensure comedy in the Khell is related to the story. - The applicant must use traditional musical instruments including drums and two blowing instruments. - The applicant must ensure no adverse remarks are made against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion. - Artists can participate in only one group and one Khell (except musicians who can participate in multiple Khells). - Mandatory attendance at discussion session on positive and negative aspects of performances. - No adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion. - The three Khell troupes which won 1st, 2nd, and 3rd places in the previous competition receive direct entry provided they apply within stipulated time.

All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konk.details: The scheme "All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konkani" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to attract youth towards dramatic activities and provide ample opportunities to showcase their talents in dramatics while promoting Goan culture through Konkani theatre. The scheme provides cash awards for the top 3 performances along with mementos and certificates, individual awards for various categories like direction, acting, music, and stage setting, and reimbursement of transport costs as per Regional Transport Office norms. The applicant must be an individual, club, or association capable of presenting a One-Act Play in Konkani with duration between 35 to 45 minutes, and must submit a typed copy of the play in Roman script along with written permission from the playwright. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konk.benefits: - Cash awards for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd best performances (amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa). - Mementos and certificates for top 3 performances. - Individual awards with mementos (no cash) for Direction, Male Actor, Female Actor, Background Music, Stage Setting, Light Effects, Make-up, and Script. - Reimbursement of transport expenses as per Regional Transport Office norms. - Video recording of all plays for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa Library. _*Performance must not contain adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion._ _*Participants must abide by all competition rules and regulations._ _*Any violation may result in disqualification and forfeiture of benefits._
All Goa One-Act Play Competition in Konk.eligibility: - The applicant must be an individual, club, or association. - The applicant must present a One-Act Play in Konkani language. - The applicant must ensure the play duration is not less than 35 minutes and not more than 45 minutes. - The applicant must ensure participation only when at least 5 groups are participating in the competition.

Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tia.details: The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tiatr Awards" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize the immense contribution of Khell and Khell-Tiatr artistes who have significantly contributed to the development of this traditional art form, addressing the need to honor veteran performers who have dedicated their lives to preserving and promoting this cultural heritage. The scheme provides a prestigious lifetime achievement award consisting of a shawl, memento, citation, and cash burse of ₹50,000/- to deserving artistes, with a comprehensive selection process that evaluates excellence in acting, script writing, directing, singing, lyrics writing, set designing, and other theatrical contributions. The applications are accepted through recommendations from individuals/institutions and advertisements in local newspapers.
Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tia.benefits: - Cash burse of ₹50,000/- awarded to selected artistes. - Prestigious recognition through shawl, memento, and citation. - Special honor ceremony held annually on 24th October on the Birth Anniversary of Rosario Rodrigues, 'Promoter of Khell-Tiatr'. - Maximum 3 artistes are honored each year. _*The selected artistes must be compulsorily present in person to receive the award._
Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tia.eligibility: - The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age. - The applicant must have at least 10 years of contribution in the field of Khell-Tiatr. - The applicant must demonstrate excellence as an actor, script writer, director, singer, lyricist, set designer, or other theatrical role in Khell/Khell-Tiatr. - The applicant who is an actor/singer/stage manager/lights effects provider/make-up artist/costume designer/live music/background music provider must have performed in at least 10 khell-tiatrs. - The applicant who is a writer/director must have written/directed at least 10 khell-tiatrs. _*Award can only be received once in a lifetime across all related categories._ ##### ***Evaluation Considerations*** - The applicant's innovative contributions to the presentation of Khell/Khell-Tiatr will be evaluated. - The applicant's work in other languages or films beyond Khell/Khell-Tiatr will be considered. - The applicant's published books of scripts/lyrics will be taken into account. - The applicant's previous awards in the field will be considered. ##### ***Relaxation*** Age limit may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well.
Lifetime Contribution to Khell/Khell-Tia.exclusions: The applicant cannot receive the award if they have previously been honored with Lifetime Contribution Awards in Tiatr (Commercial/Non-Commercial), Khell, Khell-Tiatr, or Konkani Cinema.

Nominee Details:  Complete the nominee section with full personal information including name with title (Mr./Mrs./Miss), stage name, father's name, mother's name, date of birth, age, educational qualification, correspondence address, phone numbers (landline and mobile), Aadhaar Card number, and email identification. Contribution Details:  Select the applicable contribution categories by ticking the appropriate boxes (Actor, Singer, Musician, Director, Producer, Writer, Lights, Setting, Sound, Promoter/Organizer, or Other with specification). Provide detailed information for each selected category including the number of Khell-Tiatrs involved and names of at least 10 productions. Additional Achievements:  Fill in information about gramophone records, Compact Discs, Digital Versatile Discs produced, film appearances, published books of Khell-Tiatrs, and awards won for contributions to the Khell-Tiatrs stage. Selection Process The Executive Board evaluates applications based on the stated criteria through recommendations and also reserves the right to select deserving artistes from outside the recommended list.

Tiatr Script Writing Competition.details: The scheme "Tiatr Script Writing Competition" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to encourage new generation of Tiatr playwrights to script better quality of Tiatrs and enrich the Konkani language through annual script writing competitions. The scheme provides cash prizes up to ₹15,000/- for winning scripts and opportunities for publication with honorarium payments, along with certificates for recognition of literary excellence in traditional Konkani theatre. The applicant must write original scripts in traditional tiatr format with minimum 6-7 podd'de and at least 4 Cantos, and must submit scripts that have not been published or performed earlier. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications are accepted through offline submission of typed copies with duly filled application forms.
Tiatr Script Writing Competition.benefits: ##### ***Cash Prizes*** - 1st Prize: ₹15,000/- - 2nd Prize: ₹10,000/- - 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- ##### ***Additional Benefits*** - **Certificates:** Provided to first three prize winners.- **Publication Opportunity:** Prize winning scripts can be printed in book form at Tiatr Academy of Goa's cost (subject to No Objection Certificate from script writer).- **Honorarium:** ₹5,000/- one-time payment for published scripts (in addition to prize money).- **Complimentary Copies:** 100 copies of the published book provided to script writer. ##### ***Conditions*** - Scripts must comply with content guidelines - no adverse remarks against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion - For publication benefits, script writers must provide No Objection Certificate to Tiatr Academy of Goa.
Tiatr Script Writing Competition.eligibility: ##### ***Basic Requirements*** - The applicant must write scripts on themes as specified by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must ensure the script has not been published or performed earlier. - The applicant must write original scripts only. ##### ***Script Format Requirements*** - The applicant must write scripts in traditional tiatr format. - The applicant must include minimum 6 to 7 podd'de in the script. - The applicant must include at least 4 Cantos in the script. - The applicant must write scripts in Konkani language using Roman script. - The applicant must ensure comedy is inter-related to the main plot (however, comedy may be absent in religious tiatr). ##### ***Content Guidelines*** - The applicant must ensure scripts do not contain adverse remarks against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions. - The applicant must ensure scripts do not contain content against caste, creed and religion that may hurt sentiments.

Prize winners will be contacted for any additional procedures related to publication opportunities.

Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema.details: The scheme "Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema Award" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artistes including tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely for the development of Konkani Cinema in the past, addressing the need to acknowledge their significant contributions to this cultural art form. The scheme provides a prestigious annual award consisting of a shawl, memento, citation, and cash purse of ₹50,000/-, with recognition given at a special function held on 24th April every year on the anniversary of the release of the first Konkani film 'Mogacho Anvddo' by late Al-Jerry Braganza, 'The Father of Konkani Cinema'.
Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema.benefits: **Cash Award:** ₹50,000/- as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. **Honorary Items:** Shawl, memento, and citation presented to the awardee. **Recognition Ceremony:** Special function held on 24th April every year on the anniversary of the first Konkani film. _*The awardee must be present in person to receive the award at the ceremony._ _*The award ceremony attendance is mandatory - no proxy or representative acceptance is allowed._ _*Once received, the award cannot be conferred again in the recipient's lifetime across any category._
Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema.eligibility: - The applicant must be not less than 60 years of age. - The applicant must have contributed to Konkani Cinema development. **Relaxation** - The age limit of 60 years may be relaxed if the health of the artiste is not well. **Selection Considerations** - The applicant should demonstrate excellence as an actor, script writer, director, playback singer, lyricist, producer, or composer. - The applicant may have received awards in their respective field. - The applicant should have done innovation on the Konkani Cinema front. - The applicant, if a singer/musician, should have songs recorded on vinyl records, Compact Discs, Digital Versatile Discs, online platforms, or brought out in video format. - The applicant may have worked in films of other languages in various capacities including acting, directing, singing, composing music, composing lyrics, designing sets, providing background music, or designing light effects. - The applicant, if a script writer or lyricist, may have published books of their scripts or lyrics.
Lifetime Contribution to Konkani Cinema.exclusions: The applicant cannot receive the award more than once in their lifetime across any category (Tiatr, Khell, Khell-Tiatr, or Konkani Cinema).

Step 2:  Advertisements are published in local newspapers seeking nominations. Step 3:  The Executive Board of Tiatr Academy of Goa reviews all recommendations and may also select deserving artistes from outside the recommended list. Step 4:  Selection is made based on the specified criteria including years of service, excellence in their field, awards received, innovations made, and published works. Step 5:  The selected artiste is informed and must confirm their availability to attend the award ceremony in person.

Tiatr Competition for Educational Instit.details: The scheme "Tiatr Competition for Educational Institutions at Higher Secondary/College/University Level" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage and develop Tiatr activities among students of educational institutions at higher secondary, college, and university levels, recognizing the enthusiasm shown by students in involving themselves in traditional Tiatr performances. The scheme provides financial support for production expenses and awards mementos and certificates to winners in various categories including best performance, individual artistes, direction, and technical aspects.
Tiatr Competition for Educational Instit.benefits:
***Financial Support:*** Educational institutions receive financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to meet expenses for music (live band with at least two blowing instruments), light effects, stage setting, background music, makeup, costumes, refreshments for rehearsals, and transport ***Performance Platform:*** 15 educational institutions get opportunity to participate in production and staging of Tiatr ***Awards and Recognition:*** Mementos and certificates (no cash prizes) awarded in multiple categories including: - Best Performance (1st, 2nd, 3rd prizes) - Individual Artistes Acting (1st and 2nd prizes for male and female) - Best Comedian (male and female) - Best Direction (1st, 2nd, 3rd prizes) - Technical categories: Best Setting, Light Effects, Music, Background Music, Makeup, Costumes - Best Singer Solo (1st and 2nd prizes for male and female) - Best songs categories: Duet, Duo, Trio, Quartet/Quintet, Choral Song - Best Lyrics (1st and 2nd prizes) - Best Script (1st and 2nd prizes) ***Video Documentation:*** One copy of Digital Versatile Disc provided free of cost to participating institutions ***Direct Entry Privilege:*** First three award winners of previous year's competition get direct entry provided their entries are received before due date _*All payments made by cheques in the name of educational institutions._ _*Awards distributed at special function announced by Tiatr Academy of Goa._
> ***Conditions*** - The applicant must maintain adherence to traditional Tiatr format as approved by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must ensure Tiatr duration between 2 to 3 hours including interval of minimum 10 minutes and maximum 15 minutes. - The applicant must ensure no adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion in scripts, lyrics, performances, or speeches. - The applicant must submit final typed copy of script and songs 3 days before competition commencement. - The applicant must limit prior performances of the script to maximum 2 shows before competition.
Tiatr Competition for Educational Instit.eligibility: - The applicant must be an educational institution at higher secondary, college, or university level. - The applicant must ensure Tiatr script is either new or from any script published by reputed Tiatr writers. - The applicant must ensure Tiatr follows traditional format with 6 to 7 acts with at least 4 cantos. - The applicant must include comedy linked to the story of the play. - The applicant must include at least 8 kantaram including 1 duet (interactive), 1 duo (interactive), 1 trio (interactive), 1 quartet/quintet (interactive), 1 choral song, and solos. - The applicant must ensure not more than 2 shows of the given script have been performed prior to competition.
Tiatr Competition for Educational Instit.exclusions: Musicians can participate in more than one troupe, but other artistes cannot.

application process.process: Wait for the scheme announcement in local press which will provide details about application deadlines and requirements. Step 1:  During the application period announced in local newspapers, visit the office of Tiatr Academy of Goa and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Within the stipulated time period announced in local press, submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 Provide refundable security deposit of ₹3,000/- in the form of cash or demand draft in favour of Member Secretary, Tiatr Academy of Goa payable at Panaji along with the entry form. Step 2:  If more than 15 applications are received, attend the meeting of all applicants where selection of 12 remaining troupes will be done by lots, with first three previous year winners getting direct entry. Step 2:  Prepare for performance at the place and day identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa, ensuring Tiatr duration is between 2 to 3 hours including interval of 10-15 minutes and follows all prescribed format requirements. Step 3:  Stage the Tiatr performance according to the schedule announced in local newspapers, subject to evaluation by panel of judges appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa.

Financial Assistance to Commercial Tiatr.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Commercial Tiatr Troupes/Directors/Producers for Stage Setting" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage all round development of the Tiatr in all aspects by providing encouragement to commercial tiatr directors and producers to bring in development in stage setting, addressing the need for improved theatrical infrastructure and production quality. The scheme provides financial assistance to six commercial tiatr troupes/directors/producers annually for stage setting development, with specific conditions including mandatory completion of fifteen performances and display of Tiatr Academy logo on stage sets.
Financial Assistance to Commercial Tiatr.benefits: - Financial assistance as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be provided to six commercial tiatr troupes/directors/producers annually for stage setting development. - Disbursal is made only upon completion of fifteen performances of the tiatr mentioned in the application. - Payment is processed as a one-time benefit per beneficiary. _*Tiatr Academy of Goa logo must be displayed on the front visible frames of the stage set._ _*The stage set designed under this scheme cannot be given on hire to others._ _*No adverse remarks against any individual, government, or political parties are permitted during the use of the set._ _*Work on the stage set must commence only after receiving written approval from Tiatr Academy of Goa._
Financial Assistance to Commercial Tiatr.eligibility: - The applicant must have been on the commercial tiatr stage for at least five years. - The applicant must have five years experience on the commercial tiatr stage along with the application. - The applicant must be a commercial tiatr troupe, director, or producer. ***Selection Process*** - A maximum of six commercial tiatr troupes/directors/producers will be selected annually. - If more than six applicants apply, selection will be decided by way of lots. - Remaining applicants will be wait listed and provided with financial assistance in the following financial year. - In case of withdrawal by any selected applicant, the next applicant on the waiting list will be given preference for allotment.
Financial Assistance to Commercial Tiatr.exclusions: The beneficiary will not be entitled to avail the benefit again under this scheme for the next five years from the date of receiving the financial assistance.

Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition.details: The scheme "Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition" was launched by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to honour the memory of Pandit Omkarnath and promote classical music among young artists by organizing competitive platforms for singing, vocal, and percussion performances, addressing the need to nurture and recognize classical music talent in the state. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities, Gujarat. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition.benefits: - Classical music artists are provided with the opportunity to participate in organized competitions for singing, vocal, and percussion performances. - Competitions are organized separately for two age categories: 12 to 19 years and 20 to 35 years, ensuring age-appropriate competition levels. - The scheme provides a platform for recognition and promotion of classical music talent in the state of Gujarat.
Pandit Omkarnath Music Competition.eligibility: - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant must be between 12 to 19 years of age or between 20 to 35 years of age. - The applicant must be a classical music artist. - The applicant must specialize in singing, vocal performance, or percussion instruments.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the official website of 'Mari Yojana' at  https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in . In the search bar provided at the top of the page, type 'Competition'. All the schemes of the Government of Gujarat having the word 'Competition' will be listed. Step 2:  From the list, click on the scheme 'Solo Drama Competition'. You will be taken to the schemes page. Navigate and download the application form of the scheme. The application form is available in both Gujarati and English languages, and the applicant should take print of the form in their preferred language. Step 3:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 4:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the designated authority at the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy. Step 5:  After successful submission, the applicant will receive an acknowledgement or reference number. The applicant should save this reference number for future correspondence and tracking of the application status.

Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar.details: The “Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar” is implemented by the Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Department under the Department of Industries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to honour exceptionally skilled artisans of the state for their outstanding contributions to the traditional craft sector.
Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a skilled artisan. 1. The applicant must be at least 45 years of age. 1. The applicant must be proficient in traditional or extraordinary art forms and has made unprecedented contribution in the field of traditional crafts. 1. The artisans must have contributed to the training of young artisans. 1. The applicant must have at least 15 years of experience in a recognized traditional craft. 1. The applicant must not be employed in government/semi-government/cooperative institution/union. **Note:** Preference will be given to artisans who have received national/state-level awards.

application process.process: Application forms can be obtained from the General Manager of the District Industries Centres and can also be downloaded from the website  https://investuttarakhand.uk.gov.in/themes/backend/acts/act_english1541412900.pdf  or viewed on the departmental website  https://doiuk.org/mysite/home /. The application form must be accompanied by the following documents: Aadhaar card, birth certificate or date of birth document, permanent residence certificate, a brief description of the guru/teacher who taught the craft, educational or vocational qualification certificates (if any), details of contributions to the craft, certificates of purchase of craft products, details of training provided to young artisans, information on major exhibitions participated in, details of average monthly income, and information on whether the artisan’s outstanding products have been purchased by museums, temples, or art critics. (Documents related to purchase details must be attached.) After completing the form, applicants must submit it to the respective District Industries Centre. Selection Process: Upon the recommendation of the District-Level Selection Committee, constituted under the chairmanship of the District Magistrate, the application forms of outstanding artisans along with the necessary certificates are forwarded to the State-Level Selection Committee, constituted under the chairmanship of the Principal Secretary, Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of Uttarakhand. The State-Level Selection Committee then reviews the recommendations and applications received and finalizes the selection for the Uttarakhand Rajya Shilp Ratna Puraskar.

Provision of Sports Kits to Players Part.details: The scheme “Provision of Sports Kits to Players Participating at the National Level” was introduced by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support athletes representing the state in various sports disciplines at the national level by providing them with sports kits.
Provision of Sports Kits to Players Part.benefits: - Under this scheme, sports kits are provided through sports associations to players and team members participating in various sports disciplines at the national level across different age groups. - Approximately 1,000 players benefit from the scheme annually.
Provision of Sports Kits to Players Part.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a player or a member of a team representing Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant or their team must be participating in national-level sports competitions.

application process.process: The respective sports federations select the teams to participate at the national level and apply for kits in the prescribed format. Each player or team member participating in various age groups at the national level is provided with a sports kit (including a tracksuit, jersey, shorts, socks, and shoes) worth ₹5,000/-.

Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Outstandin.details:
The “Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Outstanding Performance in Sports and Games for the Year” is a category of award under the “Biju Patnaik Sports Award&quot; Scheme. The scheme was launched by the Sports &amp; Youth Services Department, Government of Odisha to commemorate the yeoman service of late Biju Patnaik, the ex-Chief Minister of Odisha, towards the development of Sports &amp; Games in the State by conferring the highest honour of the Government of Odisha in the field of Sports in his name. The award is given to the sportspersons of Odisha who have achieved outstanding performance in any of the recognized sports during the year making the State of Odisha and India proud.
> **Objective:**

1.	To encourage the development of Sports and Games in the State.
2.	To honour meritorious sportspersons who have made the State Proud.
3.	To inspire and motivate young talents to excel in sports and games by emulating the seniors.
**Sports Discipline:** The sports disciplines recognized by the International Olympic Committee (I.O.C.), Indian Olympic Association (I.O.A.), Government of India (G.O.I.), Sports Authority of India (S.A.I.) and Government of Odisha (G.O.O.) including Sports Event for Persons with Disability.
Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Outstandin.benefits:
1. The award shall be presented every year subject to the availability of a suitable candidate, which will carry a cash award of ₹2,00,000/-.
   1. A statue, a scroll of honour, and a blazer with a tie shall be given along with all the Cash Awards.
   1. The Awardees shall be invited to receive the awards in person. They shall be given T.A. and D.A. at the rate admissible to a Grade &#39;A&#39; Officer.

**Note 01:** Canvassing for the award in any form is prohibited.
**Note 02:** The award can also be given posthumously to the next of kin of the awardee.
**Note 03:** In case of selection of more than one person for an award, the award money will be shared amongst the awardees.
**Note 04:** It will not be binding on the Department of Sports &amp; Youth Services to confer the award every year. In case of non-availability of suitable persons for the award, the award shall not be given for the respective year.
Biju Patnaik Sports Award for Outstandin.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of the State of Odisha or shall be staying at least for a period not less than 07 years.
   1. To be eligible for this award, a sportsperson of Odisha must have achieved outstanding performance in any of the recognized sports during the year making the State of Odisha and India proud.
   1. The applicant should not have been convicted of any criminal offence.
   1. The award will be conferred on a person only once in his/her lifetime, pertaining to the concerned category.
   1. Persons found positive for use of drugs/banned substances for performance enhancement, will not be eligible for this Award.

**Note:** The award can be given posthumously to the next of kin of the selected sportsperson.
> **Annulment Cancellation of Award:**


  - The Award may be cancelled in case it is found that it has been obtained by fraudulent means.
  - In such event, the concerned person shall be asked to refund the award failing which steps will be taken to recover the involved cost from him/her with simple interest @ 5% per annum.

application process.process: Application process: Step 01:  Advertisement for the award shall be uploaded every year in January on the  Department Website  with the prescribed format for the application. Step 02:  The applicants can download the application form from the official website or collect it from the office of District Collector, DSOs, SPs, NYKS, Odisha Council of Sports and Sports & Youth Services Department. Step 03:  Fill in the all necessary details in the application form and attach all the relevant documents. Step 04:  The application forms can be sent by the Collector, SP, DSO, NYKS concerned Sports Association, the person himself/herself or Odisha Council of Sports to the Sports & Youth Services Department. Note 01:  The Department of Sports and Youth Services also reserves the right to suo moto nominate names for the award. Note 02:  The application form and all supporting documents must be self-attested by the applicant, i.e. there is no need for attestation by any Gazetted officer. Scrutiny of Application: The Secretary, Sports and Youth Services Department will constitute a five-member scrutiny Committee comprising senior officials and coaches of the Department with Director-cum-Addl. Secretary, Sports and Youth Services Department or the senior most officer of the Department as head of the Committee to scrutinize all the applications and place the scrutiny result before the selection committee for consideration. Selection Procedure: An eight-member Selection Committee will be constituted by Govt. under the chairmanship of the Secretary, Sports and Youth Services Department for the selection of awardees. The Selection Committee shall examine the scrutinized nominations/ applications and recommend names for each award for approval of Government at the level of Hon'ble Minister, Sports & Youth Services. Timeline for the Award: Invitation of application through issue of Advertisement: By 31st January. Last date for receipt of applications: By 31st March Scrutiny and Selection: By 31st May Award Ceremony: 29th August (National Sports Day)

Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfa.details:
A scheme named &quot;**Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund For Sportspersons**&quot; (PDUNWFS) was launched by the Ministry Of Youth Affairs &amp; Sports with the aim to provide suitable assistance to the meritorious and outstanding sportspersons of yesteryear who had brought glory to the country in international field who are now living in indigent circumstances.
The key objectives of the scheme are as follows:-

   1. To provide suitable assistance to sportspersons injured during the period of their training for competitions and also during the competitions, depending on the nature of the injury.
   1. To provide suitable assistance to sportspersons for medical treatment.
   1. To provide suitable assistance to promote welfare of sportspersons generally in order to alleviate distress among them and their dependents in indigent circumstances.
   1. To provide assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances for training, procurement for sports equipment, participation in national and international sports events etc.
   1. To any other purpose deemed fit by the General Committee.
Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfa.benefits:
**1. Assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances:** 

  - A lumpsum ex-gratia financial assistance may be granted to an outstanding sportsperson now living in indigent circumstances, subject to a maximum of Rs. 5 lakh. 
  - In addition to this, a provision of monthly pension of Rs. 5000/- (Rupees five thousand) may be provided to those yesteryears meritorious sportspersons now living in indigent circumstances.

**2. Assistance for injuries sustained during training for and participation in Sports competitions:** 

  - A lumpsum ex-gratia financial assistance subject to a maximum of Rs. 10 lakh may be granted to an outstanding sportsperson for injuries sustained during training for and participation in sports competitions.

**3. Assistance to Families of deceased Outstanding Sportspersons:** 

  - A lumpsum exgratia financial assistance, not exceeding Rs. 5.00 lakh in each case, may be provided to the families of deceased outstanding sportspersons living in indigent circumstances.

**4. Assistance for Medical Treatment:** 

  - Financial assistance not exceeding Rs. 10 lakh may be provided for medical treatment of an outstanding sportsperson or of any of his/her family members living in indigent circumstances.

**5. Assistance to coaches, support personnel, umpires, referees and match officials:**

  - Lumpsum financial assistance, not exceeding Rs. 2 lakh may be provided to coaches and

support personnel such as sports doctors, sports psychologists, sports mentor,
physiotherapists, masseurs who have been attached with national coaching camps for senior
category players and national teams (senior category), and umpires, referees and match
officials, who have been associated with recognized national championships (senior category)
and international tournaments(senior category) in the sports disciplines included in Olympic
Games, Asian Games and Commonwealth Games who are living in indigent circumstances or
to family members of such deceased support personnel living in indigent circumstances.
**6. Discretionary powers to the Chairperson of the General Committee:** 

  - The Chairperson of the General Committee may sanction the assistance, in deserving cases, even

to those, who technically are non-eligible, taking into account full facts and circumstances
for each case and for reasons to be recorded in writing. 

  - The Chairperson will have the discretion to decide the quantum of assistance.

**7. Disclosure of information about assistance received from other resources:**

  - Sportspersons or family member of sportspersons applying for assistance from the Pandit

Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund for Sportspersons (PDUNWFS) will furnish
information about assistance received in kind or cash from any other source for the same
purpose.
Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfa.eligibility:
**1. Assistance to sportspersons living in indigent circumstances/Assistance to Families of deceased Sportspersons/Assistance for Medical Treatment to sportspersons or family members:**

  - Sportsperson of yesteryears who has retired from active sports.
  - He/She has won medals in individual events or team events in National Games and National Championships (Senior category) conducted by National Sports Federations (NSFs), recognized by Ministry of Youth Affairs &amp; Sports. Or,


  - One who has participated in an International sports events such as Olympic Games, Para-Olympics, Deaflympics, Asian Games, Para Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, World Cup/Championship, Asian Championship, Commonwealth Championship in senior category in the sports disciplines included in Olympic.

**2. Assistance for injuries sustained during training for and participation in Sports competitions:**

  - Sportsperson for injuries sustained during training for and participation in sports competitions listed above but will also include Sub Junior and Junior category competitions.

**3. Assistance for training, procurement of equipment and participation in national and international sports events:**

  - Sportspersons, whose parents are living indigent circumstances.


  - Whether support from any other Scheme of the Ministry is being availed by the applicant or the applicant can be assisted under other Schemes of the Ministry are also eligible.


  - Sportspersons belonging to those sports disciplines whose Federations are either de-recognized or whose recognition has been suspended by the Government or the Federations who has so far not got the recognition of the Government, will also be eligible for assistance for this purpose.

**4. Assistance to coaches and support personnel/Assistance for medical treatment to coaches and support personnel:**

  - Coaches and support personnel such as sports doctors, sports psychologists, sports mentor, physiotherapists, masseurs who have been attached with national coaching camps for senior category players and national teams (senior category), and umpires, referees and match officials, who have been associated with recognized national championships (senior category) and international tournaments(senior category) in the sports disciplines included in Olympic Games, Asian Games and Commonwealth Games who are living in indigent circumstances or to family members of such deceased support personnel living in indigent circumstances.

application process.process: Step 1:   An application for financial assistance from the Fund shall be addressed to the Member-Secretary of the Executive Committee in the prescribed Performa given in the scheme guidelines. The filled signed-in application is required to be sent to the following address: Member - Secretary, Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay National Welfare Fund for Sportspersons (PDUNWFS), Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports, Shastri Bhawan, New Delhi - 110001.

Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme.details:
The scheme “Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme” was launched by the Department of Information &amp; Cultural Affairs, Government of West Bengal in 2014 to revive the Folk and Tribal Culture in their respective genre across various zones and districts in the State. The scheme is primarily for the financially distressed rural Folk Artists as identified under the laid out procedure to enlist and ensure them with alternative economic support along with scope to further their domain folk culture hence preserving the cultural heritage of different parts of Bengal. The main objectives of the scheme are –
1.	To bestow dignity on folk artists by issuing them identity cards
2.	To uphold the traditional folk forms of Bengal
3.	To revive nearly extinct folk forms of art and culture
4.	To uplift the socio-economic conditions of artists associated with folk culture
Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme.benefits:
1.	Issuing identity cards to each folk artiste.
2.	Under the scheme, the veteran and distressed folk-artistes who are above 60 years of age will get a monthly pension of ₹1000/-.
3.	The enlisted folk artists under the age of 60 years, who are engaged in publicity campaigns in different departments, have been receiving ₹1000/- per month as a retainer fee.
4.	The state government will arrange the minimum income for folk artists by engaging them in the public campaign programme on development projects such as Kannyasree, Yubasree, Sikshasree, etc. and programmes like Nirmal Bangla, Sarbo Sikhsa Avijan, etc.
5.	Performance Fees: Performance-based fees @₹1000/- per head per day as and when engaged to perform their own genre mostly at any Government programme like fair/festival/Krishi Mela/Sabala Mela, etc.
Lokprasar Prakalpo Scheme.eligibility:
- The applicant may have a lineage or belong to a family practicing a given folk form or may belong to a tribal cultural/dance team or a folk-based instrumentalist as recognized by the Folk &amp; Tribal Cultural Centre.
- The applicant must be between 18 to 60 years.
- The applicants above 60 years will be eligible for pension. 
- The applicant must be a resident of West Bengal.

application process.process: Step 01:  For taking benefit of this scheme, the applicant needs to contact their district Information & Cultural Affairs Department. Step 02:  The Department of Information & Cultural Affairs publishes notifications in various vernacular newspapers from time to time in order to impanel the Folk artists through auditions in different phases held at the district. Step 03:  Interested and eligible Folk artists may apply in the prescribed format for the necessary selection procedure. Step 04:  After successful verification, the applicant can avail the benefit of the scheme.

Goa State Cultural Award.details:
The scheme "Goa State Cultural Award" by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa, has been designed to honour the eminent personalities in the field of Art and culture. The scheme intends to give recognition to the Goan artists par excellence for their lifetime achievements and for their extraordinary contribution to the field of Art and culture in Goa.
> **Objectives** 1. To honour the eminent personalities in the field of Art and culture. 1. To felicitate the artists par excellence for their lifetime achievements. 1. To recognize and appreciate the artists' par excellence as State Artist of Goa.
Goa State Cultural Award.benefits:
The awardee shall be honoured with a shawl, a sriphal, a certificate of appreciation and a financial purse to the extent of **₹ 1,00,000/- per individual** and monthly financial assistance as provided under the scheme of Kala Samman.
> **Number of Awards** Every year maximum of 12 (twelve) persons are awarded in the following fields - 1. Music 2. Dance 3. Drama/Theatre including Tiatr 4. Performing Folk Art 5. Fine Art & Craft 6. Bhajan/Kirtan/Choir 7. Film & associated Audio Visual works of Art 8. Overall contribution to the field of art & culture 9. Literature 10. (Creative) Photography
> **Announcement of List of Awardees** Within 6 months from the last date of submission of the application.
> **Presentation of Award** On or before April 30.
Goa State Cultural Award.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artist.
1. The applicant should have completed 60 years of age.
1. The applicant should have given extraordinary contributions to the field of art & culture at large and in his/her respective field of art in particular.
1. The applicant should have contributed in his/her respective field of art in Goa for a minimum of 10 years out of his/her entire career as a practising artist.
1. No award will be presented posthumously. However, during the selection process if the death of any artist occurs after the recommendation of his name then Task Force The committee may consider his name for the award, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously.
Goa State Cultural Award.exclusions:
1. No assistance shall be paid to the dependent after the death of the artist.
1. If the awardee is availing pension under any State Government or Central Government scheme, then, the awardee shall not be eligible for financial assistance under the Kala Samman Scheme.
1. No person shall be eligible for a second time to avail of the benefit.
1. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme.

Gomant Vibhushan Award.details:
The scheme &quot;Gomant Vibhushan Award&quot; has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa in order to honour and recognize the Goan renowned personalities who have contributed to the distinguished and extraordinary achievements/ services in any field of activities/disciplines such as art &amp; culture, literature &amp; education, sports, medicine, social work, civil services, public affairs, trade, science &amp; engineering, industry, economics, philosophy, politics, or any other field at national &amp; international level. The Gomant Vibhushan Award shall be given once in two years. 
<br>

> **Objectives**


   1. To honour the Goan-origin personalities who have done admirable &amp; exceptional work in their field. 
   1. To felicitate the Goan Personalities who made Goa proud by their achievements &amp; reputation and brought recognition to Goa nationally &amp; internationally.
Gomant Vibhushan Award.benefits: A Memento, citation and financial purse to the extent of **₹ 5,00,000/-**.
Gomant Vibhushan Award.eligibility:
1. The applicant should possess distinguished and exceptional achievements/services in fields of activities/disciplines such as art & culture, literature & education, sports, medicine, social work, civil services, public affairs, trade, science & engineering, industry, economics, philosophy, politics, or any other field at national & international level.
1. The applicant should be of Goan origin.
1. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during the process of selection if the death of such an artist occurs after the recommendation of the name, then the Task Force Committee may consider his name for an “award”, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously.
Gomant Vibhushan Award.exclusions:
1. No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during the process of selection if the death of such an artist occurs after the recommendation of the name, then the Task Force Committee may consider his name for an “award”, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously. 
1. No individual shall be eligible for a second time to avail of the benefit under this scheme.

State Reward to the Recipient of Nationa.details:
The scheme "State Reward to the Recipient of National Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa as a token of appreciation in order to support and promote the local artists, who have received recognition at the National and International levels.
> **Objectives** 1. To give State recognition to the local artists receiving the National Award. 1. To appreciate local talents and promote local artists. 1. To give financial support to local artists.
State Reward to the Recipient of Nationa.benefits: A memento, a certificate of appreciation and a financial purse to the extent of ₹ 1,00,000/- per individual.
State Reward to the Recipient of Nationa.eligibility:
a) The applicant should be a Goan artist who has received any of the following National Awards: 1. Sahitya Akademi Award. 1. Sangeet Natak Akademi Award. 1. Lalit Kala Akademi Award. 1. Padma Award for the contribution to the field of art & culture (for literature, music, dance, theatre, fine art, folk art etc.) 1. Bhartiya Dnyanpeeth Award. 1. Saraswati Sanman. 1. Sahitya Akademi Jivan Gaurav Puraskar (Lifetime Achievement Award). 1. Sangeet Natak Academy Fellowship. 1. Any other National or International Award specially recognized by the Government of Goa for the purpose of this scheme from time to time. b) Those living artists who have already received such awards stated above shall also be eligible for this scheme.
**NOTE:** Under this scheme, an artist shall be eligible to receive the benefit only once, although he gets more than one award from amongst above mentioned awards.
State Reward to the Recipient of Nationa.exclusions:
1. No award shall be given posthumously. 
1. The Sahitya Akademi Award for translation will not be considered for this scheme.
