Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural.details:
The Scheme “Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural Research” has been introduced to invigorate and revitalize the various institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC) and other identified cultural institutions in the country, by encouraging Fellows/academicians to affiliate themselves with these institutions to work on projects of mutual interest.
    With a view to infuse fresh knowledge capital into the institutions, the scheme expects these Fellows/academicians to select specific resources of the institutions to use in their projects and take up research works that are related to the main objectives of these institutions. It is also expected that the research work would enrich the institution with a new creative edge and academic excellence.
> **Nodal Institutions (Participating Institutions):**

The Scheme shall cover the institutions under the Ministry of Culture (MoC), as listed in the Guidelines, and may cover other such institutions in the future. The scheme will also cover Non-MoC institutions with cultural resources like manuscripts, artifacts, antiquities, books, publications, records, etc., and seek to take advantage of the scheme by engaging distinguished Fellows to work on its resources and also known for its rich publications. The nodal institutions (both MoC and non-MoC) are classified into four groups broadly based on their different areas of specialization, focus, and resources. The classification is as follows:
1.	Group-A: Archaeology, Antiquities, Museums &amp; Galleries
2.	Group-B: Archives, Libraries and General Fellowship
3.	Group-C: Anthropology &amp; Sociology
4.	Group D: Crafts, Performing/Visual/Literary Arts
> **Scope of the Scheme:**

The scope of the Scheme is to enable the identified cultural institutions to engage Fellows of outstanding merit, to work on research projects in order to unravel their unexplored resources. For purposes of convenience, monitoring, accounting, and responsibility, one of the institutions listed above would be the ‘Nodal Institution’ for each project, and the Fellows will be attached/anchored to that institution.
> **Duration of the Fellowship:**


  - The duration of the Fellowship will be for a maximum period of two years.
  - In exceptional cases, the institution may recommend to the NSC an extension for a period of up to one more year, or a reduction to somewhat less than two years, if it is supported by its assessment of the quality of the work undertaken. However, in the case of extension, the fellow won’t be eligible for any remuneration including contingency.
  - The award of the Fellowship will commence from the date of joining and the ‘months’ and ‘years’ will be reckoned accordingly.

> **Number of Fellowships:**


  - The scheme envisages the granting of up to 15 Fellowships in a year.
  - Each nodal institution can be awarded 1 Fellowship in a year. However, the MoC has the discretionary power to relax these numbers.

> **Administration of the Scheme:**

The total number of Fellowships administered by the institutions may be decided by the Ministry of Culture from time to time, in consultation with the participating institutions. This will be based on certain criteria such as the size of its untapped holdings, physical facilities already existing in the institution, the capacity of the institution to guide and inspire the Fellows to get the best out of them, its past record in publication and research, need for research/study in a particular area, etc. An amount of up to 2% of the total allocation may be set aside for meeting expenses related to the administration of the scheme including monitoring, implementation, inspection, review, etc. of the research work carried out by the Fellows, through outsourcing or Consultants.
Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural.benefits:
> **Honorarium:**


   1. A Tagore National Fellow who is from a University, College, Research Institute, or Government setup in India would be entitled to the same pay, including grade pay, etc., which he/she would have drawn had he/she continued in his/her parent organization. Essential or mandatory contributions of the employer to Provident Fund etc. would be paid by the parent organizations as would have been paid by them had he/she continued in his/her parent organization.
   1. A Fellow from abroad or from a set-up other than University, College, Research Institute or Government service, or who has retired from active service and/or is on pension, would be entitled to a fixed honorarium of ₹80,000/- per month.
   1. No payment of honorarium would normally be made to a Fellow receiving full funding from other sources up to the level of the honorarium, but such Fellow will, however, receive a Contingency Grant, other allowances, and facilities, as decided by the NSC.  

> **Contingency Grant:**


  - In case of foreign and Indian research fellows residing or serving abroad and having been selected as Tagore Fellows under Non-MoC institutions, to and fro economy class airfare from their country of residence will be provided/reimbursed by the Ministry once during the course of the Fellowship.
  - Similarly, all fellows under Non-MoC institutions who take up the Fellowship under the Scheme will be reimbursed, on an ‘actual’ basis, contingent expenses for making academic trips, engaging research assistants, etc. up to a maximum ceiling of ₹2.50 lakhs per annum, during the tenure of Fellowship subject to verification of requisite bills by the Nodal Institutions.

**Note:** For Fellows selected under MoC Institutions, the expenditure in this regard will be borne by the concerned MoC Institution from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry.
> **Accommodation:**


  - A Fellow who is not a bona-fide resident of the place of the Participating Institution to which he has proposed to be affiliated and who intends to take up rented accommodation in the city of the desired Institution will be required to indicate this fact at the time of applying for Fellowship.
  - The selected Fellow will be entitled to receive a House Rent Allowance of up to 30% of the honorarium. However, with respect to Fellows from Universities, colleges, Research institutes, or Government setups HRA will be paid by the Parent Organization as per entitlement.
  - The MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure in this regard from the grant-in-aid received by them from their administrative Division of the Ministry.
  - In respect of Non-MoC Institutions, the Ministry of Culture will reimburse the House Rent Allowance directly to Fellows on submission of rent receipts (in original) to the Participating Institutions who will verify and forward the same to the Ministry for reimbursement.

> **Settling Allowance:**


  - A Fellow from outstation will be given, if required, a lump sum grant of ₹1.00 lakh as settling allowance for packing/transportation, etc., of his personal belongings from the old station to the new station of his stay during the tenure of Fellowship, if he moves station or otherwise transports books and academic effects.
  - Allowance of an equal amount will also be given at the conclusion of the Fellowship for moving out of station. On a case-to-case basis, economy airfare from his/her place/country of residence will be provided/reimbursed upon joining and at the conclusion of the Fellowship. In this regard, Non-MoC Institutions will bear the expenditure and thereafter seek reimbursement from the Ministry after submission of certified copies of Bills along with justification.

> **Support to Fellows:**


  - Infrastructural support will be provided by the Nodal Institution to the Fellows to enable them to conduct their research. This may include the provision of a computer with peripherals and connectivity, working space in the institution’s premises, providing a congenial atmosphere to carry out research, etc. Other facilities, like appropriate seating arrangements, library facilities, etc., will also be made available.
  - One important advantage of this scheme will be the access of the Fellows to national institutions for study and avail original and rare research material. In respect of foreign fellows engaged under this scheme, necessary political/security clearances from the concerned Ministries/Departments shall be obtained by the Ministry of Culture.
  - Encouragement and financial support may also be given to enable the Fellows to present papers at conferences hosted by the concerned institution or other related organizations and institutions, which will be met out/reimbursed, on an ‘actuals’ basis, with a ceiling of ₹1.00 lakh per annum, provided adequate academic interaction is arranged
Tagore National Fellowship for Cultural.eligibility:
1. Fellows who have sound academic or professional credentials and have made significant contributions to knowledge in their respective fields will be eligible to apply for Tagore National Fellowship.
   1. Preferably the Fellows who have 5 years of experience in conducting/guiding research or the same experience in performing/any other arts can apply for Tagore National Fellowship.
   1. The applicants must have an impressive list of publications into their credit, at least two monographs (single-authored).
   1. Fellows to be engaged must have both the credentials as laid down in the preceding paragraph, as well as a strong reputation in the field covered by the Nodal Institution.
   1. Those who have in the past directly engaged with major projects at the Nodal Institution and fulfilled the above-mentioned eligibility criteria for a Tagore Fellow are encouraged to apply for the Tagore National Fellowship.
   1. Once awarded a Tagore National Fellowship, a candidate cannot apply again for a Fellowship under this scheme, either at the same or any other institution covered under the Scheme.
   1. The Scheme will be open to both Indian and foreign nationals. However, the proportion of foreigners will not normally exceed one–third of the total fellowships awarded in a year.

**Note 01:** Interested Fellows are required to enclose a research proposal prepared on the guidelines provided in Appendix A.
**Note 02:** Fellows are also required to prepare a short write-up on how the proposed research would be beneficial for the respective nodal institution.
**Note 03:** The honour and the honorarium are both of a very high order; the Institution Level Search-cum-Screening Committee (ILSSC) of the sponsoring institution and the National Selection Committee may keep these in mind while recommending/ selecting the Tagore National Fellows.
**Note 04:** In short, a person selected for the Tagore National Fellowship should be one who has already become a ‘legend’ in his area of work or is regarded very highly. It is appropriate that those who do not come near this description may not apply or be considered for the highest honour and honorarium accorded to a Fellow in India under this Fellowship.
> **Areas of Research and Eligible Projects:**


   1. The selected Fellows will normally work on a project that benefits the Nodal Institution in terms of unraveling its resources. The subject of research should be one that can be usefully pursued with the resources and facilities of the Nodal Institution awarding the Fellowship, though he/she will be free to draw on the resources and facilities of other institutions, as well.
   1. If the subject of research extends to more than one institution or the Fellow otherwise needs to draw upon the resources and facilities of other institution(s), the Nodal Institution awarding the Fellowship would recommend the Fellow to such other institution(s). In rare cases, where two institutions appear to be of almost equal importance to the Fellows, the second institution may be deemed to be the ‘Co-institution’ and the two may sign a Tripartite MoU regarding Intellectual Property, Publication, Credit sharing, facilities, etc. but accounting shall be with the Nodal Institution.
   1. Since the Scheme is focused on unraveling the cultural resources of the Nodal Institution, the project must be driven in that direction, that is, to use substantially the resources of the Nodal Institution. The inputs required for the project should have a very strong linkage with the resources available with the Nodal Institution and (in rare cases) the Co-institution.
   1. At the end of it, the project outcome must be beneficial for the Nodal Institution or co-institution, if any, and must add to the existing knowledge of the institution/subject.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 01:  The Ministry of Culture and/or the concerned institution will widely advertise the Fellowship in the leading national/regional newspapers and on its website (which should give all details) and also disseminate the scheme through professional associations/forums in the relevant fields, so that maximum publicity is accorded to the Scheme. Step 02:  The eligible fellows who can spare time of about two years to do a project based on the resources of any of the participating institutions can only apply during the prescribed timeline mentioned in the advertisement. Step 03:  The candidates may submit their application form , prepared according to the prescribed guidelines of the Scheme, to any one of the Nodal Institutions of his/her choice depending upon the area of research proposed to be undertaken. Step 04:  The candidates may submit their application form along with a biocatalyst of publications and other relevant documents including a write-up on the proposed work (guidelines are in Appendix A), the applicant should enclose a declaration stating that if selected for the Fellowship, he/she will complete the tenure of the Fellowship. Note:  The list of nodal institutions along with the other relevant details of the Scheme and application form is available on the website of the  Ministry of Culture  and Prime Ministers Museum and Library (PMML) (erstwhile Nehru Memorial Museum and Library (NMML) under the Scheme Head of the website. Process of Selection: Step 01:  The received applications will be examined by the Institution Level Search-cum-Screening Committee (ILSSC) constituted by each participating institution for the purposes of this scheme. Step 02:  The applications found worthy of consideration will be shortlisted by the ILSSC. Step 03:  The selection will be based on the relevance of the study, the benefits of the nodal institution from that particular study, and the credentials and reputation of the scholar. Only such proposals may be selected that seek to (a) engage fellows who have achieved national or international recognition and proven acceptance of their work in national/ international circles; (b) bring out resources that are not yet fully out in the public domain; and (c) publish the work for the benefit of the concerned institution. The selection will be done in two stages. Step 04:  The first stage will be of shortlisting of projects and candidates by the ILSSC, according to the criteria broadly specified as part of the Search-cum-Screening process. Apart from considering the applications received, the ILSSC is also expected to adopt a proactive approach to identify relevant projects and search for reputed fellows in that field, contact such fellows, and encourage them to submit their proposals. If the received proposals are not worthy of consideration, the ILSSC need not feel compelled to recommend any proposals for consideration by the NSC. Step 05:  At the second stage, applications/names of short-listed candidates will be considered by the NSC for each institution. Financial Assistance to Former Sports Pe.details: The scheme “Financial Assistance to Former Sports Person of UP” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh to provide financial assistance to sports persons who are old, weak, or facing hardships, under a scheme for the welfare of sports person of the state. Financial assistance is provided to such old sports persons who had brought glory to the name of the state in their youth with their sports performance.
Financial Assistance to Former Sports Pe.benefits:
The following financial assistance will be provided under the scheme:

  - State-level sports persons who have represented the official team of the state: **₹2,000/- per month**  - National level sports persons who have represented the official national team: **₹3,000/- per month**  - International level sports persons who were members of the official national team and represented the country in the Olympics, Commonwealth, Asian games, and World Cup tournaments: **₹5,000/- per month**  - The sports persons awarded with the Arjun award, Dronacharya award, and Khel Ratna award or the sports persons awarded with Padma Shree and Padma Bhushan based on their achievements in the sports field: **₹20,000/- per month**
Financial Assistance to Former Sports Pe.eligibility:
1. The sportsperson should be a domicile of Uttar Pradesh.
   1. The sports persons who are old, weak, or facing hardships and whose monthly income from all sources is not more than ₹10,000/- are eligible to apply under the scheme.

application process.process: Step 01:  To avail of the benefit of this scheme, the applicant can  download  the application form from the  official website  of the Department of Sports, Government of Uttar Pradesh. Step 02:  The applicant needs to fill out the application form completely. Step 03:  The duly filled application form along with necessary supporting documents has to be submitted to the respective sports officer of the concerned district.

Observation Home and Special School.details: The scheme “Observation Home and Special School" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Puducherry. The objective of this scheme is to take care of the children who are juvenile delinquents by providing a Home to them where their basic needs are taken care of including general and vocational education and other facilities for enabling them to become useful citizens.
Observation Home and Special School.benefits:
- Free Boarding and Lodging.
- Recreations Like Library, Play Materials With Sufficient Playground Area (Indoor and Outdoor). 
- Once a Year, Various Competitions Are Conducted in Sports, Games, Drawing, Singing, Essay Writing, Etc., the Winners Are Given Prizes During the Annual Day Celebration.
- Educational Tours to Places of Interest Once in a Year.

**NOTE:** Contact the authorities below in case of delay in disbursal of benefits:

- **Puducherry:** The Director, Directorate of Social Welfare, Saradhambal Nagar, Ellaipillaichavadhy, Puducherry. - **Karaikal:** The Collector, Karaikal.- **Mahe/Yanam:** The Regional Administrator, Mahe/Yanam.
Observation Home and Special School.eligibility:
1. The child should be under 18 years of age.
1. The child should be in conflict with the law. 
1. The child should have been admitted to the Juvenile Welfare Board.

Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional.details: "Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional Artists" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Through this scheme, awards are conferred to the participant artists whose works are adjudged outstanding among the entries at the State-level Traditional Art Exhibition conducted by the Kuzhu. The awarded works are put on display for public view in the exhibition. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.
Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional.benefits: Prize Money of ₹5,000/- per artist is given to 10 artists.
Scheme for Giving Awards to Traditional.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an artist.
1. The artist should be a native of Tamil Nadu by continuous residence for not less than 5 years.
1. The artist should be in the field of creating artworks like tanjore paintings, glass paintings, traditional paintings, wood carvings, metal sculptures, etc.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu (Tamil Nadu Fine Arts Academy) and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned staff. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Dinakaran Road, (Greenways Road) Chennai - 600 028 Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). NOTE:  The artist will have to pay an entry fee of ₹10/- along with the filled-up application form.

Scheme of Extending Financial Assistance.details: The "Scheme of Extending Financial Assistance to New Drama Productions" was launched by the Art & Culture Department, Government. of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage the dance-drama art forms and the artists involved in such arts. The scheme provides grants of ₹20,000/- for the production and staging of new Tamil dance dramas based on Tamil arts, literature and culture.
Scheme of Extending Financial Assistance.benefits:
Financial Assistance of upto ₹20,000/-, based on the quality and sceneries of the social, historical, mythological, dramas selected by the expert committee,
> **Number of Instalments**

The financial assistance is provided in four instalments: 

- 30% as the first instalment, given after the selection of the drama by the expert committee.
- 40% as the second instalment, provided three days before the conduct of the drama.
- 20% as the third instalment, released on the day when the drama is staged.
- 10% as the fourth instalment, disbursed after receiving the utilization certificate and certification from the Chartered Accountant.

*The Mandram will bear the expenses towards the rent for the auditorium, sound and light, advertisement and invitation. 
*The expenses relating to the rehearsal of drama, remuneration to the actors, scenes and settings, etc., have to be borne by the drama institution receiving financial assistance.
Scheme of Extending Financial Assistance.eligibility:
- The dramas should reflect the assistance of Tamil art forms, culture, civilization, tradition, society and history. 
- The drama should not be staged in advance. 
- The drama should not show caste, religious, or political animosity.
- No additional dialogues or scenes should be added to the drama scripts without prior approval of the Manram. 
- The drama scripts should be selected by the Manram.

Chetan Chauhan Labor Sports Promotion Sc.details: The Chetan Chauhan Shramik Krida Protsahan Yojana (CCSKPY) stands out as a remarkable initiative launched by the Uttar Pradesh government in 2022. Recognizing the potential for sporting talent to blossom even from underprivileged backgrounds, the scheme bridges the financial gap for the children of registered construction workers. By offering a one-time grant, the CCSKPY empowers these young athletes who have excelled at district, state, national, and even international levels. This financial support proves to be a game-changer, allowing them to focus on rigorous training, acquire necessary equipment, and participate in upcoming competitions. The CCSKPY not only fosters a love for sports among these children but also paves the way for them to achieve recognition and success in the sporting arena, etching their names in the history of Indian athletics.
Chetan Chauhan Labor Sports Promotion Sc.benefits:
Provide financial assistance who have been selected in district, state, national and international sports.

1. District level : ₹25,000/- per son/daughter in lump sum once.
1. State level : ₹50,000/- per son/daughter in lump sum.
1. National level : ₹75,000/- lump sum per son/daughter.
1. International level : ₹1,00,000/- lump sum per son/daughter.
Chetan Chauhan Labor Sports Promotion Sc.eligibility:
1. The worker must be working in an establishment registered under the Factories Act, 1948.
1. The monthly salary (basic salary + dearness allowance) of the worker should not exceed ₹15,000/-.
1. The worker must have worked continuously for at least six months in the establishment/factory and must be in service at the time of applying.
1. The benefit will be admissible to the worker or his two daughters only.
1. The benefit will be admissible to the worker or his two children only.
1. Only those players will be eligible who have been selected on or after March 23, 2021.
1. In case of the female worker herself being a player, she will be given the benefit.

application process.process: Step-1:  Access the official website of the Uttar Pradesh Labour Welfare Board at  https://skpuplabour.in/. Step-2:  Select the "Shramik Application" option from the homepage. Step-3:  For new users, proceed with the " Register New User " option. Fill out the registration form accurately and submit it. The system will generate a unique user ID and password, which will be sent to the registered mobile number. Step-4:  Utilize the provided credentials to log in to the portal. Step-5:  Choose the relevant scholarship scheme from the available options. Diligently complete the application form, ensuring all details are accurate and complete. Upload a recent photograph of the applicant. Finally, submit the application form for further processing. Step-6:  Obtain a printed copy of the duly submitted application form for future reference. Step-7:  Present the application form at the concerned educational institution and the factory/establishment for verification and endorsement. Step-8:  Log in again using the registered user ID and password. Access the "Scheme Application Details" section and upload a scanned copy of the verified application form along with the required supporting documents. Save the information for successful submission. Step-9:  Upon successful verification and validation of the application, the scholarship amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary's bank account. The beneficiary will be notified through an SMS on the registered mobile number. Step-10:  Applicants can track the status of their application by selecting the "Application Status" option on the portal.

Pension Scheme - Folk Artist.details: The "Pension Scheme" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The Tamil Nadu Folk Artist Pension Scheme aims to provide financial support to aged and disabled folk artists who have dedicated significant periods of their lives to the promotion and preservation of folk arts. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Regional Office.
Pension Scheme - Folk Artist.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a registered folk artist.
1. The applicant's age should be 60 years or above. 
1. The artist must have worked continuously in their profession for at least five years.
1. Disabled folk artists (sick and unable to work) who are under 60 but have been registered with the board for five continuous years are eligible for a pension.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the  regional office  and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form VIII & VIIIA from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director/Deputy Director in the regional offices. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Assistant Director/Deputy Director to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). Selection Procedure: The Board shall examine every application for pension and may accept or reject the claim. The decision of the Board is final. Before rejecting a claim, the Board will give the applicant a reasonable opportunity to make a representation.

Tholkappiar Award.details: The scheme &quot;Tholkappiar Award&quot; was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹10,000/- to writers and authors for outstanding research publications in Tamil literature who are natives of the Union Territory of Puducherry either by birth or domicile. The application was accepted offline.
Tholkappiar Award.benefits: - Financial Assistance of ₹10,000/-. with an award and certificate.
Tholkappiar Award.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a writer/author. 1. The applicant should be born in Puducherry or a resident of Puducherry for five years or have continuous residence before the date of application in the jurisdiction to exist. 1. The applicant should submit research books not less than 150 pages. 1. The applicant should submit texts that must have been printed and published as a first edition by December 31 of the specified year. 1. Essays and dissertations submitted for university degrees or examinations are not eligible. 1. A one-time awardee is ineligible to apply for the subsequent four years. 1. The texts submitted for competition should not be an abridgment, adaptation, translation, or paraphrase of another text. 1. Novels, short stories, poetry, drama, travelogues, and collections of essays are not eligible for the Tholkappiar Award. 1. The thesis editor should be in Tamil language only. 1. The thesis submitted for the Tholkappiar Award should be published in the calendar year preceding the year of the award. It should not have been published in the previous year.

Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the superintendent to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). NOTE 1:  Five texts received for the competition cannot be returned for any reason. NOTE 2:  Only application forms sent with the author's signature will be accepted for the competition.

Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize.details: The Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry launched the &quot;Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize&quot; scheme. The objective of this scheme is to provide prizes of ₹10,000/- and 10 awards to authors/writers in the field of novels, short stories, drama, poems &amp; prose in Tamil. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Director of Art and Culture Department.
Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize.benefits:
- Financial Assistance of ₹10,000/-. 
- No. of Awards: 10
Kamban Pugazh Literary Prize.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an author/writer.
1. The applicant should be a native of Puducherry by virtue of birth or continuous residence of not less than five years.
1. The applicant should publish the best novel, short story, drama, poetry and prose.
1. First edition of the book should be published between 1st January and 31st December.
1. The publication must be of creative literature of their own.
1. The book should not be an abridged version of an imitation or translated version of another book or synopsis.
1. The literary critics/ thesis research presented to university degrees or examinations are not eligible for award
1. The author once awarded is not eligible to participate in the award for the next four consecutive years.
1. The books sent for the prize should be those not awarded by other Government / Non-Government Organizations and Voluntary Literary Organizations.

Sports Scholarship Jharkhand.details: The "Sports Scholarship" scheme implemented by the Department of Welfare, Government of Jharkhand, aims to encourage sports participation and promote excellence among Scheduled Tribe students. The scheme provides scholarships, incentives, and sports materials to student-athletes. The District Welfare Office coordinates with local administrations to implement the scheme.
Sports Scholarship Jharkhand.benefits:
> ***Scholarship for Student-Athletes:*** - ₹2,500/- per year for middle and high school students. - ₹3,000/- per year for college-level athletes.
> ***Incentives for Excellence:*** - ₹10,000/- for athletes achieving recognition at the national or international level. - Daily allowance of ₹200/- and second-class rail fare for national/state-level participants. > ***Sports Material:*** - Hockey sticks, badminton rackets, tennis rackets, bows, arrows, tracksuits, shoes, socks, and carrying bags.
> ***Awards for District and State Competitions:*** - Certificates and prizes for top performers in various categories.
**NOTE****:** Support for Below Poverty Line (BPL) Athletes priority access to sports materials and financial assistance.
Sports Scholarship Jharkhand.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a Scheduled Tribe student and a resident of Jharkhand. 
1. The applicant must be studying in a middle school, high school, or college.
1. The applicant must actively participate in state or national-level sports competitions. 
1. The athletes achieving national-level recognition are eligible.
1. The applicant belongs to families below the poverty line are eligible.

Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Welfare Office in consultation with school or college authorities. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Shaktidoot Scheme.benefits:
1. **Financial Support:** Up to ₹25,00,000/- per year for Olympic-level (2020/2024) athletes.   1. **Sports Equipment:** Custom kits and advanced training tools.   1. **Medical Coverage:** ₹5,00,000/- mediclaim and accidental death insurance.   1. **Nutrition and Diet Plans:** Customized diet plans and financial aid for supplementary nutrition.   1. **Psychological Workshops:** Mental training and focus improvement sessions.   1. **International Training and Competition:** Travel and training expenses for global events.   1. **Accommodation and Coaching:** Expert coaching and necessary arrangements for advanced training..
> **Duration of benefits:** The initial duration is 2 years, which can be extended for up to 7 years based on the athlete&#39;s performance and progress.
Shaktidoot Scheme.eligibility:
1. The applicant must have participated in games recognized by the School Games Federation of India or included in the Commonwealth Games, Asian Games, Afro-Asian Games, or Olympics, as determined by a committee appointed by the Government.
   1. The applicant must below 20 years of age.
   1.  The applicant must have won state-level competitions based on their sporting achievements.
   1. The applicant must have achieved success in junior or sub-junior competitions of the open category organized by a recognized All India Federation, prioritized based on their accomplishments.
   1. The applicant must not use banned substances or have any impairment that disqualifies them from participation, as such individuals will be immediately dropped from the scheme.

> **Note:**


   1. The applicant’s sports achievements over the previous two years will be considered for selection under the scheme.
   1. The above criteria for eligibility will be generally taken into account but the committee may decide to grant such players an exceptional status under this scheme in view of the exceptional achievements of any athlete, in order to expand his talent at the international level and to fully develop his abilities.

application process.process: Step-1:  The Sports Authority of Gujarat publishes a public tender in daily newspapers, inviting applications for the scheme. Step-2:  Applicants must ensure they meet the eligibility criteria specified in the scheme before applying. Step-3:  Interested players must fill out the application form and submit it along with the required documents within the specified deadline. Step-4:  The Sports Authority of Gujarat verifies the submitted documents and reviews the applicant’s achievements and qualifications. Step-5:  A committee evaluates the applications based on the applicant’s performance, potential, and adherence to eligibility criteria. Step-6:  Selected applicants are informed through official communication from the Sports Authority of Gujarat. Step-7:  Successful applicants are enrolled in the scheme and begin receiving the specified benefits and support.

Scheme of Financial Assistance to Litera.details: The "Scheme of Financial Assistance to Literary/Educational Institutions for Organizing Programs/Conferences" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide grants to registered institutions for organizing events such as seminars, dialogues, conventions, workshops, and literary festivals. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Sahitya Academy, and financial assistance is disbursed based on actual expenses, subject to a maximum limit. Institutions must comply with language usage norms, use appropriate branding and logos, and submit reports and financial documentation after event completion. Events can be state-level, national, or international, and must involve recognized speakers, literary scholars, and culturally relevant topics.
Scheme of Financial Assistance to Litera.benefits: > **Funding Assistance for Institutions:** - Up to ₹50,000/- or 75% of the actual expenditure, whichever is lower, is provided for organizing approved literary or educational events. > **Honorarium for Speakers:** - An honorarium of up to ₹2,000/- per speaker can be paid to invited speakers participating in the event. > **Note:** - Any honorarium amount exceeding ₹2,000/- will not be reimbursed by the Gujarat Sahitya Academy and must be borne by the organizing institution. - Events must be reported with bills, photos, invitation cards, and video recordings.
Scheme of Financial Assistance to Litera.eligibility: 1. A registered literary or educational institution shall be eligible. 1. Only 2 programs can organize per year by the institution. 1. The program must be related to literature, education, or cultural discourse. 1. The institution must use the Gujarati language in all materials (alongside any other language). 1. The event must clearly acknowledge Gujarat Sahitya Academy through logos and name placement. 1. The program must involve a minimum 5 speakers. 1. All payments above ₹5,000/- must be made through banking channels only (RTGS/NEFT/Cheque).

District Level Sports School.details: Launched in 2013-14, the scheme "District Level Sports School" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide intensive sports training and quality education to young athletes by establishing district-level sports schools under a Public-Private Partnership (PPP) model. The scheme seeks to identify sporting talent from events such as Khel Mahakumbh and train them using modern infrastructure, scientific methods, expert coaching, and proper nutrition, while ensuring access to formal school education. The initiative began with 9 schools (6 residential and 3 non-residential), and expanded to 24 schools by 2017-18, catering to over 2,500 students in 21 sports disciplines. Selected athletes receive benefits such as accommodation, food, school uniforms, books, sports kits, and equipment. An average of ₹2.25 lakh is spent per player annually, including ₹1 lakh Mediclaim security. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat (SAG).
District Level Sports School.benefits: > **Monetary Support & Facilities:** - Players are provided with free education, stationery, books, accommodation, meals, school uniforms, and modern sports equipment and kits. > **Medical Insurance:** - A Mediclaim security cover of up to ₹1,00,000/- is provided to each selected athlete. > **Expert Coaching & Training:** - Intensive sports training is imparted in morning and evening sessions by expert coaches. In-school players receive additional training in 5 Physical Training (PT) periods.
District Level Sports School.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be below 14 years of age. 1. The applicant must qualify under one of the following categories: - **Proven Talent (PT):** 1. The applicant should have already performed at School Games Federation of India (SGFI), State-level, or National-level sports events. 1. The applicant must participate in a selection camp for final admission. - **Young Talent (YT):** 1. The applicant should have participated and secured first place at Taluka/District/Corporation level in Khel Mahakumbh (Under-9 or Under-11 category). 1. The applicant must register for Khel Mahakumbh and undergo the selection process. - **In-School Talent:** 1. The applicant should be identified within a school already running the DLSS program.

Cash Award to Women Players of the State.details: The scheme "Cash Award to Women Players of the State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote participation of women in sports and recognize their achievements by awarding them cash incentives for outstanding performance in state-level and national-level competitions. Female athletes securing the first, second, or third position in individual or team sports at the state level, or representing Gujarat at national competitions, receive annual scholarships based on their rank and category. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.
Cash Award to Women Players of the State.benefits: - **First Position (Individual & Team Sports at State Level/ National Representation):** ₹4,800/- per year - **Second Position (Individual & Team Sports at State Level):** ₹3,600/- per year - **Third Position (Individual Sports at State Level):** ₹2,400/- per year
Cash Award to Women Players of the State.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a woman. 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant should have passed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination. 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should have secured first, second, or third position in individual or collective sports competitions held at the state level. 1. The applicant should have represented Gujarat state in national-level sports competitions. 1. The applicant’s accomplishment must have occurred within the respective financial year.

Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of.details: The scheme "Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of Fine Arts" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to nurture artistic talent and provide financial support for experimental, research-based, or revival-focused projects in the fields of painting, sculpture, and graphic arts. The scheme benefits both junior and senior artists of Gujarat by awarding them monthly stipends, thereby helping them undertake advanced training, revive endangered Indian or folk arts, and develop their careers in art. Under this scheme, 5 senior artists will be provided with a monthly stipend of ₹3,000/-, and 10 junior artists will be provided with a monthly stipend of ₹2,000/- for one year. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy.
Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of.benefits: - **Fellowship for Senior Artists:** ₹3,000/-per month. - **Fellowship for Junior Artists:** ₹2,000/- per month.
Junior/Senior Fellowship in the Field of.eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident artist of Gujarat. - The applicant should be actively engaged in the field of painting, sculpture, or graphic arts.

Khel Mahakumbh.details: Launched in 2010, the scheme "Khel Mahakumbh" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to foster sportsmanship, encourage mass participation in sporting events, and recognize talent across all age groups through free sports services, structured competitions, and significant monetary rewards. The scheme has witnessed continuous growth in participation since its inception and provides opportunities for outstanding performers to benefit from further sports training and development schemes under the Sports Authority of Gujarat. The scheme is implemented by the Sports Authority of Gujarat.
Khel Mahakumbh.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** Winners of competitions receive cash prizes worth ₹45,00,00,000/- in total.
Khel Mahakumbh.eligibility: - The applicant should be a native of Gujarat or should have been studying, residing, working, or doing business in Gujarat for the past 2 years. - Students must participate from the taluka/district where their school or college is located. - Employees transferred from other states are eligible if their transfer to the district occurred at least 6 months before the date of registration. **Note:** The applicant can register for a maximum of 2 sports only.

application process.process: Participation Flow: School/college students to register via their respective institutions. Non-students can register via the District Sports Training Center. Trekking in Forest Area (Scheduled Caste.details: The scheme "Trekking in Forest Area" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to instill a deep love for nature, pristine landscapes, wild animals and birds, trees, mountains, springs, and ravines among the youth of the state by directly engaging them in a forest trekking experience. Under this initiative, a forest area rotation program is conducted for 100 selected young men and women, giving them immersive exposure to natural surroundings and biodiversity.
Trekking in Forest Area (Scheduled Caste.benefits: - **Nature Immersion Experience:** The selected beneficiaries will have the opportunity to participate in a guided forest trekking program designed to foster a love for nature and environmental awareness. - **Exposure to Biodiversity:** Participants will get firsthand experience of pristine natural sites including forests, wildlife, birds, trees, springs, mountains, and ravines.
Trekking in Forest Area (Scheduled Caste.eligibility: - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. - The applicant should be between 14 and 35 years of age.

Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal.details: The "Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal and Scheduled Caste Youth" scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote adventure, enhance physical fitness, and tap into the latent potential of youth from Scheduled Castes (SC) and Scheduled Tribes (ST). Under this scheme, a basic rock climbing training program has been organized for 100 youth since 2010-2011, with the aim of improving physical capacity, fostering an adventurous spirit, and bringing out the latent potential in youth belongs to scheduled caste and Scheduled Tribe.
Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal.benefits: - **Adventure Training Course:** Free-of-cost basic rock climbing training for selected SC/ST youth.- **Skill Development:** Enhances physical fitness, endurance, mental strength, and leadership qualities.- **Capacity Building:** Promotes team spirit and encourages youth to participate in national adventure initiatives.
Basic Rock Climbing Training for Tribal.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category. 1. The applicant must be between 18 and 35 years of age.

Personality Development and Yogasana Tra.details: The scheme "TASP Personality Development and Yogasana Training Camp (TASP)" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to empower Scheduled Tribe (ST) youth across 17 districts of the state by providing a structured seven-day training program. This camp focuses on personality development and yogasana training, helping the participants to develop their physical, mental, and spiritual health. The scheme seeks to uplift tribal youth through skill-building and self-improvement techniques in a culturally inclusive and health-oriented environment.
Personality Development and Yogasana Tra.benefits: - **Training and Development:** The scheme offers a seven-day residential training camp focused on personality development and yogasana. The training covers aspects of physical fitness, mental well-being, and spiritual awareness. > **Note:** A total of 50 tribal youths (both male and female) are selected from each of the 17 targeted districts.
Personality Development and Yogasana Tra.eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.

Production of Audio Albums of songs on P.details: The scheme "Production of Audio Albums of songs on Patriotism & National Integration" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to strengthen the values of Patriotism & National Integration among members of Tiatr fraternity, addressing the problem that audio albums of Konkani songs of Patriotism & National Integration are rarely produced in Goa despite numerous audio albums of songs (Kantaram) in Konkani being produced. The scheme provides financial support as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for the production of audio albums containing at least 10 songs of Patriotism & National Integration and distribution of 300 copies to schools and groups participating in various competitions. The applicant must be a tiatr artiste (commercial or non-commercial). The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Production of Audio Albums of songs on P.benefits:
##### ***Financial Support*** Tiatr Academy of Goa will give financial support as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for the production of the Album. ##### ***Distribution Channel*** Tiatr Academy of Goa will distribute 300 copies to schools & groups which participate in its various competitions and may also offer them to other schools, groups, individuals, etc. who are interested in promoting Patriotism & National Integration. ##### ***Commercial Rights*** The applicant is free to sell the remaining Compact Discs. ##### ***Sponsorship Permission*** The applicant may take sponsorship to meet the cost of production of Album. ##### ***Quality Assurance*** Lyrics will be scrutinized by the Recommendation Committee appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa with advisory support to improve quality.
**Conditions** _*The applicant must produce the Audio album strictly following the specified norms._ _*Melody and musical arrangement must be appropriate to the content of the song._ _*Lyrics must be approved by the Recommendation Committee._ _*Official letter of acceptance must be obtained from Tiatr Academy of Goa before production._
Production of Audio Albums of songs on P.eligibility: - The applicant must be a tiatr artiste (commercial as well as non-commercial). - The applicant must submit a typed copy of lyrics of songs to Tiatr Academy of Goa along with the application form. - The applicant must obtain approval of lyrics from the Recommendation Committee appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must receive official letter of acceptance from Tiatr Academy of Goa before production. - The applicant must not make any adverse remark in any form either written or verbal against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the lyrics of songs which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. ##### ***Album Content Requirements*** - The audio album must include at least 10 songs of Patriotism & National Integration. - The album should not have solo songs only. - 50% of the songs must be group songs and children's songs. - Melody and musical arrangement must be appropriate to the content of the song. - The applicant will have to give 300 copies of Audio albums to Tiatr Academy of Goa. ##### ***Quality Control Process*** - Lyrics will be scrutinized by the Recommendation Committee. - Committee will be free to advise the lyricists to improve the quality of lyrics. - Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to disapprove the lyrics as per the opinion given by Recommendation Committee.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment. *The application must be submitted to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa at least 30 days in advance of the proposed programme date. *Applications are considered on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds. Post-Application Processes Step 1: Lyrics Scrutiny & Committee Feedback The applicant must wait for the Recommendation Committee appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to scrutinize the submitted lyrics, during which the committee may advise improvements to enhance the quality of lyrics and ensure alignment with patriotism and national integration themes. The applicant must incorporate any suggestions or improvements recommended by the Recommendation Committee to enhance the quality of lyrics, ensuring the content meets the required standards for patriotism and national integration themes. Step 2: Official Approval & Acceptance Letter The applicant must wait for the final decision from Tiatr Academy of Goa, as the academy reserves the right to disapprove the lyrics based on the opinion given by the Recommendation Committee, and will issue an official letter of acceptance if the lyrics are approved. The applicant must obtain the official letter of acceptance from Tiatr Academy of Goa confirming approval of the lyrics before proceeding with the production of the audio album, as this letter is mandatory for proceeding to the production phase. Step 3: Album Production & Financial Support The applicant must plan the production of the audio album strictly following the approved norms including minimum 10 songs, ensuring 50% are group and children's songs, and that melody and musical arrangement are appropriate to the content of each song. The applicant must coordinate with Tiatr Academy of Goa to receive the financial support as decided by the academy for the production of the album, and may also arrange additional sponsorship to meet the complete cost of production if needed. Step 4: Produce Audio Album & Submit Required Copies The applicant must produce the audio album following all specified norms and quality standards, ensuring professional recording quality and appropriate musical arrangements that complement the patriotic and national integration themes of the songs. The applicant must provide 300 copies of the completed audio albums to Tiatr Academy of Goa as per the scheme requirements, which will be used by the academy for distribution to schools and groups participating in various competitions. Step 5: Complete Documentation The applicant must ensure all production documentation is complete and maintain records of the album production process, quality standards met, and compliance with all scheme norms for future reference and verification.

Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities.details: The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to support cultural institutions and individuals in organizing various activities related to tiatr in their respective villages and towns to preserve and promote the traditional Konkani theatrical art form. The scheme provides financial support for organizing Konkani musical shows, singing competitions, acting competitions, one act plays, and programs celebrating the contribution of local tiatr artists both deceased and living but non-active, while ensuring these activities are made accessible to the public free of charge. The applicant must be a cultural institution or individual willing to organize tiatr-related activities and must submit applications within specified advance notice periods ranging from 8 to 30 days depending on the activity type. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed application forms available at the Tiatr Academy of Goa office.
Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities.benefits: ##### ***Financial Support Categories*** - ***Category A1*** ***- Konkani Musical Shows:*** Financial assistance for organizing shows with minimum 14 songs including duets, trios, quartets, choral songs, solos and at least 2 comedy skits.- ***Category A2*** ***- Singing Competitions:*** Financial assistance for organizing competitions with minimum 15 participants singing newly composed kantaram.- ***Category B1*** ***- Competitions:*** Financial assistance for acting competitions including monologue, dialogue, and one act play competitions.- ***Category B2*** ***- Celebrating Tiatr Artists:*** Financial assistance for organizing programs to remember and felicitate prominent tiatr artists. ##### ***Conditions*** - Programs must be staged free of charge to the public. - All promotional materials must acknowledge collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Backdrop of minimum size 6 feet x 10 feet displaying Tiatr Academy of Goa logo is mandatory. - No adverse remarks against any governments, individuals, institutions, or content against caste, creed, and religion permitted. - Chief Guest and Guest of Honour must be decided in consultation with Tiatr Academy of Goa. - President or Vice President of Tiatr Academy of Goa will be the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour.
Promotion of Tiatr Related Activities.eligibility: - The applicant must be a cultural institution or individual organizing tiatr-related activities in Goa. - The applicant must organize activities in their respective villages or towns. - The applicant must ensure the program is staged free of charge to the public. - The applicant must agree to acknowledge Tiatr Academy of Goa collaboration in all promotional materials. - The applicant must ensure content does not contain adverse remarks against governments, individuals, institutions, or content against caste, creed, and religion. ***For Konkani Musical Shows*** - The applicant must ensure lyrics are newly composed and not recorded on any Audio/Video/Digital Versatile Disc Albums. - The applicant must arrange a band with minimum 5 instruments including drums, keyboard, guitar and 2 blowing instruments. - The applicant must organize minimum 14 songs including interactive duets, duos, trios, quartets/quintets, choral songs, solos and at least 2 comedy skits. - The applicant must submit typed lyrics and skit scripts at least 30 days in advance. ***For Singing Competitions*** - The applicant must ensure minimum 15 participants. - The applicant must ensure participants sing newly composed kantaram not recorded on any Audio/Video/Digital Versatile Disc Albums. - The applicant must arrange a band with minimum 5 instruments including drums, keyboard, guitar and 2 blowing instruments. - The applicant must provide competition rules to Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must submit typed song lyrics at least 8 days in advance. ***For Other Competitions*** - The applicant must submit application form at least 30 days in advance. ***For Celebrating Tiatr Artists*** - The applicant must focus on prominent tiatr artists such as actors, singers, writers. - The applicant must submit application form at least 15 days in advance.

Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Annivers.details: The scheme "Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Anniversaries of Tiatr Artistes of Yesteryears" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to make our younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of Tiatr artistes of yesteryears. The scheme provides for organizing functions to celebrate jubilee/birth anniversaries of deceased Tiatr artistes, including wide publicity through print and electronic media, display and garlanding of portraits, cultural programmes (tiatr and songs), and financial assistance along with provision of auditoriums/halls and additional amounts for village programmes. Applications for this scheme are accepted at least 30 days in advance on a "First come First Serve" basis, subject to the availability of funds.
Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Annivers.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** An amount as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa.- **Auditorium/Hall Provision:** Provision of an auditorium or hall by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to stage the programme.- **Additional Financial Assistance for Village Programmes:** An additional amount as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for hall charges or stage erection charges if the programme is held in a village.- **Programme Staging:** A maximum of 4 shows at 4 different places, including 3 shows in Panaji, Margao, Curchorem, Vasco, or any other city, and 1 show compulsorily staged in the artiste’s area of residence.- **Optional Additional Shows:** An additional 2 shows may be granted for performance in villages only, subject to the availability of funds, at an amount (as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa) plus an additional amount (as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa) for Pandal/Hall/Auditorium including Stage, Sound, etc..- **Publicity:** Wide publicity will be given through print and electronic media.- **Banner Provision:** One banner for Tiatr performances, to be collected from and returned to the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa, must be displayed on the front side wing of the stage.
Commemoration of Jubilees/Birth Annivers.eligibility: - The applicant must be an organizing institution or an individual. - The applicant must propose a programme to celebrate jubilee/birth anniversaries of artistes of yesteryears who are no longer living. - The applicant must ensure the programme aims to make the younger generation aware of the contribution and sacrifices of these Tiatr artistes. - The applicant must ensure the programme includes the narration of the history of the life of the late artiste to whom the programme is dedicated. - The applicant must ensure the family members of the deceased artiste are compulsorily invited for the function. - The applicant must give the proposal well in advance, providing all details of the programme, including typed script and lyrics to be presented, and the names of the artistes. - The applicant must insert/publish/announce "This programme is held in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa" in all advertisements, whether oral, print, or electronic media, and on banners. - The applicant must display the Tiatr Academy of Goa’s banner on the front side wing of the stage if it is a Tiatr, and return it after all shows. - The applicant must display a banner of minimum size 6ft.x10 ft. carrying the Tiatr Academy of Goa’s logo as a back drop if it is a Musical Show. - The applicant must discuss with the Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide about the Chief Guest/Guest of Honour well in advance. - The applicant must ensure the President/Vice President of the Tiatr Academy of Goa will either be the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour at the function. - The applicant must ensure the duration of the programme is at least 2 hours. - The applicant must ensure there are no adverse remarks made in any form, either written or verbal, against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting religious sentiments.

Tiatr Research Scholarship Program.details: The scheme "Tiatr Research Scholarship Program" was launched by the Tiatr Academy (TAG) under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage young students to undertake research in different aspects of Tiatr, its song, and music. The scheme provides scholarships to college and university students for research related to Tiatr, which must be conducted in English and Konkani (Roman script only). It also includes the publication of the approved research work in book form by TAG, with 100 copies provided to the student concerned in addition to the scholarship amount. The applicant must submit a report of the research carried out duly signed by either the guide or the head of the institution.
Tiatr Research Scholarship Program.benefits: > ***Scholarship Amount*** The amount of each scholarship will be decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) from time to time. > ***Publication of Research Work*** The research work of the students will be printed by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) in book form after approval by the Recommendation Board. > ***Copies of Published Work*** Each student concerned will receive 100 copies of their printed research work in addition to the scholarship amount. > ***Number of Scholarships*** TAG will offer scholarships in three categories every year: ◦ PhD: 1 scholarship ◦ Post-Graduation: 3 scholarships ◦ Graduation: 6 scholarships _*Scholarships will be for every academic year._ _*A scholarship will be given only once in a particular category; however, the same applicant is free to apply for other categories in subsequent academic years._
Tiatr Research Scholarship Program.eligibility: - The applicant must be a bonafide student who does research work or a project related to Tiatr. - The applicant must conduct research work in English and Konkani (Roman script only). - The applicant should have secured at least 50% marks in the last examination. - The applicant must submit a report of the research carried out, duly signed either by the guide or the head of the institution.

Promotion of Patriotism/National Integra.details: The scheme "Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Interschool Choreographic Dance Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to inculcate values of patriotism, national integration, and communal harmony in children through an inter-school competition of choreographic dancing on Konkani songs focused on these themes. The scheme provides monetary prizes ranging from ₹3,000/- to ₹10,000/- along with mementos and certificates for winners, and traveling allowances ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹4,000/- based on distance traveled by participating groups. The applicant must be an educational institution with a dance group consisting of not less than 6 or more than 10 dancers and must perform on only one patriotic song in Konkani. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline with the submission of a physical application form along with a recorded copy of the song on Compact Disc.
Promotion of Patriotism/National Integra.benefits: ##### ***Monetary Benefits*** **Prize Money for Standard 1st-4th Category** - 1st Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. - 2nd Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. - 3rd Prize: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. - Best Choreographer: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. **Prize Money for Standard 5th-10th Category** - 1st Prize: ₹10,000/- plus memento and certificate. - 2nd Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. - 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. - Best Choreographer: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. **Traveling Allowance** - Groups from within 10 kilometers radius: ₹2,000/-. - Groups from more than 10 kilometers and less than 20 kilometers: ₹3,000/-. - Groups from 20 kilometers or more distance: ₹4,000/-. ##### ***Non-Monetary Benefits*** - Mementos and certificates for all prize winners. - Refreshments provided for participants and their in-charge. - Recognition and exposure through inter-school competition platform.
Promotion of Patriotism/National Integra.eligibility: - The applicant must be an educational institution. - The applicant must form a dance group consisting of not less than 6 dancers. - The applicant must form a dance group consisting of not more than 10 dancers. - The applicant must choose to participate in either Standard 1st-4th category or Standard 5th-10th category. - The applicant must perform on only one patriotic song in Konkani language. - The applicant must not use fusion of different songs in their performance. - The applicant must provide a recorded copy of the song on Compact Disc along with the application form. ***Compliance Requirements*** - The applicant must read and understand all rules and regulations of the organization. - The applicant must abide by all competition rules and regulations. - The applicant must accept that the decision of the panel of judges will be final and binding. - The applicant must accept that Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules.

Children's Tiatr Competition.details: The scheme "Children's Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage the development of Tiatr by providing a platform for children aged up to 16 years to participate in traditional Konkani theatre productions, addressing the growing enthusiasm among students and individuals to involve children in Tiatr activities. The scheme provides financial support to participating groups and awards mementos and certificates across multiple categories including best performance, individual artistes, direction, technical aspects, and musical components. The applicant must ensure all child performers are aged 16 years or below on the application submission date and themes must be compulsorily based on the lives of children only. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed application forms.
Children's Tiatr Competition.benefits: - Financial support as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Financial assistance covers expenditure towards Music (Live Band with at least two blowing instruments), Light Effects, Stage Setting, Background Music, Make up, Costumes, Refreshments for rehearsals, and Transport. - All payments made by cheques in the name of the Educational Institutions, Sports and Cultural Associations, or Individual Producer. - Free DVD copy of the recorded performance provided to the producer or director. - Mementos and certificates awarded to winners in different categories (No Cash Prizes). - Video recording of all tiatrs for preservation in Tiatr Academy of Goa Library. - First three award winners of the previous year's Children Tiatr Competition get direct entry into the festival.
Children's Tiatr Competition.eligibility: - The applicant must be an Educational Institution, Sports and Cultural Association, or Individual Producer. - The applicant must ensure all child performers are aged up to 16 years on the date fixed for submission of application. - The applicant must ensure themes of Tiatr are compulsorily based on the lives of children only. - The applicant must ensure the duration of the tiatr is not less than one hour and a half and not more than two hours and a half (including interval of minimum 10 minutes and maximum 15 minutes). - The applicant must present the Tiatr in the traditional format as approved by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must ensure the Tiatr has 6 to 7 acts (podd'dde) with at least 4 cantos. - The applicant must ensure comedy is linked to the story of the play. - The applicant must include at least 8 Kantaram which should include 1 duet (Interactive), 1 Duo (Interactive), 1 Trio (Interactive), 1 Quartet/Quintet (Interactive), 1 Choral Song and Solos. > ***Priority*** - The first three award winners of the previous year's Children Tiatr Competition will get a direct entry into this festival, provided their entries are received before due date. > ***Other Conditions*** - Not more than 2 shows of the given script must have been performed prior to the performance at the competition. - No adverse remarks against any Governments, Individuals, Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion in the scripts, lyrics of songs, performances, or speeches. - Artistes including technicians and backstage artistes whose names appear in the submitted list shall be permitted to participate only under that troupe (Only musicians can take part in more than one troupe).

Popular Tiatr Competition.details: The scheme "Popular Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to bring about all round development of Popular Tiatr by organizing annual competitions in different parts of Goa, preserving and promoting the traditional format of tiatr performances. The scheme provides cash prizes ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹2,00,000/- for various categories including performance, direction, acting, singing, and technical aspects, along with mementos and certificates for winners. The applicant must have completed at least 5 performances including Kantaram during the period from 1st April 2018 to 31st December 2018 and must perform in specified auditoriums across Goa. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline through submission of application forms along with required documents.
Popular Tiatr Competition.benefits:
##### ***Cash Prizes for Performance Categories*** 1st Prize: ₹2,00,000/- and Memento; 2nd Prize: ₹1,50,000/- and Memento; 3rd Prize: ₹1,00,000/- and Memento ##### ***Individual Artist Awards (Acting)*** - 1st Prize (Male): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Male): ₹5,000/- - 1st Prize (Female): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Female): ₹5,000/- - Best Comedian (Male): ₹10,000/-; Best Comedian (Female): ₹10,000/- - Best Supporting Artist (Male): ₹5,000/-; Best Supporting Artist (Female): ₹5,000/- - Best Actor in Negative Role (Male): ₹5,000/-; Best Actor in Negative Role (Female): ₹5,000/- ##### ***Best Direction Awards*** 1st Prize: ₹15,000/-; 2nd Prize: ₹10,000/-; 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/- ##### ***Technical and Other Aspects*** - Best Setting: ₹10,000/-; Best Light Effects: ₹10,000/- - Best Live Music: ₹15,000/- (To be shared by all Musicians) - Best Make-up: ₹5,000/-; Best Costumes: ₹5,000/- - Best Background Music: ₹10,000/- ##### ***Best Singer Awards (Solo)*** - 1st Prize (Male): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Male): ₹5,000/- - 1st Prize (Female): ₹10,000/-; 2nd Prize (Female): ₹5,000/- - Child Artist (Male): ₹2,000/-; Child Artist (Female): ₹2,000/- ##### ***Best Actor (Child Artists)*** Child Artist (Male): ₹2,000/-; Child Artist (Female): ₹2,000/- ##### ***Other Songs Categories*** - Best Duet: ₹10,000/-; Best Duo: ₹10,000/-; Best Trio: ₹15,000/- - Best Quartet/Quintet: ₹20,000/- - Best Choral Song (Maximum four singers): ₹10,000/- - Best Comedy Kantar (solo): ₹5,000/- ##### ***Script and Lyrics Awards*** - Best Lyrics (1st Prize): ₹5,000/- - Best Script (1st Prize): ₹10,000/- - Best Script (2nd Prize): ₹5,000/- ##### ***Additional Benefits*** - Performance Fee: ₹5,000/- (only if the applicant gives consent to video record the performance). - Free DVD Copy: One copy of the performance recording will be provided to the applicant. - Video Recording: Expenditure on video recording will be borne by Tiatr Academy of Goa.
_*Awards will be announced and distributed in a specially organized Award Distribution Ceremony._ _*All prizes are one-time cash awards._
Popular Tiatr Competition.eligibility: - The applicant must have completed at least 5 performances including Kantaram during the period from 1st April to 31st December. - The applicant must perform in specified auditoriums including Ravindra Bhavan Margao, Gomant Vidya Niketan Margao, Hanuman Natyagraha Mapusa, Kala Academy Panjim, Rajiv Gandhi Kala Mandir Ponda, Ravindra Bhavan Vasco, Ravindra Bhavan Sanquelim, or Ravindra Bhavan Curchorem. - The applicant must present popular tiatrs having traditional format of the tiatr. - The applicant must maintain the traditional format strictly as specified. - The applicant must communicate the date, time and place of staging of the tiatr in the competition to the organizers at least 15 days in advance from the date of performance. - The applicant must arrange for 6 passes for the Judges and the Organizers at the performance of the Competition show. - The applicant must ensure live music with a band consisting of at least 5 instruments which shall include drums, keyboard, bass, guitar and 2 blowing instruments. - (Optional) The applicant may include child artists up to 12 years of age for special awards in singing and acting. ***Other Conditions*** - The tiatr must be strictly presented as per the given traditional format wherever it is staged. - If the format is not maintained, the tiatr will not be eligible for 1st, 2nd and 3rd prize, however individual prizes will be given for deserving artists. - The decision to award or not to award the prizes shall depend entirely on the recommendations of the panel of judges. - Political songs should be performed without exceeding the limits of freedom of expression, and criticizing individuals by taking name or displaying images or character assassination will not be allowed.
Popular Tiatr Competition.exclusions: - The applicant cannot include Kantaram presented in the Kala Academy Tiatr Competitions in the Popular Tiatr Competition, unless a tiatr from the Kala Academy's Competition is admitted in the Popular Tiatr Competition. - The applicant cannot participate artists including technicians and backstage artists in more than one group and one Tiatr, however musicians and stage setting personnel can participate in more than 2 Tiatrs.
