Gen Next Competition.details: The "Gen Next Competition" scheme was launched by the Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles, and Khadi Dept, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to ensure that the traditional handicrafts of Tamil Nadu survive and are passed on to the next generation, it is necessary to enthuse the youngsters in the field. To achieve this, a craft competition was introduced from the year 2013-2014 onwards for artisans below 30 years of age.
Gen Next Competition.benefits:
- Cash Prize of ₹2,000/-.
- Silver Medal. 
- Certificate.
Gen Next Competition.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be an Artisan. 1. The applicant should be a native of Tamil Nadu. 1. The applicant should be below 30 years of age. 1. Handicraft competitions will be conducted in the following 16 types of handicrafts: Panchaloka Idols, Brass Lamps and Brass Artifacts, Thanjavur Paintings, Thanjavur Plates, Wood Carvings, Stone Sculptures, Fire Clay Sculptures, Applique and Kalamkari work, Paper Pulp Toys, Weaving, Bamboo and Palm Leaf Products, Neti Work, Fiber Products, Temple jewelry, Image Stitching Work, Other Handicrafts. 1. The examination will be conducted based on places of prominence in handicraft industries. The center and date of the exam will be announced later.

Financial Assistance to Indigent Artiste.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Indigent Artistes" was launched by the Arts and Culture Department, Puducherry. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month to indigent artists aged 50 years and above and contributions to music, dance, drama, folk, painting and sculpture etc. The indigent artists resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry either by birth or by domicile.
Financial Assistance to Indigent Artiste.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be an indigent artist. 
1. The applicant's age should be 50 years and above. 
1. The annual income is less than ₹24,000/-. 
1. The applicant should contribute to music, dance, drama, folk, painting, and sculpture. 
1. The applicant should not be the recipient of any other assistance from any other Organizations.
1. The applicant should be a resident of the Union Territory of Puducherry either by birth or by domicile.
1. The applicant’s wife/children shall be eligible to receive assistance after the death of the indigent artist.

The scheme aims to provide prizes of ₹50,000/- and 30 awards to artists or authors/writers in the fields of Literature, Music, Dance, Drama, Painting and Sculpture, and Folk arts. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Director of Art and Culture Department.

The scheme aims to provide cash awards to coaches who train athletes and teams to achieve excellence in national and international competitions under the Jharkhand Sports Policy, 2022.

Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogi.details: The scheme “Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide an opportunity for personnel from various government departments of the state to participate annually in the All-India level competitions in various sports, organized by the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, Government of India.
Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogi.benefits: There is a provision to provide travel allowance, accommodation allowance, food allowance, sports kits, and other necessary support to all players and team members participating in the 'Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita', in accordance with departmental standards.
Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogi.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be an employee of a government department in Uttarakhand.

application process.process: Selection trials for the competition are conducted at the district and state levels, and the selected players are given the opportunity to participate in the Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita. Every year, approximately 150 personnel from various government departments of Uttarakhand benefit from this scheme by participating in the All-India Level Competition in various sports, organized by the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances, and Pensions, Government of India, for Central and State Government employees.

Financial Assistance for Scaling Mount E.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance for Scaling Mount Everest and Other Inaccessible Mountains of the World" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to encourage and reward mountaineers who demonstrate extraordinary courage and determination by scaling some of the most difficult mountain peaks in the world. The scheme offers tiered financial assistance based on the height and difficulty of the peak climbed, ranging from ₹50,000 to ₹15,00,000, with the maximum incentive awarded to individuals who successfully scale Mt. Everest. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner, Youth Services and Cultural Activities, Gandhinagar.
Financial Assistance for Scaling Mount E.benefits: > **Financial Support for Mountaineers:** - Financial assistance ranging from ₹50,000/- to ₹10,00,000/- is provided to individuals depending on the height and difficulty of the mountain scaled. - A maximum of ₹15,00,000/- is provided to those who successfully climb Mount Everest.
Financial Assistance for Scaling Mount E.eligibility: > **Eligibility Criteria for Adventurer:** - The applicant should have successfully scaled Mount Everest or other inaccessible mountains of the world. - The applicant should be aged between 18 to 45 years as on 31st December of the respective year. - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat, Mount Abu, or any other Indian state. - The applicant from Gujarat or Mount Abu should have completed a coaching course from the Swami Vivekananda Mountaineering Institute, Mount Abu. - The applicant must be physically and mentally fit. - The applicant must not have any criminal record. - The applicant who has already participated once in the camp during the same year will not be allowed to participate again. > **Eligibility Criteria for Coach or Instructor:** - The applicant should have provided services in Artificial Rock Climbing Courses or Coaching Courses held at Mount Abu. - The applicant must have completed the Method of Instructor Course and Search and Rescue Course. - The applicant should possess sufficient mountaineering experience and certifications relevant to instructing rock climbing activities. > **Eligibility Criteria for Subject Experts:** - The applicant must be one of the following: - A subject expert or experienced individual from any Ministry or Department of the Government. - A representative of an international or national mountaineering association or institution recognized by the government. - A person who has received National or International awards/medals or has similar significant achievements in mountaineering from recognized associations. > **Note:** Preference will be given to applicants who are participating for the first time.

Gaurav Puraskar Award.details: The scheme "Gaurav Puraskar Award" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and encourage individuals who have demonstrated excellence in the fields of music, dance, drama, and folk art through a combination of financial and honorary benefits. The scheme confers a cash award of ₹1,000/-, a trophy, and a letter of appreciation to 12 deserving artistes every year. It also facilitates opportunities for awardees to contribute to state-sponsored cultural events and festivals in various expert capacities. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy.
Gaurav Puraskar Award.benefits: > **Cash Prize:** - Each awardee receives a cash prize of ₹1,000/-. > **Honorary Recognition:** - Awardees are presented with a trophy and a letter of appreciation. > **Post-Award Engagement:** - Awardees may be included as members in committees of the Academy. - Awardees can offer their services as adjudicators or experts in state cultural programs such as Rajya-level Navratri festivals, Kalamahakumbh, and other events.
Gaurav Puraskar Award.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have made a significant contribution or demonstrated excellence in the fields of music, dance, drama, or folk art.

Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Ou.details: The scheme "Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Out of State" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and promote artists originally from Gujarat in the field of fine arts—such as painting, sculpture, graphic arts, and photography—by offering financial assistance to organize exhibitions abroad and outside the state. The scheme ensures support for artists with a record of conducting prior solo or group exhibitions, helping them to gain national and international exposure through structured financial aid. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy.
Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Ou.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** Up to ₹1,00,000/- for organizing exhibitions abroad. ParticularsMaximum Allowable AmountGallery rent and decoration15,000/-Transportation of artworks10,000/-Publication of catalogues or printed materials related to the exhibition₹25,000/-Framing, mounting, and display preparation of artworks₹20,000/-Inaugural ceremony, publicity, and advertisement costs₹15,000/-Artist’s accommodation, travel, food, local transport, and miscellaneous₹15,000/-
Assistance for Exhibitions Abroad and Ou.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be an artist originally from Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have organized either: - Individual Artists: Artists practicing in fields of visual arts (painting, sculpture, printmaking, etc.) who wish to participate in or organize exhibitions outside Gujarat or internationally. - Registered Art Organizations or Groups: Art societies, academies, educational institutions, or cultural organizations that promote visual arts and are organizing such exhibitions. 1. Applicants must exhibit a minimum of 30 original artworks at the exhibition for which financial assistance is being sought 1. The exhibition must be: - Outside the State (interstate exhibitions), or - Outside the Country (international exhibitions abroad), and - Must be art-related, such as showcasing paintings, sculptures, mixed media, or visual art forms.

Personality Development and Yogasan Trai.details: The scheme "Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Schedule Caste Youth" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to foster the overall development—physical, mental, and spiritual—of youth 14–35 years)belonging to the Scheduled Castes through structured yogasana and personality development programs. Each camp runs for 7 days and selects 50 beneficiaries per district from across Gujarat. The initiative serves to empower socially disadvantaged youth and enhance their self-esteem, discipline, and holistic well-being. The scheme is implemented by the District Youth Development Officers across all districts of Gujarat.
Personality Development and Yogasan Trai.benefits: - **Training:** The selected Scheduled Caste youth will receive 7 days of training focused on personality development and yogasana.
Personality Development and Yogasan Trai.eligibility: - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should be between the age of 14 to 35 years.

Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreogr.details: The scheme "Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreography & Dancing" was launched by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to promote Konkani songs by presenting them with choreography and dancing, attracting youth towards Konkani 'kantar' and improving the presentation quality of Konkani cultural performances. The scheme provides cash prizes ranging from ₹2,000/- to ₹7,000/- for winners along with mementos and certificates, and traveling allowances between ₹1,000/- to ₹2,000/- based on distance traveled by participating groups. The applicant must form a group of 6 to 10 participants and submit a recording of one selected Konkani song at the time of application. The scheme is implemented by Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreogr.benefits: ##### ***Cash Prizes for Performance*** - First Prize: ₹7,000/- plus memento and certificate. - Second Prize: ₹5,000/- plus memento and certificate. - Third Prize: ₹3,000/- plus memento and certificate. - Special Prize for Best Choreographer: ₹2,000/- plus memento and certificate. ##### ***Traveling Allowance*** - Groups traveling up to 10 kilometers radius: ₹1,000/-. - Groups traveling within 10-20 kilometers radius: ₹1,500/-. - Groups traveling 20 kilometers or more: ₹2,000/-.
Promotion of Konkani Songs with Choreogr.eligibility: - The applicant must form a group consisting of 6 to 10 participants. - The applicant must submit a recording of one selected Konkani song at the time of application. - The applicant must not perform fusion of songs as it will result in automatic disqualification. - The applicant must abide by all rules and regulations of the competition organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must accept that the decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to Mumbai/Poona and Other Parts of the Country & Vice Versa" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG), Goa, aims to compensate Goan dramatic troupes towards their transportation costs, recognizing that staging Tiatrs in Mumbai, Poona, and other parts of the country is not always financially viable. The scheme provides financial support to cover transport expenses for Goan troupes staging a minimum of five shows of the same Tiatr in Mumbai/Poona, or for Mumbai/Poona troupes staging five shows in Goa. Benefits can also be availed for only one show staged in other locations such as Kolkata, Delhi, Gujarat, Nagpur, Bangalore, or Udaipur. Applications for this scheme are accepted one month in advance of the performance date, on a 'First Come First Serve' basis, and are subject to the availability of funds.
Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to.benefits:
- The scheme provides financial support to compensate for transportation expenses incurred while staging Tiatrs, thereby promoting Goan Tiatr. - The extent of the financial support shall be fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa.
> ***Conditions*** _*The Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) may appoint a representative to witness the performance, and payments will be released based on their report._ _*A compulsory announcement stating ‘This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG)’ must be made both before the commencement of the Tiatr and again during the interval._ _*No adverse remarks must be made, either in written or verbal form, against any Governments, Individuals, Institutions, or on the basis of caste, creed, or religion within the scripts, song lyrics, performances, or speeches. If such remarks are proven, the Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) reserves the right to disqualify the performance and either withhold payment or recall any payment already made to the applicant._ _*For performances at Mandd Sobhann, Mangalore, the payment will only be made after a certificate of performance is issued by the Mandd Sobhann._
Financial Assistance to Troupes Going to.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be the writer or director of the Tiatr. 2. The applicant must stage the Tiatr as per its traditional format. 3. The applicant's Tiatr must have 6 or 7 acts (podd’dde). 4. The applicant's Tiatr must include the following - - At least 4 ‘cantos’ and comedy linked to the story of the play. - At least 10 ‘Kantaram’. 5. The applicant's 'Kantaram' must include the following - - At Least 2 Duets. - At Least 1 Duo. - At Least 1 Trio. - At Least 1 Quartet/quintet. - At Least 1 Choral Song and Solos. 6. The applicant must not have any adverse remark made in any form (written or verbal) against any Governments, Individuals, Institutions, or anything against caste, creed, and religion in the scripts, lyrics of songs, performances, speeches, etc., which may hurt the sentiments of anybody. 7. All advertisements, press notes, banners, tickets, and handbills must explicitly state that ‘This Tiatr is organized in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG)’. 8. The applicant's troupe must stage a minimum of 5 shows of the same Tiatr in Mumbai/Poona (if a Goan troupe) or 5 shows in Goa (if a Mumbai/Poona troupe) to qualify for transport support. 9. The applicant's troupe can avail benefit even if only one show is staged in other places like Kolkata, Delhi, Gujarat, Nagpur, Bangalore, Udaipur, etc. 10. The applicant can avail the scheme only twice in a financial year for two different Tiatrs.
> ***Earmarking*** 1. For performances at Mandd Sobhann at Mangalore, financial assistance is extended to two troupes from Goa. 2. Of these two Tiatrs for Mandd Sobhann, one should be from Commercial Troupes and one from a prize-winning Troupe of Goa Kala Academy ‘A’ Tiatr Competition.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. The form may also be obtained directly from the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa, requiring a physical visit to the office for collection. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 Deadline:  The submission must be made at least one month in advance of the scheduled performance date. *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment. *The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds. Post-Application Processes Step 1:   Await Performance Witnessing and Verification Upon application, the Tiatr Academy of Goa may choose to appoint and depute its own representative to witness the Tiatr performance. This representative will observe the show in Mumbai, Poona, or any other specified location and subsequently submit a report to the Tiatr Academy of Goa for review. Step 2:   Release of Financial Assistance Based on the report provided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa's representative, the financial assistance payments will be released to the concerned applicant. For Tiatrs performed at Mandd Sobhann in Mangalore, the payment will be disbursed only after a formal certificate of performance has been issued by Mandd Sobhann, Mangalore.

Promotion of Patriotism/National Integra.details: The scheme "Promotion of Patriotism/National Integration/Communal Harmony - Production of Musical Programme or Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to project patriotism, nationalism, and communal harmony through tiatrs, songs and music, addressing the need to promote these values through cultural performances and artistic expression. The scheme provides remuneration as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa to successful applicants and covers actual charges of hall/auditorium or pays a lump sum amount for performances held in makeshift pandals, along with video recording of the activity with one Digital Video Disc copy provided to the applicant. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Promotion of Patriotism/National Integra.benefits:
- Remuneration as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be provided to the applicant. - Reimbursement of actual charges of the hall/auditorium or payment of lump sum amount as fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa if performance is held in makeshift pandal. - Video recording of the activity/programme will be done by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - One copy of the Digital Video Disc will be provided to the applicant. - Maximum of 4 shows of the programme will be staged by Tiatr Academy of Goa at various places. - One banner will be provided by Tiatr Academy of Goa for compulsory display.
> ***Conditions*** - All shows must be shown to public free of charge. - Duration of the musical programme or tiatr should be not less than two hours. - In all advertisements, oral, print or electronic media, banners, the following must be inserted/published/announced: 'This programme is promoted by Tiatr Academy of Goa'. - A few seats should be reserved by the organizer(s) for the representatives of Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The Tiatr Academy of Goa banner should be compulsorily displayed at one of the two front side wings of the stage and returned after all shows. - The organizing institution/individual will have to discuss with Tiatr Academy of Goa and decide about the Chief Guest or Guest of Honour well in advance.
Promotion of Patriotism/National Integra.eligibility: - The applicant must be an individual/organization/educational institution/club. - The applicant must propose an activity that is a tiatr/musical programme on the theme of patriotism/national integration/communal harmony. - The applicant must ensure the duration of the musical programme or tiatr is not less than two hours. - The applicant must submit the application along with typed script/lyrics at least 30 days before the date of staging the programme. - The applicant must attach No Objection Certificate from the lyricist/writer/director concerned if they are not the lyricist/writer/director of the proposed activity. - The applicant must ensure scripts/lyrics do not contain any adverse remarks against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or anything against caste, creed and religion.

Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kanta.details: The scheme "Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kantaram)" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage producers, lyricists, singers, and musicians who invest significant amounts of money to produce Konkani Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums of Konkani Tiatr songs, with the ultimate goal of encouraging qualitative album production to enrich Konkani 'kantar'. The scheme provides cash awards ranging from ₹5,000/- to ₹30,000/- across twelve different categories including solo singers, group performances, lyricists, music composers, and best album awards, with specific requirements for interactive lyrics in group categories and minimum composition requirements for album eligibility.
Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kanta.benefits: - Male singer of the year (Solo): ₹10,000/- - Female singer of the year (Solo): ₹10,000/- - Child Male Singer of the year (Solo): ₹5,000/- - Child Female Singer of the year (Solo): ₹5,000/- - Duet of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹10,000/- - Duo of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹10,000/- - Trio of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹15,000/- - Quartet of the year (Nature of lyrics should be interactive): ₹20,000/- - Choral Song of the year: ₹20,000/- - Lyricist of the year: ₹10,000/- - Music composer of the year: ₹10,000/- - Best Konkani kantaram audio album of the year: ₹30,000/- ****Awards are presented every year by Tiatr Academy of Goa.***
Konkani Song & Music Awards (Tiatr Kanta.eligibility: - The applicant must produce Konkani Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums between 1st January and 31st December of the year identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must ensure the music director is compulsorily a Goan or of Goan origin. - The applicant must ensure singers in the Album are Goans whose mother tongue is Konkani. - The applicant must ensure the Album contains songs only in Konkani language and not in other languages like English, Hindi, Portuguese etc. - The applicant must ensure the songs in the Album are not old songs or remix of old songs. - The applicant must ensure the Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums consists of minimum 8 Konkani kantaram. - The applicant must ensure there are no adverse remarks in any form against any Governments/Individuals/Institutions or against caste, creed and religion in the lyrics of songs/performances/speeches. ***Competition Requirements*** - The applicant must ensure there are minimum three entries in each category to participate in that particular category competition. - The applicant must ensure for Best Album award, the album has at least 5 kantaram from specified categories: one solo, one duet (interactive lyrics), one duo (interactive lyrics), one trio (interactive lyrics), one quartet/quintet (interactive lyrics), one choral song. ***Child Singer Category*** - The applicant must ensure child singers have not completed 16 years of age on or before 31st December of the year identified by Tiatr Academy of Goa.

Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment. Selection Process & Award Announcement Step 1:  The submitted Audio Compact Disc/Video Compact Disc/Digital Versatile Disc/Digital Albums will be judged by a Panel of Judges comprising eminent personalities experienced in song and music selected by Tiatr Academy of Goa. Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Compensation.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Compensation Towards Natural Calamities" component of the scheme aims to financially assist the Goan artists to meet expenses towards repair or construction of their houses damaged due to natural calamities. The maximum financial assistance provided under this component is ₹25,000/- or the valuation done by the concerned Taluka Mamlatdar, whichever is less. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Art & Culture. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Compensation.benefits: - Financial assistance shall be provided to meet expenses towards the repair or construction of a house damaged due to natural calamities. - The quantum of financial assistance shall be a maximum of ₹25,000/- or as per the valuation done by the concerned Taluka Mamlatdar, whichever is less.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Compensation.eligibility: - The applicant must be a Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. - The applicant must be recognized as an artist by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The income of the family of the applicant (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. - The artist must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) - The applicant must be in need of funds to meet expenses towards repair or construction of their house damaged due to natural calamities.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Compensation.exclusions: The applicant already claiming the benefit from any other sources for the same purpose is not eligible.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the  Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly. The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee. Step 2:  The sub-committee shall consider the received applications and recommend the names of the artists which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme. The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released to the needy artist. Step 3:  After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance. Step 4:  After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account.

Training Classes In Veda/Devaram.details: The scheme "Training Classes in Veda/Devaram" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The scheme offers specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham. These subjects are required for divine worship/Poojas. The classes are conducted in various Saivaite and Vainavaite temples in the Puducherry region to provide instruction to eligible candidates. The instructing pandits (teachers) are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. Applications are collected by receiving them from some of the important temples of the Puducherry region.
Training Classes In Veda/Devaram.benefits: - Provision of training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham, which are required for divine worship/Poojas. - Instructing pandits are provided an honorarium of ₹1,000/- per month. - The honorarium is given once every three months. - The honorarium is disbursed upon the pandits furnishing attendance particulars of the students who attended the Veda classes.
Training Classes In Veda/Devaram.eligibility: - The applicant must be an eligible candidate to receive the training. - The applicant must be a resident of Puducherry. - The applicant must know how to read, write, and speak Tamil fluently. - The applicant must be interested in receiving specialized training classes in Veda, Devaram, and Nalayira Divya Prabantham.

Financial Assistance to the Family of Te.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to the Family of Temple Employees" was launched by the Hindu Religious Institutions and Wakf Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. The scheme aims to grant financial assistance to the family of the temple employee who expires while in service. The scheme provides an amount of ₹5,000/- under the Group Insurance Scheme and an amount of ₹20,000/- under the Chief Minister’s Welfare Fund. The applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Financial Assistance to the Family of Te.benefits: **Financial Benefit:** An amount of ₹5,000/- is granted under the Group Insurance Scheme. **Financial Benefit:** An amount of ₹20,000/- is granted under the Chief Minister’s Welfare Fund. **Intended Use of Benefit:** The amounts are granted to the family of the temple employee who expire while in service.
Financial Assistance to the Family of Te.eligibility: - The applicant must be a family member of the deceased employee of the temple. - The temple employee must have died while in service.

Assistance for Purchase of Traditional M.details: The "Assistance for Purchase of Traditional Musical Instruments and Costumes for Scheduled Caste/Tribe Individuals" scheme was launched by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support scheduled caste and scheduled tribe individuals whose livelihood depends on traditional arts by providing them with essential musical instruments and costumes.
Assistance for Purchase of Traditional M.benefits: - Persons belonging to the Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes, whose source of income is through their traditional art, and who do not possess musical instruments or costumes, are provided with traditional musical instruments (such as Dhol, Damaun, Masakbeen, Ransingha, Trumpet, Nagada, Shield, Sword, etc.) and costumes free of cost to help them sustain their livelihood. - The instruments are provided only once in a lifetime.
Assistance for Purchase of Traditional M.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a folk artist. 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community. 1. The applicant's monthly income must not exceed ₹2,000/-. 1. Only one set of musical instruments is provided per artist in a family under this scheme.

application process.process: The Directorate of Culture publishes an advertisement for providing traditional musical instruments and costumes to eligible SC/ST individuals. Following the advertisement, the concerned individuals are required to submit to the Director of the Culture Directorate a certificate of monthly income of ₹2,000/- issued by the Tehsildar, a certificate of artist/instrument, Aadhaar card, caste certificate, bank account details including account number and IFSC code, PAN card, permanent residence certificate, and an affidavit stating that the beneficiary has not received any grant under other schemes. Eligible beneficiaries are selected by a committee constituted under the chairmanship of the Secretary of Culture at the Directorate level. After the selection process, beneficiaries can collect the musical instruments from the Directorate.

Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons.details: The scheme “Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons in State Services” was launched by the Department of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide job opportunities to medal-winning sportspersons of Uttarakhand, who have represented the state in international and national games, by offering them out-of-turn employment in various state services.
Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons.benefits: Under this scheme, medal-winning players from Uttarakhand who have represented the state in International or National Games are provided out-of-turn employment on Gazetted and Non-Gazetted posts (from Level-3 to Level-10) across various government departments.
Out of Turn Employment to Sportspersons.eligibility: 1. State players/sportspersons who have won gold, silver, or bronze medals in international or national games, such as the Olympic/Paralympic Games, World Cup/World Championship, Asian Games, Commonwealth Games, Asian Championship, Commonwealth Championship, SAF Games, and National Games, are eligible under the scheme. 1. Players/sportspersons participating in any of the following sports will be considered eligible: Athletics, Archery, Badminton, Basketball, Boxing, Canoeing & Kayaking, Cycling, Diving, Equestrian, Fencing, Football, Golf, Handball, Hockey, Judo, Lawn Tennis, Shooting, Rowing, Sailing, Swimming, Table Tennis, Taekwondo, Volleyball, Weightlifting, Wrestling, Baseball, Chess, Cricket, Kabaddi, Karate, Kho-Kho, and Mallakhamb. 1. The player/sportsperson must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The player/sportsperson must have represented the state of Uttarakhand in the National Games in the year and competition for which they are applying for employment.

application process.process: As outlined in Government Order No. 728/VI-3/2023-33(7)2014, dated 14.09.2023, the Sports Directorate will receive vacancy details from the relevant departments and publish advertisements in newspapers to recruit eligible athletes. Upon receiving applications directly from the Director, Sports Directorate, the committee will review the applications and submit its recommendations within two months. The Sports Department will forward the committee’s recommendations to the respective departments. Selected medal-winning athletes will be appointed to supernumerary positions by the relevant department within four months. For employment, athletes must possess the minimum educational qualifications required for the position. However, the committee may consider granting exemptions or relaxations for medal-winning athletes regarding mandatory or preferred qualifications. If a medal winner does not possess the required educational qualifications at the time of appointment, the department will allow the athlete up to four years to acquire the necessary qualifications. Medal-winning athletes must submit their applications to the sports offices within two years (for seniors) and three years (for juniors) after achieving their success. Applications must include the completed form along with the medal-winning certificates, Aadhaar card, and permanent residence certificate. Medal-winning athletes from 10 years ago and 5 years ago will be eligible to apply within 12 months from the date of issuance of this Government Order.

Financial Assistance for Encouraging Wor.details: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Encouraging Worker&#39;s Children&#39;s Participation in Sports Activities” is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board to the children of the workers working in the industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for participating in sports competitions so that the children of the workers can also become good sportspersons.
Financial Assistance for Encouraging Wor.benefits:
Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided as per the following table to the children of workers for participating in sports competitions:
Sl. No. Sports CompetitionDistrict-level competition amountDivision-level competition amountState-level competition amountNational-level competition amountInternational-level competition amount1On participation in group sports competition₹2,000/-₹3,000/-₹4,000/-₹5,000/-₹11,000/-21st, 2nd &amp;amp;amp; 3rd place in a group sports competition₹2,000/-₹3,000/-₹4,000/-₹5,000/-₹21,000/-3On participation in individual sports competition₹3,000/-₹5,000/-₹7,000/-₹9,000/-₹21,000/-41st, 2nd &amp;amp;amp; 3rd place in individual sports competition₹3,000/-₹5,000/-₹7,000/-₹9,000/-₹31,000/-
Financial Assistance for Encouraging Wor.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
   1. The applicant should be registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board.
   1. The applicant&#39;s monthly salary should not exceed ₹25,000/-.
   1. Benefits are provided to children of registered workers for participating in group or individual sports competitions, and for securing 1st, 2nd, or 3rd place in these competitions.
   1. There is no limit on the number of workers&#39; children eligible under this scheme.
   1. There is no minimum service period requirement for the worker.

**Note:** Application must be submitted within one year of the date of issuance of the certificate of participation in sports activities.

Silpi Pension Scheme - Assam.details:
Silpi Pension Scheme is a Welfare Scheme provided by the Government of Assam to support the Artists of Assam. Artiste/Family pension along with Barxik Silpi Sanman (One-time financial assistance) of the Govt. of Assam will be offered to the person having outstanding contributions in the field of Art and Culture in the State and Special Family Pension will also be offered to indigent families of Artistes who had made a spectacular contribution in the State’s Cultural sphere and have unfortunately passed away. There are 4 types of Schemes under the Silpi Pension Scheme:
1. Artist Pension Scheme 2. Family Pension Scheme 3. Barxik Silpi Sanman (Ex-Gratia Grant) Scheme 4. One-time Special Financial Assistance to Families of deceased artist Scheme
The main objective of the Scheme is to support the artist and needy families of Artists who made contributions to the field of Art and Culture in the State of Assam. It also aims to provide Financial assistance to the artist and their families in different schemes. It provides pensions to families and artists monthly for better livelihood and gives recognition to the Art and Culture of Assam through this platform. The financial assistance schemes are expected to encourage artists and technicians to engage in their creative pursuits with renewed vigour.
For Divyang and Bed-ridden artists, the Cultural Development Officers or the Junior Assistants of Cultural Centres under the Directorate of Cultural Affairs from their respective districts will visit the homes of those applicants for applying through an online process. The names and contact numbers of concerned Cultural Development Officers/Junior Assistants will be available on the official website.
Silpi Pension Scheme - Assam.benefits: Under the Artist Pension Scheme, the beneficiary will receive an amount of ₹8,000/- (per month). Under the Family Pension Scheme, the beneficiary will receive an amount of ₹4,000/- (per month). Under the Barxik Silpi Sanman (Ex-Gratia Grant), the beneficiary will receive an amount of ₹50,000/- (One time). Under the One-time special financial assistance to families of deceased Artist Scheme, the beneficiary will receive an amount of ₹50,000/- (One time).
Silpi Pension Scheme - Assam.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a permanent resident of the State of Assam.
- An artist, who has made outstanding contributions in the field of Music, Dance, Fine Arts, Puppetry, Musk making, and also covering artists and technicians associated with Mobile Theatre and Amateur Theatre and Films, is eligible under this scheme.
- Indigent families of artists who have made outstanding contributions in the field of Music, Dance, Fine Arts, Puppetry, Musk making, etc. are eligible under this scheme.
- The applicant must have a recognition proof certificate.

Khiladi Protsahan Yojana.details: The Khilaadee Protsaahan Yojana, a scheme of the Madhya Pradesh Building Department under the Labor Department, provides financial assistance to registered construction workers or their family members under the MP Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board who have excelled in sports.
Khiladi Protsahan Yojana.benefits: - On selection at various levels, incentive amount is payable as follows:- Levels(Category – A) Incentive amount on getting selected in district/divisional/state level sports.(Category – B) Incentive amount given by the Board for being winner in District/Divisional/State level game.At District Level₹10,000/-₹5,000/-At Division Level₹25,000/-₹15,000/-At State Level₹25,000/-₹30,000/-
Khiladi Protsahan Yojana.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Madhya Pradesh.

Marriage Assistance - Folk Artist.details: The scheme "Marriage Assistance" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. This scheme provides financial assistance of ₹2,000/- for the marriage of registered folk artists, or their son or daughter. The assistance aims to support the cultural community by helping with marriage expenses.
Marriage Assistance - Folk Artist.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a registered folk artist.
1. The registered folk artist must have no dues payable to the Board.
1. The registered folk artist can apply for financial assistance for their marriage or adult children (son or daughter). 
1. The registered folk artist and the person getting married must attain the age prescribed by law for marriage. 
1. If both husband and wife are registered folk artists, only one of them is eligible for this assistance per marriage.
1. The family of a registered folk artiste can avail of this assistance only twice.

Financial Assistance for Encouraging Wor.details: The scheme “Financial Assistance for Encouraging Worker&#39;s Children&#39;s Participation in Cultural Activities” is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board to the children of the workers working in the industrial and commercial establishments of the state of Haryana for participating in cultural competitions so that the children of the workers can also become good artists.
Financial Assistance for Encouraging Wor.benefits:
Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided as per the following table to the children of the workers for participating in cultural competitions:
**Sl. No.****Cultural competitions****District-level competition amount****Division-level competition amount****State-level competition amount****National-level competition amount****International-level competition amount**1On participating in group cultural competitions such as dance, music, etc.₹2,000/-₹3,000/-₹4,000/-₹5,000/-₹11,000/-2On securing 1st, 2nd and 3rd position in group cultural competitions such as dance, music, etc.₹2,000/-₹3,000/-₹4,000/-₹5,000/-₹21,000/-3On participating in solo cultural competitions such as dance, music, etc.₹3,000/-₹5,000/-₹7,000/-₹9,000/-₹21,000/-4On securing 1st, 2nd and 3rd position in solo dance competition₹3,000/-₹5,000/-₹7,000/-₹9,000/-₹31,000/-
Financial Assistance for Encouraging Wor.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
   1. The applicant should be registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board.
   1. The applicant&#39;s monthly salary should not exceed ₹25,000/-.
   1. Benefits are provided to children of registered workers for participating in group or solo cultural competitions, and also for securing 1st, 2nd, or 3rd position in these competitions.
   1. There is no limit on the number of workers&#39; children eligible under this scheme.

Scheme for Giving Financial Assistance t.details: The "Scheme for Giving Financial Assistance to the Legal Heirs of the Deceased Artist (Wife/Husband) on the Death of the Indigent Artist who was Receiving Financial Assistance" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. Through this scheme, financial assistance of ₹3,000/- is given to the eligible legal heir (wife/husband) of the deceased artist.
Scheme for Giving Financial Assistance t.eligibility:
- The applicant should be the legal heir (wife/husband) of the deceased.
- The deceased should have been an artist.
- The deceased should have been receiving financial assistance through the scheme " Scheme of Financial Assistance to Indigent Artistes" by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu.
- The deceased should have been 58 years or older.
- The benefit of the scheme will be given only on the death of the indigent artist. 
- The deceased should have professionally served for the enrichment of any one of the art disciplines or more such as music, dance, drama, film, folk arts, etc.
- The annual income of the deceased artist or their legal spouse should not have exceeded ₹12,000/-.

Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Financial Ass.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Financial Assistance for Funeral of the Artist" component of the scheme aims to provide financial relief to the families of deceased Goan artists by assisting them in meeting funeral expenses, thereby acknowledging the contributions of artists and supporting their families during difficult times. The component provides financial assistance of up to ₹10,000/- to cover expenses related to the funeral of a recognized Goan artist. The applicant must be a family member of the deceased artist. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Financial Ass.benefits: - Financial assistance of up to a maximum of ₹10,000/- shall be sanctioned to meet expenses in connection with the funeral of the Goan artist. - The benefit is provided as a one-time lump sum grant. - The financial assistance amount shall be disbursed to the eligible member of artist's family in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Financial Ass.eligibility: - The applicant must be a family member of the deceased artist. - The deceased artist must have been born and brought up in Goa. - The deceased artist must have been recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The family income of the deceased artist (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. - The applicant must not have claimed or received funeral assistance benefits from any other government source for the same purpose.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the  Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly. The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee. Step 2:  The sub-committee shall consider the received applications and recommend the names which are considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme. The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released. Step 3:  After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance. Step 4:  After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account.

Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Lumpsum Grant.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Lumpsum Grant" component of the scheme aims to provide a lumpsum grant (maximum ₹20,000/-) to the dependent family in case of death of the artist. The one-time financial assistance amount is disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) mode. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Lumpsum Grant.benefits: - Financial Assistance in the form of a lumpsum grant, maximum of ₹20,000/- shall be provided. - The one-time financial assistance amount is disbursed to the eligible applicant in the form of Electronic Clearing Service (ECS) mode. > ***Conditions*** - The wife/husband of the late artist shall be considered first for the grant. - In the event of the wife/husband predeceasing the late artist, the benefit shall be passed on to the unmarried/unemployed sons/daughters of the deceased artist as the case may be in equal ratio.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Lumpsum Grant.eligibility: - The deceased artist must have been Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. - The deceased artist must have been recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The deceased artist must not have been less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) - The applicant must be the dependent family member of the deceased artist. - The wife/husband of the late artist shall be considered first for the grant. - In the event of the wife/husband predeceasing the late artist, the benefit shall be passed on to the unmarried/unemployed sons/daughters of the deceased artist as the case may be in equal ratio. - The annual income of the family of the deceased artist (from all the sources) must be less than ₹25,000/- per annum.

Scheme Of Financial Assistance For The P.details:
The scheme “Scheme of Financial Assistance for the Preservation and Development of Cultural Heritage of the Himalayas” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India. The objective of the scheme is to promote, protect and preserve the cultural heritage of the Himalayan region spreading in UT of Jammu &amp; Kashmir, UT of Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttrakhand, Sikkim, and Arunachal Pradesh through research, documentation, dissemination, etc.
**Mode of and Conditions for Release of Grants:**

  - The grant shall be given based on the appraisal of applications and recommendations by the Expert Advisory Committee and thereafter administrative approval and financial concurrence of competent authorities in the Ministry of Culture.
  - The grants will be paid in two equal installments, the first being normally released with the approval of the project. The second installment will be released on completion of the project and on receipt of duly audited statement of accounts showing the utilization of the entire amount of grant plus the share of the grantee/concerned State/U.T. Government and other documents. The release of the balance of the grant will be decided on the basis of the actual expenditure incurred on the project subject to the maximum limit.
  - An organization in receipt of financial assistance under the scheme shall be open to inspection by an officer of the Ministry of Culture, Government of India, or the State Government concerned.
  - The accounts of the project shall be maintained properly and separately and submitted to the Government of India as and when required and will be subject to check by an officer of the Central Government or the State Government or by the Comptroller and Auditor General of India at his discretion.
  - The organization shall maintain a record of all assets acquired wholly or substantially out of the Central Government grant and shall not dispose of or encumber or utilize for purposes other than those for which the grant was given without prior approval of the Government of India.
  - If at any time, the Government of India has reason to believe that the sanctioned money is not being utilized for approved purposes, the payment of the grant may be stopped and the earlier grants recovered.
  - The organization must exercise reasonable economy in the working of the approved project.
  - The grantee organization shall furnish to the Ministry of Culture a quarterly progress report of the project indicating in detail both the physical achievements and the expenditure incurred on each of the approved items separately.
  - The grantee shall submit three copies of the Project Report duly bound/Audio-Video CDs/Photographs to the Ministry of Culture and one copy to the State Government where the project has been undertaken.
  - Applications of the organizations against which the previous grant/ Utilisation certificate is pending will not be considered.

**Mode of Payment:** All payments will be made through electronic transfers.
**Special Provision:**
The Expert Advisory Committee (EAC) on the scheme is empowered to recommend or reject any proposal received without or with the recommendation of State Government/U.T. administration/ Local Administration and also to recommend the amount beyond the maximum limit but not exceeding ₹30.00 lacs from this scheme, in respect of any proposal which is of outstanding merit for which the EAC feels that the maximum limit would not be sufficient for undertaking the said project, with the approval of Minister (Culture) and concurrence of AS &amp; FA, Ministry of Culture.
**Inspection & Monitoring:**
Inspection would be carried out by Ministry officials every year at least in 5% of the cases. The concerned State Govt., District Collector/Dy. Commissioner will also monitor.
**Penalties in case of Misutilisation of grants:**
The members of the executive body of the organization would be liable for the recovery of misused grants. The organization will also be blacklisted for misuse of funds, fake registration certificate, etc. All immovable assets created from the Government grants would be taken over by local administration prescribed by the Ministry of Culture.
Scheme Of Financial Assistance For The P.benefits:
The financial assistance is given for any of the items listed below up to a maximum of ₹10.00 lakhs to any single organization:
**Sl. No.****Items****Maximum amount per annum**1Study and research on cultural heritage               ₹10.00 lakhs
2Preservation of old manuscripts, literature, art &amp;amp;amp; crafts, and documentation of cultural activities/ events like music, dance, etc.               ₹10.00 lakhs
3Dissemination through audio-visual programmes of art and culture               ₹10.00 lakhs
4Training in Traditional and Folk Art               ₹10.00 lakhs
**Note 01:** The maximum grant admissible to an organization would be 75% of the total expenditure to be incurred on any item subject to the maximum ceiling fixed. The remaining 25% expenditure or more should be met by the State Govt./U.T.
**Note 02:** Administration failing which the grantee organization could contribute the amount from their own resources. However, in the case of Arunachal Pradesh and Sikkim, funding will be shared between the Government of India and the organization in the ratio of 90:10 respectively.
Scheme Of Financial Assistance For The P.eligibility:
1. The voluntary organization should be registered as a society under the Societies Registration Act 1860 or as a public trust under Indian Trust Act, 1882, and shall have been functioning for a period of three years.
   1. Colleges and Universities are also eligible to apply.
   1. The organization should have the capacity to undertake and promote research projects. It should have facilities, resources, and personnel to implement the scheme for which the grant is required.
   1. A college applying for the grant should be affiliated with the University.
   1. Grants from this scheme will be given only to those organizations which are not in receipt of grants from any other source for similar purposes.

**Note 01:** The Colleges and Universities should introduce in their curriculum or research course aspects of studies relating to the preservation of Himalayan art and culture, in case not already done.
**Note 02:** The grants will be ad-hoc and of non-recurring nature.
**Note 03:** Organizations that are doing good work in the field and have resources for meeting matching funds will be given preference.

Goa State Best Library and Best Libraria.details:
The scheme "Goa State Best Library and Best Librarian Award" has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa envisaging grant of awards for one meritorious Library and one Librarian serving either in any Government or Government–aided Libraries in the State of Goa, which include the Public/Academic/Special/Research Libraries every year.
> **Objective** To recognize the hard work put in by the management of the Libraries and the Librarians and to give an impetus and encouragement to them by conferring awards on them for their contribution in the field of library movement.
Goa State Best Library and Best Libraria.benefits:
> **Nature and Quantum of Assistance**
**Goa State Best Library Award** A cash prize of ₹ 50,000/-, a Memento, a Citation and a Certificate.
**Goa State Best Librarian Award** A cash prize of ₹ 25,000/-, a Memento, a Citation and a Certificate.
> **Number of Awards** Every year one Library and one Librarian will be selected for the award.
Goa State Best Library and Best Libraria.eligibility:
> **For Library** 1. The library should be in existence for a minimum period of 15 years. 1. The library should have a minimum of 100 registered members for the last 5 years. 1. The library should have in possession a minimum of 2500 books, periodicals etc., in readable condition. 1. The library should have a proper infrastructure with retrieval facilities. 1. The library should be spacious, having a minimum area of 40 sq. mts. and with proper ventilation. 1. The library should have conducted regular programmes etc. for the members/public to enhance 1. their reading habits and knowledge. 1. The library should have maintained all the library records properly and up to date. 1. The award shall be conferred to only one well-stacked library from the State of Goa.
> **For Librarian** 1. The Librarian should be born in the State of Goa or should be a resident of the State of Goa for a minimum period of 15 years. 1. The Librarian should have a minimum of 10 years of continuous service as a Librarian/Section-In-Charge of a reputed library from the State of Goa. 1. The Librarian should have taken up initiatives for library development/inculcating reading culture in his/her area of work. 1. The award shall not be conferred posthumously. However, in the event of death of the individual after recommendation of his/her name for the award by the Award Committee, the award shall be conferred posthumously. Further, any illustrious service of any individual in the field of library movement shall also be recognized and considered for the award not beyond one year of death or retirement of the individual. 1. The award shall be conferred on one meritorious librarian i.e. serving in any Government, Government-aided Libraries in the State of Goa which include the Public/Academic/Special/Research Libraries etc.
**NOTE:** In the event of no suitable person of the desired standard being found, no award shall be conferred for that year.
Goa State Best Library and Best Libraria.exclusions: **The award shall not be conferred posthumously.** However, in the event of death of the individual after recommendation of his/her name for the award by the Award Committee, the award shall be conferred posthumously. Further, any illustrious service of any individual in the field of library movement shall also be recognized and considered for the award not beyond one year of death or retirement of the individual.

Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhu.details:
The “Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhumi of Goa” has been designed by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa with the objective of encouraging the festival theatre of Goa which is known as “Gomantakiya Utsavi Rangabhumi”. This form of theatre has an illustrious tradition of presenting plays during festivals in the villages. Most of the renowned actors of this motherland have a history of performing their first character role on Utsavi Rangabhumi, wherein more than 1000 plays were performed on the occasion of village deities’ festivals all over Goa. The financial support and motivation from the government through this scheme could bring the festive theatre to its original glory.
<br>

> **Objectives**


   1. To revive and preserve the festive theatre of Goan villages. 
   1. To encourage local village groups to restart the Houshi Ranghabhumi theatre movement by providing necessary support for the revival of sangeet natak. (Musical plays) performances and prose plays. 
   1. To encourage local female artists and child artists to participate in these plays. 
   1. To encourage amateur artists and to bring discipline to traditional festive theatre. 
   1. To encourage new playwrights, directors, set designers and other stage technicians. 
   1. To create a bonding of unity and brotherhood through the medium of theatre in the villages.
Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhu.benefits:
> **Nature and Quantum of Assistance** 1. Financial assistance for the production of prose play will be a maximum of ₹ 20,000/- or 75% of the actual cost, whichever is less. However, the same could be decided by the selection committee from time to time depending upon the type of the play. 1. Financial assistance for the production of the Sangeet play will be a maximum of ₹ 30,000/- or 75% of the actual cost, whichever is less. However, the selection committee may suggest the quantum from time to time. 1. The department may identify a few groups for providing directional support. In this case, fees of the directors and technical experts, including the duration of short-term production workshops will be decided by the Government from time to time. Undertaking in this regard from the concerned devasthan/traditional village institution/village committee shall be required to be submitted. 1. The selection committee may recommend an amount of ₹ 3,000/- to the scriptwriter for his new script if desired, based on the quality of the play.
[**NOTE:** The village theatre groups could apply for financial assistance towards prose as well for sangeet natak. However, no group will get financial assistance for more than one play per year]
Scheme for Upliftment of Utsavi Rangabhu.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be traditional village festive theatre groups/amateur theatre groups. 
1. The group should have traditions of performing their plays during the village deity festival through devasthan or village institutions. 
1. There has to be a tradition of performing the plays at least for 25 years.
1. The theatre group has to perform all the roles including that of the female in the drama from the same village. No professional artist will be allowed.
1. Traditional theatre group from the same village has to perform the play as the tradition may be and the devasthan or village committee may certify the same.
1. There should be a Bank Account of the group in the Nationalized/ Scheduled Bank in order to release payment.

Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Ar.details: The "Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Art Exhibitions: Group Shows" was launched by the Art and Culture Department, Government of Tamil Nadu. The scheme aims to encourage talented artists in the field of painting, and sculpture by granting a sum of ₹50,000/- to the groups of five artists for conducting "Group Shows" art exhibitions. The applications are accepted offline in the prescribed form available at the Oviya Nunkalai Kuzhu.
Scheme of Grant-In-Aid for Conduct of Ar.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a group of artists.


1. The artists should be natives of Tamil Nadu by continuous residence for not less than 5 years.
1. The artists should have continuous involvement in their field of painting and sculpture.
1. The artists should possess an adequate number of artworks for the conduct of their show.
1. Participation in National or State level Art Exhibitions and Artists Camps will be considered as an additional qualification.

The Tripura Tribal Folk Arts & Cultural.details: The "Tripura Tribal Folk Arts & Cultural (Financial Assistance) Scheme, 2022" was launched by the Tribal Welfare Department, Government of Tripura. The scheme aims to to provide financial assistance to the government and non-government organizations to promote & preserve the traditional culture programme, exhibition in different tribal communities, folk song, dance, occasion, organizing Mela, Festivals and observance of major tribal festivals etc.
The Tripura Tribal Folk Arts & Cultural.benefits:
> **Government-Level Events:** - Financial assistance for State, District, Sub-Division, and block-level festivals/melas up to a maximum of 15% above the previous year's expenditure.
> **Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) Events:** - Financial assistance for State Level Festivals and Melas up to 10% of the previous year's expenditure. - New applications can receive a maximum of ₹30,000/- for organizing festivals, melas, or related activities.
The Tripura Tribal Folk Arts & Cultural.eligibility: 1. The persons and organizations belonging to Scheduled Tribes. 1. Both governmental and non-governmental organizations are eligible if they are involved in promoting and preserving tribal culture. 1. The governmental and non-governmental organizations should cover any Festivals, Melas/ Musical Instrument/occasions any community programmes.

Financial Grant for Sports Associations.details: The scheme "Financial Grant for Sports Associations" by the Tourism, Art-Culture, Sports, and Youth Affairs Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to support recognized sports associations in organizing and promoting various sports activities in the state. Under this scheme, financial grants are provided to sports associations that meet the eligibility criteria to conduct training camps, host competitions, and encourage sports development.
Financial Grant for Sports Associations.benefits:
- Financial grants are provided to recognized state-level sports associations for organizing sports competitions and training camps. - Assistance is offered for conducting training camps before national-level competitions for selected players.
**NOTE:** - The grant includes coverage for competition organization costs, training camp expenses, and administrative support. - The funds are disbursed based on the recommendations of the committee constituted under Jharkhand Sports Policy 2022.
Financial Grant for Sports Associations.eligibility: 1. The association should be a recognized state sports association registered under the Jharkhand State Registration Department. 1. The association must be affiliated with the Jharkhand Olympic Association and the relevant National Sports Federation. 1. The association association should have district-level units functioning in at least 18 districts of the state. 1. Para-sports associations or associations related to sports included in the Olympics, Asian Games, or Commonwealth Games are eligible. Associations for other sports require at least 15 affiliated districts.
Financial Grant for Sports Associations.exclusions:
- Associations operated by individuals or private groups are not eligible.
- If two or more associations apply for the same sport, only the association recognized by the Jharkhand Olympic Association and National Federation will be considered.

Assistance to Trusts/Institutions for Se.details: The scheme "Assistance to Trusts/Institutions for Setting Up Cultural Centers/Auditoriums in the Municipal Area" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to strengthen cultural development and encourage the preservation and promotion of arts and heritage by supporting the creation and improvement of cultural infrastructure in urban regions. Under this initiative, eligible trusts and institutions are provided financial assistance either for constructing new cultural centres or for renovating existing ones. The scheme is implemented by the Sangeet Natak Academy, Gujarat.
Assistance to Trusts/Institutions for Se.benefits: - **Assistance for New Construction:** 50% of the total cost or ₹30,00,000/- whichever is lower. - **Assistance for Renovation:** Up to ₹15,00,000/-.
Assistance to Trusts/Institutions for Se.eligibility: - A trust or institution operating within the municipal areas of Gujarat shall be eligible for this scheme.
